Name: A. L. TYLER
Description: Mining and rise in real estate.

Name: HENRY F. DE BARDELEBEN
Description: Chiefly in coal and iron properties. He has a large amount of property and is engaged in several large industrial enterprises in coal, iron and land. He is the controlling owner in the De Bardeleben Coal and Iron Company.

Name: DR. HENRY M. CALDWELL
Description: Chiefly real estate and lumber. He is president of Elyton Land Company, and Birmingham Trust and Savings Company.

Name: W. A. WALKER
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: T. T. HILLMAN
Description: Iron manufacturing.

Name: JOHN T. MILNER
Description: Pine and coal lands.

Name: ROBERT B. KYLE
Description: Sawmills and real estate.

Name: JOSIAH MORRIS
Description: Private banking and real-estate speculation in Birmingham. He organized the Elyton Land Company and is its largest stockholder. The company has been a great success on account of the founding of the city and its subsequent growth.

Name: J. B. HAGGIN
Description: Stock farm; Anaconda copper mine, and real estate.

Name: JOHN BIDWELL
Description: Surveying, ranches, and fruit growing.

Name: DR. HUGH GLENN
Description: Wheat-farming on a large scale, and lands.

Name: RICHARD GIRD
Description: Ranches and farming.

Name: Dr. JAMES P. GREVES
Description: Iron and copper mining in Lake Superior region; silver mines in Nevada, and lands in California.

Name: HARRIS NEWMARK
Description: Dealing in wool and hides.

Name: H. W. HELLMAN
Description: Wholesale groceries and liquors.

Name: KASPAR KOHN
Description: Dealing in wool and hides.

Name: MRS. R. S. BAKER
Description: From her first husband, Don Abel Stearns. Made in city real estate and stock-raising. Owner in vast cattle and grain ranches.

Name: COLONEL R. S. BAKER
Description: Cattle raising and real estate. He has great cattle and grain ranches and valuable city real estate.

Name: MAJOR GEORGE H. BONEBRAKE
Description: Real estate and banking. President of the Los Angeles National Bank and of the State Loan and Trust Company.

Name: D. FREEMAN
Description: Farming on a large scale and real estate.

Name: L. PHILLIPS
Description: Farming on a large scale and real estate.

Name: E. F. SPENCE
Description: Banking and real estate. President of the First National Bank and of the Savings Bank of Southern California.

Name: J. B. LANKERSHIM
Description: Real estate and banking. President of the Main Street Savings Bank and Trust Company.

Name: ISAIAS W. HELLMAN
Description: Banking and real estate. President of the Farmers' and Merchants' Bank.

Name: L. L. BRADBURY
Description: Reputed to be the richest man in Southern California. California mines; stocks and real estate in Oakland and Southern California.

Name: JOHN S. VOSBURG
Description: Arizona mines and Southern California real estate.

Name: L. J. ROSE
Description: Fruit raising, wine-making and lands. He sold his famous “Sunny Slope” fruit ranch in San Gabriel Valley during the boom of 1887 to an English syndicate for over a million dollars.

Name: Mrs. CATHERINE GARCELO
Description: She was a sister of Dr. Samuel Merritt, a Forty-Niner, who left her $3,000,000. Made in hotel business, real estate, and loans.

Name: GEORGE W. GRAYSON (of Grayson, Owens & Co.)
Description: Silver mines, wine dealing; but chiefly lands and cattle; and sale of meat.

Name: HORACE H. SEATON
Description: Merchandising and trade.

Name: J. C. AINSWORTH
Description: Steamboating on the Columbia and Willamette rivers in partnership with R. R. Thompson and S. G. Reed; real estate in Portland, Ore., and in the State of Washington, and banking.

Name: EDGAR MILLS
Description: President of D. O. Mills & Co.'s bank; banking and real estate.

Name: MRS. MARGARET B. CROCKER (widow of Judge E. B. Crocker)
Description: Made in Central Pacific Railroad.

Name: NEWTON BOOTH
Description: Wholesale importation of groceries and dealing in the same. He is still a member of the old firm of Booth & Co., wholesale grocers.

Name: A. COOLUT
Description: Importing tobacco, cigars, ammunition and notions, in part. His wealth came largely, however, from the Central Pacific Railroad, of which he was an original stockholder.

Name: WILLIAM LAND
Description: Hotel business and loans.

Name: FREDERICK COX (of Cox & Clark)
Description: Cattle-raising and land.

Name: C. W. CLARK (of Cox & Clark)
Description: Cattle-raising and land.

Name: JEFFERSON WILCOXSON
Description: Dealing in cattle and sheep; real estate, loans and warehouse at Williams.

Name: LOGAN H. ROOTS
Description: Banking; mail carrying; railroads; real estate; and introducing telephone service in Texas and Arkansas. His first efforts were in cotton-raising after the war. He is a director in the Arkansas and Gulf Railroad, St. Louis, Iron Mountain and Southern Railroad; Consolidated Refrigerating Company, etc.

Name: P. K. ROOTS
Description: Banking, cotton raising, real estate, etc.

Name: COLONEL ZEBULON WARD
Description: Cotton plantations and leasing penitentiaries.

Name: R. W. MARTIN
Description: Trading and loaning money on plantations and real estate.

Name: W. J. THOMPSON
Description: Trading and loaning money on plantations and investments in real estate.

Name: STEPHEN W. DORSEY
Description: Railroads in Arkansas; stage mail contracts; mining speculations; and ranch and cattle in New-Mexico.

Name: ALLEN TOWLE
Description: Timber land and lumber manufacturing in Placer County.

Name: AUGUST HEILBRON
Description: Raising and slaughtering cattle, and hardware business.

Name: E. HEILBRON
Description: Raising and slaughtering cattle and hardware merchandising in partnership with August Heilbron.

Name: JOHN W. ALLYNE
Description: Oils and real estate.

Name: O. D. BALDWIN
Description: Mines and real estate.

Name: L. L. BAKER
Description: Manufacturing agricultural machinery and wholesale hardware.

Name: J. BRANDENSTEIN
Description: Merchandising and lands.

Name: ARCH. BORLAND (of Grayson & Co.)
Description: Land, cattle-raising and mines.

Name: ALPHEUS BULL
Description: Insurance; silver and other mines; speculation and banking. He was interested in the Big Bonanza mines and left an estate of several millions.

Name: E. J. BALDWIN
Description: Hotels, mining and real estate.

Name: THOMAS BELL
Description: Quicksilver mines and commission merchandising.

Name: W. B. BOURNE
Description: Real estate and investments.

Name: HENRY BABCOCK
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: T. H. BLYTHE
Description: City real estate. He made a fortune of several millions.

Name: J. T. BOYD
Description: Real estate and street railroads.

Name: ALFRED BOREL (of Alfred Borel & Co.)
Description: Private banking, and lands.

Name: DAVID BIXLER
Description: Silver and gold mines, and real-estate investments.

Name: EDWARD BARRON
Description: Quicksilver mines.

Name: PRINCESS GALATIO COLONNA (Paris)
Description: From her father, John W. Mackay, made in the Bonanza silver mines.

Name: ALFRED A. COHEN
Description: Attorney for Central Pacific and other roads. In Oakland Ferry, real estate, etc.

Name: JULES CERF
Description: Real estate.

Name: GEORGE W. CROCKER
Description: Railroads and lands.

Name: MRS. CLARK W. CROCKER
Description: Railroads and lands.

Name: R. D. CHANDLER
Description: Dealing in coal and pig iron.

Name: W. H. COWELL
Description: Manufacturing lime and investments in timber lands.

Name: JOHN CARROLL
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: CHARLES F. CROCKER
Description: Inherited from Charles Crocker, who made a great fortune in the Central Pacific Railroad and lands. Charles F. Crocker is vice-president of that road and a director in Wells, Fargo & Co.’s Express Company.

Name: WILLIAM H. CROCKER
Description: Inherited from Charles Crocker and made in the Central Pacific Railroad, and lands.

Name: FREDERICK CROCKER
Description: Railroads and lands. Inherited from Charles Crocker.

Name: MARIA COLEMAN (Sister of W. S. O’Brien)
Description: Mines, etc.

Name: JAMES V. COLEMAN
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: MRS. ARCHIBALD C. D. DICK (London)
Description: From her father, Parrott, the banker. Made in mines, banking and real estate.

Name: J. S. DOE
Description: Real estate and manufacturing doors, sashes, blinds and building.

Name: COLL. DEANE
Description: Banking, brokerage and speculation.

Name: WILLIAM DUNPHY
Description: Wholesale cattle and lands.

Name: S. P. DEWEY
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: MRS. PETER DONAHUE
Description: Iron manufacturing, gas and investments.

Name: MRS. J. MERVYN DONAHUE
Description: Inherited from her husband. Made in gas stock, iron manufacturing, etc.

Name: C. J. DEMPSTER
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: J. A. DONOHUE
Description: Private banking, real estate, gas and mines.

Name: BARTLETT DOE
Description: Manufacturing doors, sashes and blinds, building and real estate.

Name: WALTER E. DEANE
Description: Made in mines.

Name: A. E. DAVIS
Description: Railroads and mines.

Name: HORACE DAVIS
Description: Flour-milling chiefly.

Name: M. H. DE YOUNG
Description: Publishing “The Daily Chronicle,” and investments in real estate.

Name: J. ENRIGHT
Description: Real estate and lands.

Name: E. E. EYER
Description: Mines and speculation.

Name: J. O. EARLE
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: JAMES G. FAIR, Jr.
Description: Silver mines and speculation. Inherited from his father, James G. Fair, who was interested in the Big Bonanza mines.

Name: CHARLES FAIR
Description: Silver mines and speculation. Inherited from James G. Fair.

Name: MISS VIRGINIA FAIR
Description: Silver mines and speculation. Inherited.

Name: MRS. JAMES C. FLOOD
Description: Silver and gold mines; banking and real estate. Inherits from her husband.

Name: MISS CORA JANE FLOOD
Description: Inherited from her father, James C. Flood. Made in mines, banking and real estate.

Name: JAMES L. FLOOD
Description: Inherited from James C. Flood. mines, banking and real estate.

Name: C. N. FELTON
Description: Mines and real estate.

Name: LADY FLORENCE EMILY FENNER-HESKETH (wife of Sir Thomas G. F. Fenner-Hesketh, England)
Description: From her father, William Sharon. Made in silver mines, banking, railroads, etc.

Name: W. R. FULLER (of Whittier, Fuller & Co.)
Description: Made a large fortune in dealing in paints, oils and glass.

Name: E. L. GOLDSTEIN (of B. Dreyfus & Co.)
Description: Mfg. California wines and very valuable city real estate.

Name: LEWIS GERSTLE
Description: Importing furs and merchandising in the Alaska Commercial Company.

Name: ADAM GRANT
Description: Merchandising, drygoods and lands.

Name: WILLIAM T. GARRATT
Description: Foundry business; then railroads, steamship investments and mining.

Name: ALVINZA HAYWARD
Description: Silver and gold mines; Gold Hill Water Company; railroads and real estate.

Name: S. C. HASTINGS
Description: Law and investments.

Name: CHARLES WEBB HOWARD
Description: Water company and stocks.

Name: E. S. HELLER
Description: Wholesale drygoods.

Name: A. P. HOTALING
Description: Wholesale liquors and real estate.

Name: E. W. HOPKINS
Description: Made in the Central Pacific Railroad.

Name: TIMOTHY HOPKINS
Description: Mines and the Central Pacific Railroad. He was the adopted son of Mark Hopkins, from whom he received a large legacy; and he obtained $3,000,000 from the estate of Mrs. Hopkins-Searles, to whom Mark Hopkins left the bulk of his great fortune of over $20,000,000. Treasurer of the Central Pacific Railroad and director in the Southern Pacific.

Name: MOSES HOPKINS
Description: Inherited from Mark Hopkins, who made a great fortune in the Central Pacific Railroad and in mines.

Name: WILLIAM S. HOPKINS
Description: From Mark Hopkins, who made a great fortune in the Central Pacific Railroad and in mines.

Name: C. F. D. HASTINGS
Description: Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: MR. HUTCHINSON
Description: Head of the Alaska Fur Company. Made in the fur business.

Name: GEORGE HEARST
Description: Silver, gold and copper mines, banking and real estate.

Name: W. R. HEARST
Description: Silver, gold and copper mines, banking and real estate.

Name: W. S. HOBART.
Description: Silver mines, speculation and Gold Hill Water Co.

Name: A. E. HEAD.
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: JAMES IRVINE.
Description: Merchandising and land.

Name: JOHN P. JONES.
Description: Silver and gold mines, speculation and banking.

Name: M. P. JONES.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: ROBERT JOHNSON.
Description: Merchandising iron.

Name: JEFFERSON G. JAMES.
Description: Cattle raising and lands.

Name: J. G. KITTLE.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: MICHAEL J. KELLY.
Description: Made in lands and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM M. LENT.
Description: Silver and other mines in California and Colorado and speculation.

Name: NICHOLAS LUNING.
Description: Real estate and loans.

Name: CHARLES LUX (of Miller & Lux).
Description: Cattle-raising and lands.

Name: MR. LEWIS (of Allen & Lewis).
Description: Commission grain.

Name: JEROME LINCOLN.
Description: Merchandising and banking.

Name: JAMES LICK.
Description: Merchandising and rise in real estate. He owned an enormous amount of real estate, including fifty lots in San Francisco, a large tract in Placer County, and the island of Cata, Catalina, containing 50,000 acres, lying off Los Angeles. He founded the Lick Observatory.

Name: JOHN W. MACKAY.
Description: Made in the Big Bonanza silver mines, banking and speculation. Director in the Commercial Cable Company.

Name: J. L. MOODY.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: ANDREW B. McCREARY.
Description: Speculation in mining shares and real estate.

Name: CHARLES MAIN (of Main & Winchester).
Description: Manufacturing harness in Portsmouth, N. H., and sale of goods here. Added to by investments in real estate.

Name: ROBERT F. MORROW.
Description: Silver and other mines and speculation.

Name: DANIEL MEYER.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: HENRY MILLER (of Miller & Lux).
Description: Wholesale cattle-raising and lands.

Name: DR. R. H. McDONALD (of the Pacific Bank).
Description: Finance and banking.

Name: THOMAS MAGEE.
Description: Real estate.

Name: CHARLES McLAUGHLIN.
Description: Railroads and lands.

Name: MRS. McDONOUGH.
Description: From W. S. O’Brien. Made in silver mines, etc.

Name: JAMES N. McDONALD.
Description: Merchandising, mines and real estate.

Name: DR. JOHN R. NIGHTINGALE.
Description: Investments in real estate.

Name: FRANCIS G. NEWLANDS.
Description: From William Sharon. Made in silver mines, etc.

Name: WILLIAM NORRIS.
Description: Made in overland express business and banking in Wells, Fargo & Co. Secretary of the company.

Name: CORNELIUS O’CONNOR.
Description: Real estate and stocks.

Name: JAMES F. ORTMAN.
Description: Groceries and real estate.

Name: TIBURCIO PARROTT.
Description: Inherited. Made in mines, buildings, real estate and banking.

Name: JOHN PARROTT.
Description: Made in mines, banking and real estate.

Name: JAMES PHELAN.
Description: A ’49er. For thirty years an importer and dealer in merchandise and has investments in real estate. Is worth several millions.

Name: GEORGE C. PERKINS.
Description: Merchandising and mines.

Name: EDMUND PATTEN.
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: MRS. JOHN A. PAXTON.
Description: Banking and mines.

Name: A. J. POPE (of Pope & Talbot).
Description: Manufacturing lumber; timber lands, and vessels. The firm has large interests at Port Gamble, Wash.

Name: DR. E. B. PERRIN.
Description: Lands.

Name: MRS. M. A. PARROTT.
Description: Banking, mines, real estate, etc. John Parrott, her husband, was a pioneer.

Name: GEORGE W. PRESCOTT.
Description: Made in the Union Iron Works and investments.

Name: HENRY PIERCE.
Description: Dealing in grain and judicious investments.

Name: MOSES ROSENBAUM.
Description: Real estate and merchandising.

Name: WILLIAM C. RALSTON.
Description: Silver mines, speculation and banking.

Name: ISAAC L. REQUA.
Description: Mines and speculation.

Name: DR. WASHINGTON M. RYER.
Description: Made in real-estate investments.

Name: A. G. RUSS.
Description: Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: GEORGE W. RIDLEY.
Description: Extensive wheat farmer and land-owner in Butte County.

Name: LOUIS SACHS.
Description: Wholesale drygoods and clothing in Sachs Brothers & Co., here, and in Stiefel, Sachs & Co., New-York City.

Name: CLAUS SPRECKELS.
Description: Sugar refining.

Name: JOHN D. SPRECKELS.
Description: Received the gift of $1,000,000 from his father, Claus Spreckels, who by his fight with the Eastern Sugar Trust compelled the latter to buy his Philadelphia sugar refinery at an advance of $3,000,000 over what he paid for it.

Name: MISS SPRECKELS.
Description: Received a gift of $1,000,000, from her father, Claus Spreckels, who by his fight with the Eastern Sugar Trust compelled the latter to buy his Philadelphia sugar refinery at an advance of $3,000,000 over what he paid for it.

Name: JOHN SKAE.
Description: Silver mines and speculation. San Francisco and New-York City. Added to in real estate.

Name: LEVI STRAUSS.
Description: Merchandise drygoods and men’s furnishing goods in the firm of Levi Strauss & Co., of San Francisco.

Name: GUSTAVE SUTRO.
Description: Mines and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM SHIELS.
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: THOMAS SUNDERLAND.
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: ADOLPH SUTRO.
Description: Silver mines, speculation, the Sutro Tunnel and real estate.

Name: A. M. SIMPSON.
Description: Lumber manufacturing and lands.

Name: LOUIS SLOSS.
Description: Furs and merchandising in the Alaska Commercial Company.

Name: LELAND STANFORD.
Description: Made a large fortune in building and operating the Central Pacific Railroad; in the Wells, Fargo & Co. Express; in mines, and various investments. President of the Central Pacific and director in the Southern Pacific, Wells, Fargo & Co., etc.

Name: FRED. W. SHARON.
Description: Mines and real estate.

Name: ROBERT SHERWOOD.
Description: Jewelry business and speculation in Comstock shares.

Name: MRS. J. D. TALLENT.
Description: Banking, etc.

Name: W. C. TALBOT (of Pope & Talbot).
Description: Manufacturing, lumber, timber lands and vessels. The firm has sawmills and other large interests at Port Gamble, Wash.

Name: HIRAM TUBBS.
Description: Merchandising and lands.

Name: R. R. THOMPSON.
Description: Mines and real estate.

Name: RICHARD TOBIN.
Description: Law practice, banking and investments.

Name: JAMES P. TREADWELL.
Description: Law practice, large fees, loans, and city real estate.

Name: WILLIAM H. TAYLOR.
Description: Iron manufacturing. President of the Risdon Iron Works.

Name: LLOYD TEVIS.
Description: Made in the Wells, Fargo & Co. Express, Wells, Fargo & Co.’s Bank and branches; banking, real estate and mines. President of Wells, Fargo & Co.

Name: N. VAN BERGEN (of N. Van Bergen & Co.).
Description: Wholesale liquors and large investments in real estate.

Name: MRS. J. H. VAN SCHROEDER.
Description: Inherited. Gas stock, etc.

Name: JOHN WIELAND (of the John Wieland Brewing Co.).
Description: Brewing.

Name: J. C. WILMERDING.
Description: Wholesale liquors and real estate.

Name: ANDREW WELCH.
Description: Shipping and commission.

Name: JOSEPH WOODWORTH.
Description: Speculation in mining shares.

Name: WILLIAM WAKERLEY.
Description: City real estate.

Name: R. B. WOODWARD.
Description: Hotel and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM H. WHITE.
Description: Oils and real estate.

Name: GENERAL THOMAS H. WILLIAMS.
Description: Silver mines in Nevada.

Name: EX-GOVERNOR R. H. WATERMAN.
Description: Mines and railroads.

Name: S. M. WILSON.
Description: Law and investments.

Name: MR. WHITTIER (of Whittier & Fuller).
Description: Dealing in paints, oils and window glass.

Name: DANIEL T. MURPHY.
Description: Formerly Mayor of San Jose. Made a fortune in ranche lands, cattle-raising and city real estate.

Name: JESSE C. STOVALL (of Stovall & Wilcoxson).
Description: Dealing in cattle and sheep; loans, real estate and warehousing.

Name: J. J. HAGERMAN.
Description: Formerly one of the owners of the Chapin iron mine in Wisconsin. Increased his wealth by silver mines in Colorado, and railroad development. Director in the Aspen Mining and Smelting Company, Colorado Midland Railway, etc.

Name: N. C. CREEDE.
Description: Founder of the Creede Mining Camp, who is the owner of mines of great value.

Name: N. P. HILL.
Description: Boston and Colorado Smelting Company. Smelting and mining.

Name: J. S. BROWN.
Description: Cattle and wholesale groceries.

Name: W. M. CLAYTON.
Description: Made in real estate.

Name: G. W. CLAYTON.
Description: Local real estate.

Name: DONALD FLETCHER.
Description: Real estate.

Name: H. A. W. TABOR.
Description: Gold and silver mines.

Name: WILLIAM GILPIN.
Description: Real estate, Spanish grant.

Name: JEROME B. CHAFFEE.
Description: Mercantile business and banking, and finally in Colorado gold mines.

Name: ISAAC E. BLAKE.
Description: Oil refining and real estate. He is connected with the Continental Oil Company, branch of the Standard Oil Company.

Name: MORITZ BARTH.
Description: Made in real estate.

Name: DAVID H. MOFFAT, JR.
Description: Banking, Colorado mines and railroads. President of the First National Bank, and of the Denver and Rio Grande Railroad.

Name: WILLIAM BARTH.
Description: First in selling boots and shoes; then in real estate, in which his fortune has been chiefly made. President of the City National Bank.

Name: HENRY R. WOLCOTT.
Description: Mines, telephone and street railway stock and real estate. Vice-President of the National Bank of Commerce. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society of New York. President of the Colorado Telephone Company, and director in many other corporations.

Name: WILLIAM B. DANIELS.
Description: Merchandising. Founder of the leading drygoods and carpets house of the plains.

Name: DENNIS SULLIVAN.
Description: Made in Colorado mines and cattle-raising.

Name: HENRY M. PORTER.
Description: Cattle-raising, real estate and mines. He is the owner of a Mexican grant.

Name: S. N. WOOD.
Description: Made in banking.

Name: F. P. ERNEST.
Description: Cattle-raising and real estate.

Name: JOB A. COOPER.
Description: Real estate and banking. President of the National Bank of Commerce.

Name: MR. ILIFF.
Description: Made in cattle-raising and real estate.

Name: GEORGE C. SCHLEIER.
Description: Made in real estate.

Name: F. A. KEENER.
Description: Real estate and advance in values.

Name: J. R. GRANT (of the Omaha and Grant Smelting and Refining Company).
Description: Mining first, and then smelting.

Name: E. ELLIDY (of the Omaha and Grant Smelting and Refining Company).
Description: Colorado mines and smelting.

Name: WILLIAM S. JAMES (of the Omaha and Grant Smelting and Refining Company).
Description: First in Colorado mines and then in smelting.

Name: CHARLES B. KOUNTZE.
Description: Banking, real estate, railroads, Colorado mines and smelting. President of the Colorado National Bank, and interested in the Globe Smelting and Refining Company. A large owner of real estate.

Name: HENRY C. BROWN.
Description: Made in real estate and investments. Obtained by pre-emption 160 acres now in the heart of the city. Owner of the Henry C. Brown Hotel, as well as of other valuable property.

Name: JOHN J. RIETHMANN.
Description: Banking, real estate and Colorado mines. President of the German National Bank.

Name: WALTER S. CHEESMAN.
Description: Partly in mines and banking, but mainly in real estate. Vice-President of the First National Bank.

Name: JOHN EVANS (ex-Governor of Colorado).
Description: Made in railroad building, and in real estate at Evanston, Ill., and elsewhere.

Name: E. F. HALLACK.
Description: Sawmills and lumber.

Name: JOSEPH A. THATCHER.
Description: Banking here and cattle-raising at Pueblo. President of the Denver National Bank and member of Thatcher Brothers.

Name: SAMUEL B. MORGAN.
Description: Colorado mines, and fortunate investments in real estate.

Name: H. M. GRIFFIN.
Description: He made a million or thereabouts in silver mining.

Name: JOHN HULBERT.
Description: Mining brokerage and real estate.

Name: DR. WILLIAM A. BELL.
Description: Railroads and real estate.

Name: MAHLON D. THATCHER.
Description: Banking and cattle raising in the firm of Thatcher Brothers.

Name: FRANKLIN FARRELL.
Description: Foundry and machine business.

Name: P. T. BARNUM.
Description: Museum and circus business.

Name: HENRY SANFORD.
Description: Made in Adams Express Company.

Name: CLAPP SPOONER.
Description: Railroads and stocks.

Name: E. C. BASSICK.
Description: Colorado mines.

Name: G. F. GILMAN.
Description: In the tea business and investments.

Name: W. D. BISHOP.
Description: Railroads, stocks and Western Union Telegraph Company. Director in the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad; Western Union Telegraph Company, etc.

Name: NATHANIEL WHEELER.
Description: Made in the Wheeler & Wilson sewing machines, and investments. Director in the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad.

Name: WILLIAM H. PERRY.
Description: Made in the Wheeler & Wilson sewing machines, and investments.

Name: BENJAMIN B. HOTCHKISS.
Description: Manufacturing firearms and machine guns.

Name: ELIAS HOWE.
Description: Royalties on sewing machine needles.

Name: JUSTIN STOCKING.
Description: Made over $2,000,000, chiefly in railroads.

Name: MRS. HENRY S. GLOVER.
Description: Made in the Cornwall ore bank, Pennsylvania.

Name: CORNELIUS BENEDICT.
Description: Stocks and brokerage.

Name: A. FOSTER HIGGINS.
Description: Made in the practice of his profession as adjuster and in insurance and investments.

Name: CALDWELL H. COLT.
Description: Manufacturing firearms.

Name: LEONARD DANIELS.
Description: Flour milling and investments.

Name: GENERAL CHARLES E. HILLYER.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: SAMUEL L. CLEMENS (known in literature as “Mark Twain”).
Description: Made in the publication of his own books, in the firm of Charles L. Webster & Co., New-York City.

Name: MARSHALL JEWELL.
Description: Manufacture of belting and other lines of goods.

Name: MRS. SARAH COLT (widow of Samuel Colt).
Description: Manufacturing firearms.

Name: JAMES G. BATTERSON.
Description: Insurance, building and contracting.

Name: BOLAND MATHER.
Description: Merchandise, drygoods and banking.

Name: HENRY KENEY.
Description: Wholesale groceries, in partnership with Walter Keney, and investments in banks, insurance companies, railroads, etc.

Name: Mrs. WALTER KENEY.
Description: From her husband, who left to her his entire estate. Made in partnership with Henry Keney.

Name: WILLIAM H. BARNUM.
Description: Manufacturing car-wheels and iron foundry business.

Name: N. L. BRADLEY.
Description: Manufacturing gas and kerosene fixtures, lamps, bronzes, etc. He is the treasurer of the Bradley & Hubbard Manufacturing Co.

Name: EDWARD MILLER.
Description: Manufacturing gas and kerosene fixtures, lamps, bronzes, etc.

Description: Merchandising, coal and lumber, building and banking. President of the First National Bank and the City Savings Bank.

Name: CHARLES PARKER.
Description: Iron foundry, guns, wood-screws, lamps, vises, etc. President of the Charles Parker Co., iron founders; and in Parker Brothers, guns, and the Parker & Whipple Co., hardware manufacturers.

Name: WALTER HUBBARD (President of Bradley-Hubbard Manufacturing Co.).
Description: Manufacturing gas and kerosene fixtures.

Name: JOHN SUTLIFF (President, Foster & Merriam Co.).
Description: Manufacturing cabinet hardware.

Name: HORACE C. WILCOX.
Description: Manufacturing plated ware.

Name: LEMUEL J. CURTIS.
Description: Manufacturing plated ware.

Name: JULIUS WADSWORTH.
Description: Packing in Chicago, merchandising in New-Orleans, and railroads.

Name: HENRY G. HUBBARD.
Description: Manufacturing and banking.

Name: JAMES W. ALSOP.
Description: Made in the West India Trade, real estate in New-York and railroads.

Name: JOHN H. WHITTEMORE (of the Tuttle & Whittemore Malleable Iron Company).
Description: Made in the manufacture of iron. The company is a large concern and has branches in several other cities.

Name: CORNELIUS B. ERWIN.
Description: Manufacturing hardware in the Russell & Erwin Manufacturing Company.

Name: EZEKIEL H. TROWBRIDGE.
Description: Shipping, West India trade and investments. New-Haven Railroad, etc.

Name: DANIEL TROWBRIDGE.
Description: Made in shipping and the sale of groceries.

Name: HOADLEY B. IVES.
Description: Mainly in railroad investments.

Name: J. B. SARGENT (of Sargent & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing hardware.

Name: TREDWELL KETCHAM.
Description: Banking and brokerage.

Name: MRS. ARTHUR N. GIFFORD.
Description: Inherited from her father, Philip Manett, a merchant in Boston.

Name: RICHARD S. FELLOWS.
Description: Wholesale merchant of clocks and watches in New-York City, and in gas companies and factories in Connecticut.

Name: HENRY FARNAM.
Description: Canal and railroad building.

Name: HENRY F. ENGLISH.
Description: Inherited. Lumber during the war, manufacturing clocks, etc., and a little in shipping.

Name: PIERCE N. WELCH.
Description: Banking and manufacturing.

Name: JUSTUS S. HOTCHKISS.
Description: Largely inherited. Partly made in manufacturing and in lumber.

Name: DR. HENRY BRONSON.
Description: Long life of judicious investments in real estate and securities.

Name: OLIVER W. WINCHESTER.
Description: Manufacturing patent shirts in Boston, and then manufacturer of fire-arms in New-Haven.

Name: HANFORD SMITH.
Description: Partly in real estate.

Name: WILLIAM A. SLATER.
Description: Inherited. Made in cotton manufacturing by his father, John F. Slater, who left an estate of several millions, and who gave $1,000,000 for the education of the colored race in the South.

Name: EDWARD CHAPPELL.
Description: Merchandising; lumber and coal.

Name: A. P. STURTEVANT.
Description: Woollen manufacturing in Connecticut; and real estate, including the Sturtevant House, in New-York City.

Name: CHARLES L. HUBBARD.
Description: From his father, James L. Hubbard. Made in the manufacture of paper.

Name: LORENZO BLACKSTONE.
Description: Made in cotton manufacturing and investments.

Name: DAVID HALL.
Description: Chiefly made in real estate in New-York City.

Name: CYRUS WHITE.
Description: Manufacturing envelopes and ginghams, rise in real estate, etc.

Name: FREDERICK MARQUAND.
Description: Jewelry business in New-York City and investments in real estate.

Name: GEORGE H. CHASE.
Description: Stock brokerage business in New-York City.

Name: WALTON FERGUSON.
Description: Iron manufacturing at Pittsburg.

Name: GEORGE A. HOYT.
Description: Merchandise, clothing, mining coal, and real estate.

Name: JOSEPH B. HOYT (of Schulz & Hoyt, hide and leather merchants, New-York City).
Description: Partly inherited from Joseph B. Hoyt, his father, manufacturer of leather belting, tanner and dealer in leather, who founded the firm of Hoyt Brothers and was associated with Ladew and Fayerweather as J.B. Hoyt & Co.

Name: THE REV. T. H. PORTER.
Description: Inherited; tanning and leather.

Name: J. I. RAYMOND.
Description: Importing at New-York.

Name: HENRY K. McHARG.
Description: Brokerage business in New-York, railroads, and investments; is in Wabash Railroad, Colorado Coal and Iron Company, Morning Star Consolidated Mining Company, Evening Star Mining Company, etc.

Name: HENRY R. TOWNE (president Yale & Towne Manufacturing Company).
Description: Manufacturing patented locks.

Name: FRANK SWAN.
Description: Iron manufacturing in Joliet.

Name: WILLIAM HUBBARD.
Description: Merchandising in New-York City.

Name: HIRAM DEWING.
Description: Stocks.

Name: W. A. LOTTIMER.
Description: Inherited; made in merchandizing drygoods, and in stocks.

Name: JOHN V. HECKER.
Description: Self-raising flour, milling in New-York by his father and himself. President of the George V. Hecker Company.

Name: W. W. SKIDDY (president of Stamford Manufacturing Company).

Name: JAMES D. SMITH (of James D. Smith & Co., New-York).
Description: Brokerage and banking business and stocks.

Name: FRANK PHELPS.
Description: Importation of merchandise.

Name: SETH THOMAS.
Description: Manufacturing clocks.

Name: WILLIAM L. GILBERT.
Description: For fifty years president of the Gilbert Clock Company. Had other factory and banking interests. He was a member of Gilbert & Gay, bankers, now Holmes & Gay.

Name: JOSEPH SWIFT.
Description: Manufacturing matches.

Name: WILLIAM K. SWIFT.
Description: Manufacturing matches.

Name: MRS. E. B. McCOMB (widow of Henry S. McComb).
Description: Made in railroad building and railroad stocks chiefly. Some in tanning.

Name: JAMES C. McCOMB.
Description: Made in railroad building and railroad stocks chiefly. Some in tanning.

Name: MISS HANNAH SHIPLEY.
Description: Made in banking by her brother, Joseph Shipley, an Englishman.

Name: COLONEL H. A. DUPONT.
Description: From his father, General Henry Dupont, head of the Dupont Powder Works, and made in the manufacture of gunpowder and investment of accumulations. Colonel Dupont is president of the Wilmington and Northern Railroad Company.

Name: WILLIAM DUPONT.
Description: Inherited. Fortune made in manufacturing powder.

Name: SAMUEL HARLAN (of Harlan & Hollingsworth Company).
Description: Iron shipbuilding.

Name: THOMAS JACKSON (of Harlan & Hollingsworth Company).
Description: Iron shipbuilding.

Name: COLONEL JOSHUA CLAYTON.
Description: Planting and farm lands.

Name: HARBESON HICKMAN.
Description: Land investments in the West, and vessels and lands in Delaware.

Name: MRS. NICHOLAS L. ANDERSON.
Description: From Nicholas Longworth, of Cincinnati. Made in real estate and investments.

Name: ALEXANDER GRAHAM BELL.
Description: Made in the Bell telephone, patented.

Name: MRS. ALEXANDER GRAHAM BELL.
Description: Made in the Bell telephone, patented. Her husband transferred to her $10,000,000 or more of the stock of the Bell Telephone Company.

Name: REV. JOHN A. ASPINWALL.
Description: From his father, William H. Aspinwall. Made in coasting vessels, the Panama Railroad, etc.

Name: A. L. BARBER.

Name: W. W. CORCORAN.
Description: Banking and negotiation of United States bonds.

Name: MRS. ZACHARIAH CHANDLER.
Description: Wholesale drygoods and speculation in United States bonds.

Name: MATTHEW G. EMERY.

Name: GARDINER G. HUBBARD.

Name: CHRISTIAN HEURICH.
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: GEORGE E. LEMON.
Description: Pension agency business and his weekly newspaper.

Name: JOHN T. LENMAN.
Description: Real estate. He owns the Lenman Building and a large amount of other local property.

Name: MRS. DAVID B. MORGAN.
Description: Made by her husband in Wall Street.

Name: HENRY McSHANE.
Description: Bell and brass foundry business.

Name: SAMUEL NORMENT.

Name: PROFESSOR PATTEN.
Description: Western railroads and lands.

Name: E. FRANCIS RIGGS.

Name: JAMES N. RICHARDS.
Description: Manufacturing bricks.

Name: COLONEL HENRY STRONG.
Description: Real estate, etc.

Name: MRS. EDWARD TEMPLE.

Name: CALEB C. WILLARD.

Name: JOSEPH WILLARD.
Description: Hotel-keeping, real estate and local corporations.

Name: HENRY A. WILLARD.
Description: Hotel-keeping, real estate and local corporations.

Name: MRS. JOHN HAY.

Name: JOHN ELLIOTT.
Description: Banking, merchandising and investments.

Name: COLONEL WILLIAM M. STEWART.

Name: MISS SARAH H. COLEMAN.

Name: EDWARD H. GATO.

Name: WILLIAM CURRY.
Description: Shipbuilding and merchandising, groceries and provisions.

Name: MRS. MARY I. CABLE.

Name: JACOB DARST.

Name: MRS. JANE GUTH.

Name: H. J. F. RICKER.

Name: MRS. SARAH M. MOFFATT.

Description: Real estate and stocks.

Description: Merchandising and investments.

It has a half-interest in the Citizens’ Bank of Monticello (Shirk & McLean); a half-interest in the Tipton County Bank at Tipton, the Citizens’ Bank at Delphi, and nearly all the stock in the First National Bank of Peru—all banks in Indiana.

They have the largest wagon factory in the world, with branches in New-York City, Chicago, San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Kansas City and Wichita.

Name: J. M. STUDEBAKER (of the Studebaker Brothers Manufacturing Company).

Name: JOHN W. LANE.
Description: Telegraph interests, Providence horse railroads, real estate and houses in Portland, and other interests.

Name: J. B. BROWN.
Description: The richest man in Maine. His fortune was founded by a modest start in a grocery store, followed by importing sugar and West India goods, and then, naturally, by sugar refining in Portland, and the investment of profits. He went into banking, real estate, hotels, railroads, and steamship lines. He was a large owner in the Boston and Maine Railroad.

Name: EDWARD O’BRIEN.
Description: Building sailing ships for his own use, ocean freighting, lime kilns, and banking. He was president of a bank.

Name: EX-GOVERNOR COBURN.
Description: Made in the purchase of low-priced pine lands, of which he was one of the largest owners in Maine, and the sale of logs therefrom.

Name: CHRISTIAN AX (of Gail & Ax).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: GEORGE J. APPOLD.
Description: Wholesale leather and hides.

Name: EDWIN F. ABELL.
Description: Publishing “The Sun,” daily newspaper.

Name: GEORGE W. ABELL.
Description: Publishing “The Sun,” daily newspaper.

Name: HORACE ABBOTT.
Description: Iron manufacturing and building monitors, etc.

Name: Mrs. F. W. BENNETT.
Description: From her husband, F. W. Bennett. Made in auction business and mining property.

Name: GENERAL GEORGE S. BROWN (of Alex. Brown & Son).
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: WALTER B. BROOKS.
Description: Manufacturing and railroad investments.

Name: D. L. BARTLETT.
Description: Made in iron manufacturing, etc.

Name: BERNARD CAHN (of Cahn, Belt & Co.).
Description: Importing liquors.

Name: WILLIAM F. BURNS.
Description: Banking; president of Eutaw Savings Bank.

Name: GABRIEL D. CLARK.
Description: Wholesale and retail jeweller.

Name: B. FRANK DEFORD.
Description: Wholesale leather.

Name: THOMAS DEFORD (of Deford & Co.).
Description: Wholesale leather.

Name: FRANCIS DENMEAD.
Description: Manufacture of malt, and dealing in hops.

Name: CHARLES D. FISHER (of Gill & Fisher).
Description: Shipping and commission business.

Name: JOHN S. GITTINGS.
Description: Large real estate investments, banking and stocks of corporations. Largest owner of real estate in Maryland; senior member of John S. Gittings & Co., bankers; and director in many corporations.

Name: JAMES A. GARY (of James S. Gary & Sons).
Description: Cotton goods manufacturing.

Name: G. W. GAIL (of G. W. Gail & Ax).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: ROBERT GARRETT.
Description: Merchandising, banking, and railroads, but chiefly in The Baltimore and Ohio Railroad. He is a member of Robert Garrett & Sons, private bankers. Their money was largely inherited from his father, John W. Garrett, who made an immense fortune in merchandising, banking, and the development of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.

Name: T. HARRISON GARRETT.
Description: Inherited from John W. Garrett, and made in merchandising, banking, and the development of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad.

Name: MISS MARY E. GARRETT.
Description: Inherited from John W. Garrett, and made in merchandising, banking, and the development of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad. She is the founder and sole support of the Bryn Mawr Female Academy of Baltimore.

Name: JAMES GREGG.
Description: Made in groceries.

Name: MAURICE GREGG.
Description: Loans and investments.

Name: JOHN GILL.
Description: President of Mercantile Trust Company; banking.

Name: MRS. GANN M. HUTTON (Celeste Winans).
Description: From her father, Thomas Winans. Made in railroad building and contracts in Russia.

Name: JOHN A. HAMBLETON.
Description: Private banking in the firm of John A. Hambleton & Co.

Name: WILLIAM E. HOOPER.
Description: Cotton manufacturing.

Name: JOHNS HOPKINS.
Description: Merchandising groceries first, then railroads, especially the Baltimore and Ohio, in which his fortune was chiefly made.

Name: GEORGE JENKINS.
Description: Leather dealing.

Name: MICHAEL JENKINS.
Description: Leather dealing.

Name: HENRY JAMES.
Description: Lumber dealing and banking. President of the Citizens’ National Bank.

Name: WILLIAM KNABE (of William Knabe & Co. Manufacturing Company).
Description: Piano manufacturing.

Name: FRANCIS T. KING.
Description: Banking and real estate; president of the Central Savings Bank. Although he died with less than a million, this was because he gave so much to philanthropic objects.

Name: WILLIAM KEYSER.
Description: Copper manufacturing.

Name: H. IRVIN E. KEYSER.
Description: Copper manufacturing.

Name: THOMAS M. LANAHAN.
Description: Practice of law and real estate investments.

Name: LOUIS McLANE.
Description: Made originally in California. Engaged here in looking after his investments. Was vice-president of the Mercantile Trust and Deposit Company.

Name: C. S. MALTBY.
Description: Merchandising, oysters and groceries and ship-chandlery goods.

Name: CHARLES F. MAYER (president B. and O. Railroad).
Description: Railroads, coal mines, and Western Union Telegraph Company.

Name: BENJAMIN F. NEWCOMER.
Description: Wholesale flour and railroads. President of the Safe Deposit and Trust Company.

Name: ENOCH PRATT.
Description: Banking; wholesale iron and real estate; president of National Farmers’ and Planters’ Bank.

Name: ANDREW REID.
Description: Importing sugar and coffee.

Name: JOSEPH H. RIEMAN.
Description: Packing and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM S. RAYNES.
Description: First in retail drygoods, followed by extensive purchases of suburban real estate, which has risen in value.

Name: GEORGE SMALL.
Description: South American trade, deep-sea ships, and miscellaneous investments.

Name: W. W. SPENCE.
Description: Importing sugar and coffee and investments. Is vice-president of the Mercantile Trust and Deposit Company.

Name: SAMUEL M. SHOEMAKER.
Description: Made in Adams Express business.

Name: JESSE TYSON.
Description: Manufacture of chemicals.

Name: CHARLES A. VOGELER.
Description: Proprietary medicine manufacturing.

Name: W. T. WALTERS.
Description: Wholesale whiskey and railroad investments. Is vice-president of the Safe Deposit and Trust Company.

Name: DE WITT CLINTON WINANS.
Description: Inherited from Ross Winans. Made in foreign railroad building and government contracts.

Name: WALTER SCOTT WINANS.
Description: Inherited from Ross Winans. Made in foreign railroad building and Government contracts.

Name: WILLIAM WINANS.
Description: Inherited. Railroad building and Government contracts abroad.

Name: ROSS R. WINANS.
Description: Inherited. Railroad building and Government contracts abroad.

Name: FRANCIS WHITE.
Description: Rise in values of real estate.

Name: GEORGE B. WESTCOTT.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: JACOB HUMBIRD.
Description: Railroad building in South America, etc.

Name: JACOB TOME.
Description: Saw mills, lumber and banking. President of Cecil National Bank.

Name: FREDERICK L. AMES.
Description: Richest man in the city of Boston. Inherited a large fortune and has increased it. All made in railroads, real estate, telegraph lines and investments. He is a director in the Chicago and Northwestern Railway, American Telegraph and Cable Company, Mercantile Trust Company, Missouri Pacific Railway, Union Pacific Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Company, etc., etc.

Name: OLIVER AMES.
Description: Inherited, and increased by himself; all made in manufacturing shovels, plows, etc., and railroad and other investments.

Name: OAKES A. AMES.
Description: Inherited and increased by himself; all made in manufacturing shovels, plows, etc., and railroad and other investments.

Name: WILLIAM AMORY.
Description: Cotton manufacturing.

Name: EDWARD F. ATKINS.
Description: Railroads and merchandising.

Name: CHARLES FRANCIS ADAMS.
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate and investments in railroads, etc.

Name: WALDO ADAMS.
Description: Inherited from his father. Made in the Adams Express Company.

Name: J. EDWARD ADDICKS.
Description: Made in the Bay State and Boston Gas Companies.

Name: FRANK W. ANDREWS.
Description: Inherited from his father, who made his money in merchandising and real estate.

Name: DANIEL F. APPLETON (of Robbins, Appleton & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing Waltham watches.

Name: JOHN QUINCY ADAMS.
Description: Largely inherited. Made in real estate and railroads. Director in the Boston, Housac Tunnel and Western Railroad, the Chicago Junction Railways and Stock Yards Company, etc.

Name: B. A. ATKINSON (of B. A. Atkinson & Co.).
Description: Prominent for many years in the furniture and house-furnishing business.

Name: MRS. JOHN F. ANDREWS.
Description: From her father, Nathaniel Thayer, who made a great fortune in shipping, foreign trade, banking and railroads.

Name: SAMUEL ATHERTON.
Description: Tanning and leather, and investments.

Name: JOHN L. BREMER.
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: GARDNER BREWER.
Description: Commission drygoods, and agency of New-England Mills, with large investments in real estate.

Name: JAMES M. BEEBE.
Description: Drygoods and investments in real estate, which is now worth over $1,000,000.

Name: GRENVILLE T. W. BRAMAN.
Description: Back Bay real estate and cotton manufacturing.

Name: MARTIN BRIMMER (Trustee).
Description: Inherited valuable real estate from his father of the same name. Family has been rich for several generations.

Name: E. WILSON BLAKE.
Description: Cracker baking and operations on Board of Trade in Chicago.

Name: T. O. H. P. BURNHAM.
Description: Bookselling and real estate.

Name: ROBERT B. BRIGHAM.
Description: Restaurant business and investments in real estate.

Name: CAPTAIN JOSIAH P. BRADLEE.
Description: Shipping and foreign trade.

Name: JOHN BROWN.
Description: The “West End millionaire.” Real estate, etc.

Name: CHARLES P. BOWDITCH.
Description: Partly inherited from J. Ingersoll Bowditch. Made in the West India trade and Bell telephone.

Name: MRS. ELIZABETH B. BOWDITCH.
Description: Partly inherited from J. Ingersoll Bowditch. Made in the West India trade and Bell telephone.

Name: FREDERICK BUTTERFIELD.
Description: Importation of drygoods.

Name: WILLIAM O. BLAKE.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: MARIA C. BLAKE.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: W. L. BRADLEY.
Description: Manufacturer of fertilizers.

Name: JASON S. BAILEY.
Description: Rise in real estate and investments.

Name: JOSHUA BENNETT.
Description: Real estate and investments.

Name: FRANCIS BARTLETT.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, Sidney Bartlett. Made in mines, investments in Illinois Steel Company, etc., etc.

Name: ISAAC T. BURR.
Description: Railroads and investments.

Name: JAMES H. BEAL.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: JOHN D. BATES.
Description: Made in the sale of dry goods.

Name: RICHARD BAKER.
Description: Made in deep-sea ships, ocean freighting, and foreign trade. He was with William F. Weld & Co.

Name: EDWARD BANGS.
Description: Real estate and law practice.

Name: GEORGE N. BLACK.
Description: Pine lands, saw mills and lumber.

Name: JOHN FRYANT.
Description: Made in shipping and ocean freighting.

Name: EZRA BAKER.
Description: Ocean shipping, trade in fruit, and railroads.

Name: BARNEY COREY.
Description: Made in the wine business.

Name: CHARLES U. COTTING.
Description: Manager for the “Fifty Associates.” Made in real estate.

Name: MRS. J. RANDOLPH COOLIDGE.
Description: From her father, John L. Gardner. Merchandising and real estate.

Name: NATHAN CUSHING.
Description: Accumulated a fortune in the wholesale grocery business.

Name: T. JEFFERSON COOLIDGE.
Description: First in the East Indies trade, then in cotton manufacturing, and part of the time in railroads. Treasurer of the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company. President of the Emery and the Lawrence Manufacturing Companies. Director in Dwight Manufacturing Company, Boston and Lowell Railroad, Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad, Kansas City, Fort Scott and Memphis Railroad, etc., etc.

Name: ELISHA S. CONVERSE.
Description: Treasurer of Boston Rubber Shoe Company; rubber shoe manufacturing.

Name: JAMES W. CONVERSE.
Description: President of Boston Land Company, and of Boston Rubber Shoe Company. Made in manufacturing, etc.

Name: LEONARD R. CUTTER.
Description: Real estate.

Name: BENJAMIN P. CHENEY.
Description: Made in the express business.

Name: ALEXANDER COCHRANE.
Description: Manufacturing and importing chemicals.

Name: GEORGE B. CLAPP.
Description: Tanning and leather, and speculation.

Name: DANIEL B. CLAFIN.
Description: Merchandising small wares, hosiery, gloves, etc.

Name: E. W. CONVERSE (of Converse, Stanton & Cullen).
Description: Commission drygoods and rise of National Tube Works stock.

Name: L. L. CRAGIN.
Description: Made in the manufacture of soap.

Name: URIEL H. CROCKER.
Description: Inherited from his father, Uriel Crocker, of Crocker & Brewster, once the great publishers of Boston. Made in publishing and investments in railroads and real estate.

Name: MRS. AMY H. CABOT (Brookline).
Description: Fortune made in mercantile business, the China trade, and investments in real estate.

Name: F. GORDON DEXTER.
Description: Inherited and increased his fortune by investments in real estate and railroads. He is in Union Pacific and other Western roads.

Name: DANIEL L. DEMMON.
Description: Real estate, of which he is a large holder, including the “Boston Tavern”; and mining stocks, etc.

Name: MOSES DAY.
Description: Chiefly in manufacturing cordage.

Name: OLIVER DITSON.
Description: Music publishing and real estate.

Name: MRS. FRANKLIN DEXTER.
Description: Real estate. (Inherited from her husband.)

Name: WILLIAM DENNISON.
Description: Tag manufacturing and real estate.

Name: MRS. ELIZABETH T. ELDREDGE.
Description: From her grandfather, Williams, of J. J. & M. Williams, the famous wine merchants. Partly made in rise in real estate.

Name: JACOB EDWARDS, Treasurer of the Bates Manufacturing Company.
Description: Manufacturing.

Name: WILLIAM ENDICOTT, Jr.
Description: Chiefly in commission drygoods and Western railroads and lands. Is president of New-England Trust Company.

Name: NATHANIEL H. EMMONS.
Description: Inherited from his father and from Thomas B. Wales, his grandfather. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: MOSES ELLIS.
Description: Merchandising and real estate in California and Boston.

Name: ROBERT D. EVANS.
Description: Manufacturing rubber. President of the American Rubber Company.

Name: EUSTACE C. FITZ (of Fitz, Dana & Co.).
Description: Merchandising iron, steel and metal; and investments. President of the Blackstone National Bank. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society.

Name: GEORGE F. FABYAN, of Bliss, Fabyan & Co.
Description: Commission drygoods, and, to some extent, manufacturing cotton.

Name: CHARLES FAULKNER, sr. (of Faulkner, Page & Co.).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: J. V. FLETCHER.
Description: Provisions and banking, etc. President of Faneuil Hall National Bank.

Name: CAPTAIN ROBERT B. FORBES.
Description: Made in the China trade, deep-sea shipping and ocean freighting.

Name: JOHN M. FORBES.
Description: Some of his fortune made in the China trade, but most of it in railroads, especially Chicago, Burlington and Quincy, also in the Bell telephone.

Name: WILLIAM H. FORBES (of J. M. Forbes & Co.).
Description: Made in the China trade and the Bell telephone.

Name: DANIEL S. FORD.
Description: Publishing “The Youth’s Companion” and real estate. He has about a million of real estate alone.

Name: JOSEPH N. FISKE.
Description: Real estate and loans. Taxed on $1,300,000 of real estate alone.

Name: ISAAC FENNO.
Description: In the sale of clothing, and in real estate.

Name: JONATHAN FRENCH.
Description: From his father of the same name, and investments in real estate.

Name: JOHN FOSTER.
Description: Dealing in wines, and real estate investments.

Name: JOHN S. FARLOW.
Description: In the East India trade, followed by investments in railroads.

Name: W. O. GROVER.
Description: Made in the manufacture of Grover & Baker sewing machines, and investments.

Name: DAVID GREENOUGH.
Description: Real estate improvement.

Name: JOHN L. GARDNER.
Description: Largely inherited. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: GEORGE A. GARDNER.
Description: Inherited from his father; money made in merchandising and Boston real estate, etc.

Name: HON. WILLIAM GASTON.
Description: Law, real estate, etc.

Name: A. L. HOLLINGSWORTH.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, and all made in the paper business.

Name: JOHN C. HAYNES.
Description: Music publishing (with Ditson), and real estate and other investments. President of Charles H. Ditson & Co.

Name: LOUIS HECHT.
Description: Commission wool and banking.

Name: H. HOLLIS HUNNEWELL.
Description: Merchandising and investments in real estate, but made mostly in Western lands and railroads.

Name: EDGAR HOUGHTON (of Houghton, Coolidge & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing boots and shoes.

Name: H. O. HOUGHTON (of Houghton, Mifflin & Co.).
Description: Publishing magazines and copyrighted books.

Name: WILLIAM H. HILL (of Richardson, Hill & Co., bankers).
Description: Partly inherited from his father of the same name; but his wealth was acquired by himself, before his father’s death, in banking and investments in real estate, etc. President of the Boston and Bangor Steamship Company. Director in the First National Bank, American Rubber Company, Marine Insurance Company, Assabet Manufacturing Company, Windsor Company, International Steamship Company; and gas, wharf and other companies.

Name: EDGAR HARDING (of Harding, Whitman & Co.).
Description: Drygoods commission business.

Name: GEORGE D. HOWE.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: ALFRED C. HERSEY.
Description: Merchandising, wharf business, ship-owning and investments in railroads and cotton mills.

Name: CHARLES P. HEMENWAY, trustee of Augustus Hemenway estate.
Description: Made in the Chili trade and merchandising, real estate investments. The estate owns nearly $3,000,000 of real estate.

Name: F. B. HAYES.
Description: Law, real estate, railroads, etc.

Name: H. L. HIGGINSON (of Lee, Higginson & Co.).
Description: Banking, copper mining, etc.

Name: GEORGE O. HOVEY.
Description: Made in drygoods.

Name: JACOB H. HECHT.
Description: Merchandising and real estate. He is a large owner of property in New-York City.

Name: J. D. W. JOY (of Joy, Langdon & Co.).
Description: Drygoods, commission business and real estate.

Name: JOHN C. JESSUP.
Description: Manufacturing (Dighton mills), etc.

Name: SAMUEL JOHNSON (of C. F. Hovey & Co.).
Description: Inherited; made in drygoods and real estate.

Name: EBEN D. JORDAN (Jordan, Marsh & Co.).
Description: Large business in drygoods, and investments.

Name: MISS ANNA JAQUES.
Description: Inherited from her brothers and sisters.

Name: JOSEPH S. KENDALL (of Faulkner, Page & Co.).
Description: Commission, drygoods and investments.

Name: FRANKLIN KING.
Description: Wholesale drugs and paints, and real estate.

Name: HENRY P. KIDDER (of Kidder, Peabody & Co.).
Description: Banking and brokerage.

Name: FRANK A. KENNEDY, Cambridge.
Description: Cracker-baking.

Name: JEROME KIDDER.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: DAVID KIMBALL.
Description: Mostly in real estate.

Name: MOSES KIMBALL.
Description: Originally in drygoods; then in real estate, including the “Boston Museum,” and railroads, etc.

Name: SAMUEL LITTLE.
Description: Mostly in real estate, but he has other interests. President of the Rockland Bank. President of the Howard Watch Company.

Name: HENRY LEE (of Lee, Higginson & Co.).
Description: Banking; Safe Deposit Company; Calumet and Hecla copper mines at Lake Superior; and railroads.

Name: GEORGE C. LEE (of Lee, Higginson & Co.).
Description: Banking; Safe Deposit Company; Calumet and Hecla copper mines at Lake Superior; and railroads.

Name: ARTHUR T. LYMAN.
Description: Manufacturing. Treasurer of the Lowell Manufacturing Company.

Name: JAMES M. LITTLE.
Description: Made in drygoods and real estate.

Name: SAMUEL C. LAWRENCE.
Description: Inherited. The family have for several generations been in the Medford rum business; some of the money made in distilling in South Carolina and rise in real estate. His real estate interests alone amount to more than a million.

Name: ELISHA T. LORING.
Description: Trade with South America and deep-sea ships chiefly. Some in copper mining at Lake Superior.

Name: FRANCIS C. LOWELL.
Description: Inherited. Real estate mostly.

Name: AMORY A. LAWRENCE.
Description: Commission drygoods, etc.

Name: ABBOTT LAWRENCE.
Description: Commission drygoods, etc.

Name: AUGUSTUS LOWELL.
Description: Commission drygoods, etc.

Name: ROBERT C. MACKAY.
Description: East India trade and vessel owning.

Name: HENRY L. MILLS.
Description: Inherited. Made in railroads, etc.

Name: THOMAS NOTLEY (Catlin & Co.).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: LEOPOLD MORSE (of Leopold Morse & Co.).
Description: Wholesale and retail clothing; and the manufacture of clothing.

Name: CHARLES J. MORRILL.
Description: Shipping business and investments. President of the Provident Institution for Savings.

Name: CHARLES MERRIAM.
Description: Drygoods and railroads. Trustee of the Nathaniel Thayer estate.

Name: WILLIAM MINOT.
Description: Real estate.

Name: DANIEL R. NOYES (J. L. Bremer & Co.).
Description: Commission dry goods.

Name: GEORGE H. NORMAN.
Description: Contracting and building water works.

Name: WILLIAM J. NILES.
Description: Rise in real estate chiefly.

Name: THOMAS NICKERSON.
Description: Originally in deep-sea shipping and foreign trade, then in railroads in the West and Mexico.

Name: MRS. ELIZA S. NEVINS.
Description: From her husband, David Nevins. Drygoods.

Name: DAVID NEVINS, Jr.
Description: Inherited from his father. Made in drygoods.

Name: ALBERT W. NICKERSON.
Description: Largely inherited. Made in shipping, railroad investments, etc.

Name: HARVEY D. PARKER.
Description: Hotel business. (Parker House.)

Name: SAMUEL B. PIERCE.
Description: Sale of crockery. Added to by real estate investments.

Name: ROBERT TREAT PAINE.
Description: Inherited and accumulated. Is himself engaged in law.

Name: RALPH POMEROY.
Description: Boots and shoes; and railroads.

Name: COLONEL ALBERT A. POPE (of The Pope Manufacturing Company).
Description: Made in the manufacture of the Columbia bicycles. The founder of the business in America, and an inventor of many patented devices.

Name: THOMAS W. PIERCE.
Description: Drygoods first, and then railroads and stocks.

Name: ISAAC PRATT, Jr.
Description: Iron merchandising, real estate and banking. President of the Atlantic National Bank.

Name: MRS. JOHN F. PEARSON.
Description: From her father, Samuel B. Hale. Made in South American trade and banking.

Name: THOMAS E. PROCTOR.
Description: Tanning and leather.

Name: GEORGE F. PARKMAN.
Description: Mortgages, real estate and law.

Name: OLIVER W. PEABODY.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: CHARLES J. PAINE.
Description: Inherited some and made money in railroad stocks. His wife is a daughter of John Bryant, East India merchant, who left $2,000,000.

Name: FRANCIS H. PEABODY.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: JOHN C. PHILLIPS.
Description: Real estate and securities inherited for several generations. The real estate alone amounts to more than two millions.

Name: JAMES PARKER.
Description: Largely made in rise in real estate.

Name: HENRY L. PIERCE (of Walter Baker & Co.).
Description: Chocolate business.

Name: W. B. RICE (of Rice & Hutchins).
Description: Manufacturing boots and shoes and investments.

Name: WILLIAM A. RUSSELL.
Description: Chiefly in manufacturing paper.

Name: ROYAL E. ROBBINS.
Description: Treasurer of the American Waltham Watch Company. Manufacturing patented watches by machinery.

Name: GEORGE F. RICHARDSON.
Description: Chiefly in real estate.

Name: P. J. REGGIO.
Description: In the Smyrna trade and investments in real estate.

Name: H. R. REED (Nash, Spaulding & Co.).
Description: Sugar refining and wharf property.

Name: ISAAC B. RICH.
Description: Publishing business and theatrical management.

Name: COLONEL HENRY S. RUSSELL.
Description: Inherited. Made in the China trade, and the Bell telephone.

Name: JAMES S. STONE.
Description: Real estate mostly.

Name: QUINCY A. SHAW.
Description: Inherited. Made chiefly in Western lands and the Calumet and Hecla copper mines. Owns nearly a million of real estate in Boston.

Name: FREDERICK R. SEARS.
Description: Inherited from David Sears. Made in merchandising and real estate investments. He has more than a million dollars’ worth of real estate in Boston.

Name: JOSEPH SAWYER (of Sawyer, Manning & Co.).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: JOSHUA MONTGOMERY SEARS.
Description: Inherited. Made in merchandising and real estate. He is taxed on $4,500,000 of real estate.

Name: JOHN P. SQUIRE.
Description: Pork packing.

Name: WILLIAM SOHIER.
Description: Real estate mostly. Has over a million dollars’ worth.

Name: DAVID SNOW.
Description: Largely made in real estate.

Name: JAMES STEVENSON.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: GRACE STEVENSON.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: J. P. SPAULDING (Nash, Spaulding & Co.).
Description: Sugar refining and wharf property.

Name: MRS. HENRIETTA S. SARGENT (Brookline).
Description: Merchandising by her husband, Ignatius Sargent, and investments in real estate.

Name: A. SHUMAN (of A. Shuman & Co.).
Description: Wholesale and retail clothing and manufacturing thereof.

Name: JOHN STETSON.
Description: Made in the printing and publishing business; banking, and theatrical management.

Name: JOHN SIMMONS.
Description: Made several millions in wholesale ready-made clothing and real estate. The estate pays taxes on $2,250,000 of buildings and lots.

Name: JOHN SHEPARD.
Description: Made in merchandising dry goods, and investments. Director in the Lamson Cons. Store Service Company.

Name: MRS. FRANCIS SKINNER.
Description: From her father, John L. Gardner. Merchandising and real estate.

Name: BARTHOLD SCHLESINGER (of Naylor & Co.).
Description: Iron business.

Name: A. W. SPENCER.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: WILLIAM SHEAFE.
Description: Real estate.

Name: ELIHU THOMSON (Thomson-Houston Electric Company).
Description: Invention and manufacture of patented electrical machinery.

Name: BENJAMIN F. THOMPSON.
Description: Tanning and leather.

Name: JAMES THORNDIKE.
Description: Real estate mostly.

Name: JOHN E. THAYER.
Description: Inherited from Nathaniel Thayer, his father, who began his business career in shipping and foreign trade, but made his great fortune chiefly in banking and railroad investments; he controlled the Philadelphia, Wilmington and Baltimore Railroad, and sold it to the Pennsylvania Railroad; he was interested in the New-York Central Railroad also, the Michigan Central, and the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy, and also in Western lands.

Name: BAYARD THAYER.
Description: Inherited from Nathaniel Thayer, his father,who began his business career in shipping and foreign trade, but made his great fortune chiefly in banking and railroad investments; he controlled the Philadelphia, Wilmington and Baltimore Railroad, and sold it to the Pennsylvania Railroad; he was interested in the New-York Central Railroad also, the Michigan Central, and the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy, and also in Western lands.

Name: EUGENE V. R. THAYER.
Description: Inherited from Nathaniel Thayer, his father. Made in shipping, railroads, banking and lands.

Name: NATHANIEL THAYER.
Description: Inherited from Nathaniel Thayer, his father. Made in shipping, railroads, banking and lands. He has also an interest in the Illinois Steel Company.

Name: CAPTAIN JOSEPH B. THOMAS.
Description: Merchandising in California in early days, in which he made a million; then sugar refining in Boston.

Name: JOHN TAPPAN.
Description: Merchandising on a large scale.

Name: H. C. THACHER (of H. C. Thacher & Co.).
Description: Merchandising, cotton and wool, and loans.

Name: GEORGE P. UPHAM.
Description: Dry goods business.

Name: ROGER WOLCOTT.
Description: Inherited from his father, J. Huntington Wolcott. Made in commission drygoods in the firm of A. & S. Lawrence & Co. and in investments.

Name: CHARLES WHITNEY.
Description: Lumber dealing and real estate investments; over a million dollars of real estate.

Name: SOLOMON WILDES.
Description: In merchandising and investments in real estate.

Name: HENRY M. WHITNEY.
Description: Mostly in West End street railroad enterprise and coasting steamers; is large owner in Metropolitan Steamship Company.

Name: J. REED WHIPPLE.
Description: Hotel business chiefly (Young’s Hotel and Parker House).

Name: SAMUEL D. WARREN.
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: WILLIAM G. WELD.
Description: From his father, who made several millions in deep-sea ships, ocean freighting, the East India trade and real estate in Boston and New-York City.

Name: N. WHITING.
Description: In the sale of clothing, and investments in real estate.

Name: RALPH H. WHITE (of R. H. White & Co.).
Description: Made in dry goods.

Name: ARIOCH WENTWORTH.
Description: Marble business and real estate. About $2,000,000 worth of real estate.

Name: JAMES A. WOOLSON (of William Claflin, Coburn & Co., and Rogers, Wood, Loring & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing boots and shoes, loans, and investments.

Name: MOSES WILLIAMS.
Description: Wines, liquors and real estate, there being over a million of the latter.

Name: FRANCIS C. WELCH.
Description: He succeeded his father as trustee of old estates and made his fortune in that business and by inheritance, and in various investments.

Name: ROBERT C. WINTHROP.
Description: Largely from his wife, who was Mrs. John E. Thayer. Mr. Thayer was a banker.

Name: THOMAS WIGGLESWORTH.
Description: Made in East India trade and merchandising by his father.

Name: JOSEPH H. WHITE (of White, Payson & Co.).
Description: Commission drygoods and real estate.

Name: JOHN W. WHEELWRIGHT.
Description: Made in dry goods.

Name: WILLIAM F. WELD.
Description: Inherited. Made in ships, ocean freights, foreign trade and real estate.

Name: CHARLES G. WELD.
Description: Inherited. Made in ships, ocean freights, foreign trade and real estate.

Name: CAPTAIN SAMUEL WATTS (formerly of Thomaston, Maine.).
Description: Deep-sea shipping, which he built for his own use; ocean freighting, and investments.

Name: DANIEL R. SARTWELL.
Description: Distilling and investments.

Name: PROFESSOR ALEXANDER AGASSIZ.
Description: Made his fortune in the great Calumet and Hecla copper mines at Lake Superior.

Name: W. MURRAY CRANE (of Z. & W. M. Crane).
Description: Manufacturing paper.

Name: ZENAS CRANE (of Z. & W. M. Crane).
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: JAMES B. CRANE.
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: WESTON BRYON.
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: SAMUEL WILLISTON.
Description: Manufacturing buttons upon a plan suggested by his wife.

Name: JAMES P. RAY.
Description: Manufacture of cotton-batting and shoddy, banking, etc. President of the Franklin National Bank, and large owner in railroad stocks. He recently sold 2,000 shares in the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Railroad to Messrs. Rockefeller and Morgan, of New-York.

Name: CHARLES T. CROCKER (of Crocker, Burbank & Co.). Partly inherited. Made in manufacturing paper, railroads, etc.
JAMES PHILLIPS, jr.
Description: Woollen manufacturing and dealing in wool, with other investments. Owner of “The New-York Press.”

Name: RODNEY WALLACE.
Description: Manufacturing paper, railroads, etc.

Name: GEORGE N. PROCTOR.
Description: Manufacturing wool, gold mine investments, and coal.

Name: MRS. MARY BRAYTON YOUNG (widow of Bradford M. C. Durfee).
Description: A fortune of many millions, made in cotton and iron manufacturing.

Name: EDWIN F. SEARLES.
Description: Inherited from his wife, the widow of Mark Hopkins, of San Francisco, an enormous fortune. Made in California mines and railroads.

Name: E. J. M. HALE.
Description: Woollen mills and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM F. DRAPER.
Description: Partly inherited, but all made in managing cotton mills and manufacture of patented cotton machinery.

Name: MRS. J. C. PARSONS.
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: WILLIAM WHITING (of the Whiting Paper Company).
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: E. C. TAFT.
Description: Manufacturing paper.

Name: TIMOTHY MERRICK.
Description: Thread manufacturing, etc.

Name: WILLIAM SKINNER.
Description: Silk manufacturing.

Name: MRS. NATHANIEL THAYER.
Description: She has a large fortune in her own right, inherited from her family, the Van Rensselaers of New-York State, who owned a great landed estate around Albany.

Name: CHARLES ALBERT COFFIN.
Description: Manufacturing shoes; and the Thomson-Houston Electric Company.

Name: HENRY A. PEVEAR.
Description: Manufacturing morocco, and in Thomson-Houston Electric Company.

Name: JOSEPH N. SMITH.
Description: Made in shoe manufacturing and in Thomson-Houston Electric Company.

Name: BENJAMIN F. SPINNEY.
Description: Made in manufacturing shoes, banking, and in Thomson-Houston Electric Company.

Name: JOHN B. ALLEY.
Description: Manufacturing and dealing in sole leather; and railroad investments.

Name: FRANCIS W. BREED.
Description: Manufacturing, and has investments in Tennessee Land Company and other enterprises.

Name: BENJAMIN F. BUTLER.
Description: Law practice and investments.

Name: C. H. TENNEY.
Description: Hat manufacturing.

Name: RICE MUNN REYNOLDS (of E. M. & T. Reynolds).
Description: Wool manufacturing, etc., etc.

Name: CYRUS W. HOLMES.
Description: Manufacturing woollens and president of Monson National Bank.

Name: HENRY F. BARROWS.
Description: Manufacturing jewelry, banking, etc.; president of North Attleborough National Bank.

Name: GEORGE ST. JOHN SHEFFIELD.
Description: From his father, James E. Sheffield, who made a large fortune in merchandising at Mobile, Ala., and in railroad and kindred investments in the North.

Name: A. C. HOUGHTON (president of the Arnold Print Co.).
Description: Manufacturing cotton goods.

Name: Hon. MOSES T. STEVENS.
Description: Manufacturing.

Name: N. P. COBURN (of A. Coburn, Son & Co., of Hopkinton).
Description: Shoe manufacturing.

Name: WILLIAM J. ROTCH.
Description: Whaling and investments. Has interest in Illinois Steel Co.

Name: EDWARD D. MANDELL.
Description: Shipping and ocean freights.

Name: MISS MARY L. JONES.
Description: Inherited a fortune made in whaling and East India trade.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM A. ABBE.
Description: Made in whaling and deep sea ships.

Name: MISS EMILIA H. BOURNE.
Description: Made in whaling and deep sea ships.

Name: MRS. THOMAS G. HUNT.
Description: Made in whaling and deep sea ships.

Name: JONATHAN BOURNE.
Description: Made in whaling, deep sea ships and various investments. President of Merchants’ National Bank.

Name: FRANCIS HATHAWAY.
Description: Inherited from his father. Made in deep sea ships and trade with China and the East Indies.

Name: HORATIO HATHAWAY.
Description: Merchant. Inherited from his father. Made in deep sea ships and trade with China and East Indies.

Name: WILLIAM L. GRANT.
Description: Made in the New Home sewing machines.

Name: JOHN W. WHEELER.
Description: Made in the New Home sewing machines.

Name: ANDREW J. CLARK.
Description: Made in the New Home sewing machines.

Name: S. D. WARREN.
Description: Manufacturing paper and investments.

Name: LEONARD B. HARRINGTON.
Description: Tanning and leather business and banking.

Name: GEORGE PEABODY.
Description: Inherited from Joseph Peabody, his father, a merchant, and increased it by investments.

Name: FRANCIS C. BERTRAM.
Description: Made in South American and African trade and deep sea ships.

Name: JOHN BERTRAM.
Description: Merchandising, foreign trade and deep sea ships.

Name: DAVID PINGREE.
Description: Principally made in ownership of pine lands in Maine and New-Hampshire and sale of logs therefrom. There are about 1,200,000 acres of this land in Maine alone.

Name: MRS. J. M. THOMPSON.
Description: From her husband, who made a fortune in Adams Express Company.

Name: GEORGE R. DICKINSON.
Description: Paper manufacturing.

Name: D. B. WESSON (of Smith & Wesson).
Description: Manufacturing revolvers (patented).

Name: HORACE SMITH (of Smith & Wesson).
Description: Manufacturing revolvers and President of Chicopee National Bank.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM BLISS.
Description: From her father, Chester W. Chapin. Made in the Boston and Albany Railroad, the Union Pacific Railroad, and other railroad, canal and steamboat enterprises.

Name: MRS. J. A. RUMRILL.
Description: From her father, Chester W. Chapin. Made in the Boston and Albany Railroad, the Union Pacific Railroad, and other railroad, canal and steamboat enterprises.

Name: WILLIAM MASON.
Description: Building locomotives and other machinery ; real estate in Boston. etc. There are $650,000 of real estate in Boston (Mason Machine Works).

Name: JAMES F. WHITIN.
Description: Manufacturing cotton and machine shops.

Name: HORATIO SLATER.
Description: Manufacturing woollens and investments.

Name: STEPHEN SALISBURY.
Description: Inherited from his father, of the same name. Made in banking, railroads and real estate. President of Worcester National Bank.

Name: JONAS G. CLARK.
Description: Sale of furniture in California, and real estate investments.

Name: GEORGE S. BARTON.
Description: Iron manufacturing.

Name: GEORGE HENRY WHITCOMB.
Description: Inherited from his father, David Whitcomb, who made his fortune in retailing hardware and then became a manufacturer of envelopes. Increased by investments in real estate, East and West.

Name: WILLIAM GILES.
Description: Law, railroads and investments. He left $2,000,000.

Name: ICHABOD WASHBURN.
Description: Made in the manufacture of barbed wire, by inventions and processes, for the use of which the Washburn & Moen Manufacturing Company are still paid royalties by concerns all over the country.

Name: JOSEPH H. WALKER.
Description: Tanning and the manufacture of boots and shoes.

Name: EDWARD L. DAVIS.
Description: Inherited. Made in car-wheel manufacturing.

Name: WILLIAM B. RICE.
Description: Manufacturing wire.

Name: JESSE MOORE.
Description: Distilling in Kentucky.

Name: R. C. TAYLOR.
Description: Real estate and kindred investments.

Name: PHILIP L. MOEN.
Description: Manufacturing barbed wire and patented implements.

Name: F. B. KNOWLES.
Description: Manufacturing patented looms.

Name: THEOPHILUS WALKER.
Description: Manufacturing glue and also interested in the Danvers Bleachery and Dye Works. He left an estate of $3,000,000.

Name: FRANK W. GILCHRIST.
Description: Pine lands and lake vessels.

Name: GEORGE N. FLETCHER.
Description: Pine lands, saw mills, real estate and sulphite factory.

Name: A. W. COMSTOCK.
Description: Pine lands and saw mills. President of Alpena Banking Company.

Name: A. N. SPRATT.
Description: Pine lands, saw mills, mining land in Montana, etc.

Name: MRS. DIANA RICHARDSON.
Description: Pine lands and sale of stumpage. From her late husband.

Name: HENRY BOLTON (of Bolton & McRae).
Description: Wholesale general merchandise, cedar trees, telegraph poles, etc.

Name: DONALD McRAE (of Bolton & McRae).
Description: General merchandise, cedar trees, telegraph poles, etc.

Name: W. B. COMSTOCK.
Description: Pine lands, sale of stumpage, and banking.

Name: A. W. WRIGHT (of the A. W. Wright Lumber Company).
Description: Saw mills, lumber, pine lands, banking and railroads.

Name: N. B. BRADLEY.
Description: Sawmills; manufacture of lumber; and pine lands.

Name: F. P. CHESBROUGH (of Chesebrough & Charlton).
Description: Pine lands, manufacturing lumber, and investments.

Name: ALEXANDER FOLSOM (of Folsom & Arnold).
Description: Lumber; saw mills, pine lands; and banking.

Name: THOMPSON SMITH.
Description: Lumber, manufacturing, pine lands and vessels.

Name: GEN. R. A. ALGER.
Description: Pine lands, manufacturing, lumber and investments. Director in the United States Express Company.

Name: NEWELL AVERY.
Description: Manufacturing, lumber and pine lands.

Name: E. ALFRED BRUSH.
Description: Inherited a large fortune from his father, who made the money in real estate in Detroit.

Name: LUTHER BEECHER.
Description: Railroads, mines and real estate.

Name: CHRISTIAN H. BUHL (of Buhl, Sons & Co.).
Description: Wholesale hardware and tinware; manufacturing iron and investments; president of Detroit National Bank.

Name: C. C. BOWEN (of D. M. Ferry & Co.).
Description: Raising and dealing in seeds, and investments.

Name: MRS. DR. BOOK.
Description: Inherited several millions from her father, Francis Palms, sr., who made his fortune in dealing in mineral and pine lands, sale of stumpage, banking, etc.

Name: JOHN J. BAGLEY.
Description: Manufacturing tobacco and real estate.

Name: WM. A. BUTLER.
Description: President of Mechanics’ Bank, city real estate.

Name: THEO. H. EATON.
Description: Wholesale drugs, chemicals, etc.

Name: D. M. FERRY (of D. M. Ferry & Co.).
Description: Raising and dealing in seeds, banking, real estate, etc.

Name: JACOB S. FARRAND (of the former firm of Farrand, Williams & Co.).
Description: Wholesale drugs, paints and oils; banking and real estate.

Name: PETER HENKEL.
Description: Wholesale liquors and groceries.

Name: GEORGE H. HAMMOND.
Description: Pork packing and real estate.

Name: COL. F. J. HECKER, president of the Peninsular Car Company.
Description: Made in building railroad cars.

Name: BELA HUBBARD.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: GEORGE HENRIE.
Description: City railroads, banking, contracting, etc.

Name: JAMES F. JOY, formerly president of the Michigan Central Railroad.
Description: Made in railroads and investments.

Name: EDWARD KANTER.
Description: Banking and real estate. President of German-American Bank.

Name: G. V. N. LOTHROP.
Description: Law practice, investments in real estate, etc.

Name: WILLIAM B. MORAN.
Description: Real estate, inherited in part.

Name: W. K. MUIR.
Description: Street railroads and real estate.

Name: JAMES McMILLAN.
Description: He is at the head of fifteen or twenty companies and factories. Made his fortune in railroads, car building, and manufacturing.

Name: HUGH McMILLAN.
Description: President of Commercial National Bank. Made his fortune in railroads, car building and manufacturing.

Name: S. J. MURPHY.
Description: Pine lands, sawmills and lumber.

Name: JOHN S. NEWBERRY.
Description: Car building, railroads, banking and real estate.

Name: FRANCIS PALMS.
Description: Inherited from his father. Money made in dealing in pine and mineral lands, banking, etc.

Name: T. W. PALMER.
Description: Dealing in pine lands, real estate and banking. Partly by gift. All made in the same way.

Name: MRS. T. W. PALMER (born Merrill).
Description: From her father. Made in dealing in pine lands, etc.

Name: WILLIAM H. STEVENS.
Description: Banking and stock farm. President of Third National Bank and of American Banking and Savings Association.

Name: M. S. SMITH.
Description: Jewelry, lumber manufacturing and pine lands.

Name: DANIEL SCOTTEN.
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: ALLAN SHELDON.
Description: Wholesale dry goods, real estate, banking, etc.

Name: TRANGOTT SCHMIDT.
Description: Tanning and leather, dealing in wool, furs, etc.

Name: ALANSON SHELEY (of Williams, Davis, Brooks & Co.).
