Description: Wholesale drugs, paints and oil, real estate, banking, etc.

Name: MISS LILLIE THOMPSON.
Description: Inherited from her grandfather, Brush. Made in real estate in Detroit.

Name: E. W. VOIGHT.
Description: Brewing, real estate and investments.

Name: WILLIAM B. WESSON.
Description: Real estate and banking. Was president of a savings bank and Trust, Security and Safe Deposit company.

Name: DAVID WHITNEY, Jr.
Description: Reputed to be the richest man in Michigan. Fortune made in saw mills, lumber, vessels on the lakes, banking, Detroit real estate, etc.

Name: HIRAM WALKER.
Description: Distilling.

Name: DAVID WARD.
Description: Dealing in lumber and in pine and mineral lands, silver mines in Utah and investments.

Name: W. C. YAWKEY.
Description: Dealing in lumber and pine lands.

Name: ALEXANDER McFARLAN.
Description: Manufacturing lumber and pine lands.

Name: DWIGHT CUTLER.
Description: Saw mills, lumber, dealing in real estate, etc. President of Cutler & Savidge, lumber manufacturers. President of First National Bank.

Name: J. W. CONVERSE.
Description: Manufacturing lumber and in the O. E. Brown Flour Milling Company.

Name: DANIEL H. WATERS.
Description: Real estate, pine lands, etc.

Name: D. A. BLODGETT.
Description: Lumber, saw mills and private bank at Cadillac.

Name: H. A. HAYDEN.
Description: Milling, real estate and banking.

Name: WILEY R. REYNOLDS.
Description: Milling, banking and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM D. THOMPSON.
Description: Manufacturing interests and president of Jackson City Bank.

Name: THOMAS R. LYON.
Description: Sawmills, lumber, grocery-store, etc.

Name: WILLIAM B. MORLEY.
Description: Shipbuilding; vessel owning on the Lakes; freighting, etc.

Name: JOHN M. LONGYEAR.
Description: Dealing in pine lands, iron-ore lands, etc.

Name: MRS. MARY BREITUNG.
Description: From her husband, Edward Breitung. Made in dealing in iron-mining lands and pine lands.

Name: CHARLES H. HACKLEY (of Hackley & Hume).
Description: Sawmills and lumber; president of Muskegon National Bank.

Name: T. D. STIMSON.
Description: Manufacturing and selling lumber.

Name: JOHN TORRENT.
Description: Pine lands, sawmills, lumber, stoves, etc.

Name: JONATHAN BOYCE.
Description: Manufacturing, lumber and planing.

Name: S. M. STEPHENSON.
Description: Mines, dealing in lands, saw-mills and hotels; vice-president of The Kirby-Carpenter Co. and president of First National Bank.

Name: J. D. WESTON.
Description: Sawmills; lumber; manufacturing sashes, doors, etc.

Name: CHARLES F. RUGGLES.
Description: Pine lands, stumpage and sale of rough timber.

Name: JOHN CANFIELD (of the Canfield Salt and Lumber Company).
Description: Manufacturing lumber and salt, and tug line on the lakes.

Name: E. G. FILER (of L. C. Filer & Sons).
Description: Sawmill, pine lumber and grocery store.

Name: LOUIS SANDS.
Description: Sawmill, pine lumber and grocery store.

Name: D. W. FILER (of D. L. Filer & Sons).
Description: Lumber, saw-mill and grocery store.

Name: JAMES DEMPSEY.
Description: Pine lands and manufacturing lumber.

Name: EDWARD BUCKLEY.
Description: Pine lands and manufacturing lumber.

Name: H. A. CHAPIN.
Description: Owner of the famous Chapin iron mine, which he leases. He has also made money in real estate and loans.

Name: AMASA RUST (of Rust Bros. & Co.).
Description: Sawmill; lumber and salt.

Name: W. R. BURT.
Description: Dealing in pine lands, sawmills and lumber.

Name: DANIEL HARDIN.
Description: Manufacturing salt, planing mill, pine lands, banking, etc., president of Commercial National Bank.

Name: EZRA RUST.
Description: Sawmills, pine lands.

Name: ARTHUR HILL.
Description: Dealing in timber and pine lands principally.

Name: THOMAS MERRILL.
Description: Dealing in timber and pine lands principally.

Name: GEORGE L. BURROWS.
Description: Private banking and pine lands. Inherited a large sum from his father.

Name: ROBERT M. STEEL.
Description: Made in building railroads mainly (Union Pacific and Northern Pacific); also in banking, dealing in pine lands, and furniture manufacturing.

Name: PERRY HANNAH (of Hannah, Lay & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing lumber; dealing in pine lands; banking; real estate, and hotel.

Name: JOSEPH SELLWOOD.
Description: Made in iron mines and real estate.

Name: A. M. MILLER.
Description: Started in a logging camp, and made money by real estate investments.

Name: JOHN D. HOWARD.
Description: Originally a grocery store at Superior. Then investing in real estate in Superior and Duluth.

Name: LUTHER MENDENHALL.
Description: Banking and real estate. President of Duluth Union National Bank.

Name: JOHN A. WILLARD.
Description: Law practice and real estate chiefly. He made his first money in Winnebago Reservation lands and next in Sioux lands on the Minnesota River. At one time he owned about 12,000 acres in Blue Earth County, and 19,000 acres acres in Yellow Medicine, Redwood and Brown counties, Minnesota. In 1873 with R. D. Hubbard and another partner, he built the linseed oil mill here, and made some money therein. Since 1878 he has been president of the First National Bank. Also interested in a brick yard, the Mankato Knitting Works, and the Standard Fibreware Co.

Name: R. D. HUBBARD (of Hubbard & Gere, oil millers and R. D. Hubbard & Co., flour millers).
Description: Made his money in oil and flour milling; cattle raising in Montana; real estate, in Duluth and Chicago, etc. Director and owner in the First National Bank.

Name: H. W. BROWN.
Description: Gasworks and local enterprises.

Name: H. C. AKELEY.
Description: Manufacturing lumber.

Name: JOSEPH DEAN.
Description: Lumber business, loans and mortgages.

Name: L. F. MENAGE.
Description: Rise in real estate and loans.

Name: THOMAS LOWRY.
Description: Real estate and street railways.

Name: P. G. WINSTON.
Description: Railroad contracting.

Name: F. G. WINSTON.
Description: Railroad contracting.

Name: T. B. WALKER.
Description: Pine lands, sawmills, lumber and banking. President of Flour City National Bank.

Name: JOHN C. OSWALD.
Description: The sale of liquors, wholesale, and investments.

Name: L. M. STEWART.
Description: Law practice for many years and investments.

Name: H. F. BROWN.
Description: Sawmills and lumber.

Name: C. G. GOODRICH.
Description: Street railroads and rise in the value of inherited real estate.

Name: S. G. COOK.
Description: Lumber manufacturing.

Name: J. H. THOMPSON.
Description: Made in the sale of clothing.

Name: S. T. McKNIGHT.
Description: Sawmills and lumber.

Name: JOHN MARTIN.
Description: Sawmills and lumber.

Name: A. J. SAWYER.
Description: Made in the grain business.

Name: GEORGE H. CHRISTIAN.
Description: Flour milling.

Name: W. S. BENTON.
Description: Linseed oil manufacturing.

Name: J. B. GILFILLAN.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: J. W. JOHNSON.
Description: Iron manufacturing.

Name: W. H. DUNWOODY.
Description: Flour milling and dealing in grain.

Name: C. H. PRIOR.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: H. T. WELLES.
Description: Investments in local real estate.

Name: F. H. PEAVEY.
Description: Dealing in grain.

Name: W. W. EASTMAN.
Description: Manufacturing, real estate and loans.

Name: H. G. SIDLE.
Description: Made in real estate and banking.

Name: C. C. WASHBURN.
Description: Flour milling.

Name: GEORGE R. NEWELL.
Description: Wholesale groceries.

Name: LEVI L. COOK.
Description: Made by the advance in values of real estate.

Name: D. MORRISON.
Description: Made a large fortune in pine lands and their advance in value; and manufacturing.

Name: CLINTON MORRISON.
Description: Presented with a fortune made by his father, D. Morrison, in pine lands and manufacturing, which has been added to by himself by investments in real estate, etc. President of the Farmers and Mechanics’ Savings Bank.

Name: WILLIAM McNAIR.
Description: Law practice and real estate.

Name: J. W. PENCE.
Description: Made $400,000 by investment in whiskey just before the Government tax was put on in war times; and increased his fortune by purchases of real estate which has risen in value, and investments in mines.

Name: JOHN S. PILLSBURY.
Description: Made in milling flour.

Name: GEORGE A. PILLSBURY.
Description: Flour milling.

Name: CHARLES A. PILLSBURY.
Description: Flour milling.

Name: SAMUEL C. GALE.
Description: Rise in real estate; loans and insurance business.

Name: R. B. LANGDON.
Description: Made in contracting and railroad building.

Name: T. B. CASEY.
Description: Made in the sale of drygoods and banking.

Name: PETER WOLFORD.
Description: Real estate investments and loans, the latter being his principal business.

Name: A. H. LINTON.
Description: Railway contracting and building.

Name: RICHARD CHUTE.
Description: Real estate and investments.

Name: H. E. FLETCHER.
Description: Inheritance and real estate chiefly, but has also made money in milling.

Name: GEORGE W. VAN DUSEN.
Description: Buying grain extensively from farmers and shipping it; also engaged in the grain elevator business.

Name: JAMES LAWTHER.
Description: Dealing in coal, and insurance business.

Name: N. P. CLARKE.
Description: Logging and private banking.

Name: FREDERICK WEYERHAUSER.
Description: The bulk of his fortune made in pine lands. Some in manufacturing lumber.

Name: R. C. JEFFERSON.
Description: Sawmills, lumber and pine lands.

Name: H. P. UPHAM.
Description: Banking and dealings in railroad securities.

Name: JAMES J. HILL.
Description: Probably the richest man of the Northwest. Made entirely in railroads. President of the Great Northern Railway, and of the St. Paul, Minneapolis and Manitoba Railway. Is largely interested in other roads. Has absolute control of 4,000 miles of road, and is now building 800 miles to the Pacific coast.

Name: MRS. JAMES J. HILL.
Description: She received an anniversary present of a million dollars in Government bonds from her husband. Made in railroads.

Name: NORMAN T. KITSON.
Description: He left a fortune of $4,500,000, accumulated in steamboating, railroads and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM DAWSON.
Description: Made his money almost entirely in real estate. President of Bank of Minnesota.

Name: CRAWFORD LIVINGSTON.
Description: Made in gas and electric light business.

Name: D. C. SHEPARD (of Griggs, Cooper & Co.).
Description: Merchandising, groceries and railroad contracting.

Name: PETER SIEMS.
Description: Railroad contracting and building.

Name: DENNIS RYAN.
Description: Money made in selling silver and other mining properties.

Name: A. H. WILDER.
Description: Made his money in Government contracts, and increased it in ranches and real estate.

Name: C. W. GRIGGS (of Griggs, Cooper & Co.).
Description: Merchandising, groceries and lumber, and real estate investments.

Name: ANSEL OPPENHEIM.
Description: Made in railroads and real estate.

Name: A. B. STICKNEY.
Description: Made in railroads.

Name: SAMUEL MAYALL.
Description: Obtained his footing by Government contracts for supplies, and increased his fortune by investments in real estate.

Name: W. R. MERRIAM.
Description: Contracts and banking. President of Merchants’ National Bank.

Name: P. H. KELLY.
Description: Made in the grocery business and real estate.

Name: C. D. GILFILLAN.
Description: Made in the city waterworks and in banking.

Name: E. F. DRAKE.
Description: Made some money in law and in banking in Xenia, Ohio. Then embarked in railroad building in Minnesota, and brought to the State, the first rails, cars, and locomotives ever seen there. He built the St. Paul and St. Anthony road, and became largely interested in the St. Paul and Sioux City Railroad, of which he became the president. He was also interested in lumbering in Wisconsin; stone quarries; a fine stock farm in Southwestern Minnesota, and valuable real estate in St. Paul.

Name: THEODORE L. SCHURMEIER.
Description: Inherited from his father-in-law, in part. Has been engaged in merchandising dry-goods and clothing, manufacturing boots and shoes, etc.

Name: COLONEL JOHN MERRIAM.
Description: Contracts, real estate and investments.

Name: HORACE THOMPSON.
Description: Made in railroads, banking and real estate.

Name: HENRY HALE.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: CONRAD GOTZIAN.
Description: Manufacturing boots and shoes.

Name: W. F. DAVIDSON.
Description: Steamboating and real estate.

Name: CHARLES E. DE GRAFF.
Description: Railroad contracting and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM LINDEKE.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: ISAAC STAPLES.
Description: Pine lands, lumber, sawmills and store; president of Lumberman’s National Bank and of a savings bank.

Name: JACOB BEAN (of Hersey & Bean).
Description: Pine lands, saw-mills, etc.

Name: H. W. LAMBERTON.
Description: President of the Winona Deposit Bank. Made in banking and investments.

Name: V. SIMPSON.
Description: Made in real estate, loans, etc.

Name: M. G. NORTON (of Laird, Norton & Co.).
Description: Made in pine lands, saw-mills and lumber.

Name: JAMES L. NORTON (of Laird, Norton & Co.).
Description: Made in pine lands, saw mills and lumber.

Name: WILLIAM H. LAIRD (of Laird, Norton & Co.).
Description: Pine lands, saw mills and lumber.

Name: R. S. McCLURE.
Description: Loans on notes and other securities.

Name: STEPHEN DUNCAN.
Description: Inherited. Son of the late Dr. Stephen Duncan, one of the largest and wealthiest planters in the South.

Name: JOHN GARTH.
Description: Manufacturing and selling lumber.

Name: J. C. LERCY.
Description: Made in the ownership of land, which turned out to have a zinc mine.

Name: S. B. ARMOUR (of Armour Brothers Packing Company).
Description: Packing beef and pork.

Name: A. W. ARMOUR (of Armour Brothers’ Packing Company).
Description: Packing beef and pork.

Name: VICTOR B. BUCK.
Description: Merchandising boots and shoes and rise in real estate.

Name: KERSEY COATES.
Description: Hotel and rise in real estate.

Name: J. C. GATES.
Description: Merchandising boots and shoes, and rise in real estate.

Name: W. E. HALL.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: JAMES F. HOLMES.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: ALBERT MARTY.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: JAMES B. PORTER.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: L. J. PORTER.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: MRS. KATE TOOTLE.
Description: Made by her husband, the late Milton Tootle, in wholesale drygoods and real estate investments.

Name: MISS FANNIE TOOTLE.
Description: Inherited from her father, Milton Tootle. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: MILTON TOOTLE, JR.
Description: Inherited from his father, Milton Tootle. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: JOHN TOOTLE.
Description: Inherited from Milton Tootle. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: JAMES McCORD, SR.
Description: Made in wholesale grocery business.

Name: A. N. SCHUSTER.
Description: Wholesale clothing and private banking. He is also a partner in stores in Hannibal, Mo.; Colorado, Texas; Pueblo, Colo.; and Marysville, Kan. President of the Schuster-Hax National Bank.

Name: JOHN S. LOGAN.
Description: Made in mines.

Name: RUFUS L. McDONALD (of R. L. McDonald & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing woollen and duck wear. Largest manufacturer of this class of goods in the West. Also merchandising drygoods and notions.

Name: WILLIAM M. WYETH.
Description: President of Wyeth Hardware and Manufacturing Co. Made in manufacturing.

Name: J. C. PRYOR.
Description: Made in cattle-raising.

Name: WILLIAM G. FAIRLEIGH.
Description: Merchandising, drygoods and investments.

Name: GEORGE T. HOAGLAND.
Description: Made in lumber trade and money-lending.

Name: DUDLEY M. STEELE.
Description: Wholesale groceries and land. He is a partner in stores in Wichita and Omaha, also.

Name: CHARLES B. FRANCE.
Description: Banking and investments. President of the State National Bank.

Name: LOUIS HAX.
Description: Of the Louis Hax Furniture Company. Made in merchandising carpets, the manufacture of furniture and banking. President of the Central Savings Bank.

Name: N. P. OGDEN.
Description: Banking and investments in real estate. President of the Commercial National Bank.

Name: THOMAS E. TOOTLE.
Description: Wholesale drygoods.

Name: CALVIN F. BURNES.
Description: Law practice, real estate investments, and banking. President of the National Bank of St. Joseph.

Name: JAMES N. BURNES.
Description: Made in real estate investments. Daniel D. Burnes and Calvin C. Burnes are legatees.

Name: ABRAM NAVE.
Description: Wholesale groceries.

Name: ISAAC N. RIDGE.
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: GEORGE SHEIDLEY.
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: LAMON V. HARKNESS (of Harkness, Wyman & Russell).
Description: Banking; he is worth several millions.

Name: ADAM LONG.
Description: First in wholesale groceries (firm of Long Brothers); then in profitable investments in real estate.

Name: JOHN LONG.
Description: First in wholesale groceries (firm of Long Brothers); then in profitable investments in real estate.

Name: GEORGE FOWLER.
Description: Packing meats. The firm of George Fowler & Sons have a plant worth several millions.

Name: DAVID T. EALS.
Description: Stock ranches, cattle-raising and investments.

Name: A. L. MASON.
Description: General merchandising and rise in real estate.

Name: THOMAS H. SWOPE.
Description: Made in rise in real estate.

Name: THOMAS CORRIGAN.
Description: Street railroad franchises and real estate.

Name: GEORGE F. WINTER.
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: W. S. WOODS.
Description: Banking and stock-raising in South Dakota.

Name: WILSON WADDINGHAM.
Description: Cattle-raising and stock ranches.

Name: WILLIAM D. GRISWOLD.
Description: Real estate and investments.

Name: CHARLES CLARK.
Description: Mining properties.

Name: CHARLES McCLURE.
Description: Granite Mountain mines.

Name: SAMUEL CUPPLES (of Samuel Cupples Woodenware Co.).
Description: Manufacturing woodenware.

Name: HUGH McKITTRICK (of the Hargadine-McKittrick Drygoods Co.).
Description: Drygoods.

Name: W. A. HARGADINE (of last above).
Description: Drygoods.

Name: WILLIAM J. LEMP.
Description: Proprietor of Lemp’s Western Brewery. Made in that business.

Name: ADOLPHUS BUSCH (of Anheuser-Busch Brewing Association).
Description: Brewing fine beers.

Name: W. F. NOLKER.
Description: Brewing.

Name: WILLIAM BARR (of the William Barr Drygoods Co.).
Description: Wholesale and retail drygoods and investments.

Name: C. F. G. MYER.
Description: Wholesale drugs.

Name: JOHN T. DAVIS (of Samuel C. Davis & Co.).
Description: Wholesale drygoods.

Name: JOHN WHITTAKER (of Francis Whittaker & Sons).
Description: Packing meats.

Name: L. M. RUMSEY (of the L. M. Rumsey Mfg. Co.).
Description: Manufacturing machine pumps and mining machinery.

Name: MOSES RUMSEY (of last above).
Description: Manufacturing machine pumps and mining machinery.

Name: JOHN R. LIONBERGER.
Description: Mining and banking.

Name: E. C. STERLING.
Description: Brick manufacturer.

Name: GERARD B. ALLEN.
Description: Iron manufacturing and steamboats.

Name: JOHN J. MITCHELL.
Description: Railroads, principally the Chicago and Alton.

Name: OLIVER HART.
Description: Made in real estate and coal lands.

Name: GEORGE E. LEIGHTON.
Description: Iron foundry business and real estate speculations.

Name: GILBERT CHAPMAN.
Description: Iron foundry business and lumber.

Name: MRS. JULIA MAFFITT.
Description: Made in the Indian trade and real estate investments by Pierre Chouteau, in early days.

Name: CHARLES P. CHOUTEAU.
Description: Made in Indian trade and real estate investments in early days.

Name: GOVERNOR D. R. FRANCIS.
Description: Grain options, etc.

Name: W. H. PECK.
Description: Made in contracting, building and insurance.

Name: JOHN A. SCUDDER.
Description: Steamboating on the rivers.

Name: M. TYLER.
Description: Made in rise in real estate.

Name: J. J. ROE.
Description: Made a fortune in packing meats.

Name: ROBERT CAMPBELL.
Description: Made in banking and brokerage business.

Name: ERASMUS WELLS.
Description: Street railroads.

Name: J. B. M. KEHLOR (of Kehlor Brothers).
Description: Laclede flour mills.

Name: JOHN SCULLIN.
Description: Street railroads.

Name: JAMES T. DRUMMOND (of the Drummond Tobacco Company).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: DANIEL CATLIN (of Catlin Tobacco Company).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: JAMES E. LIGGITT (of the Liggitt & Myers Tobacco Company).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: GEORGE S. MYERS (of last above).
Description: Tobacco manufacturing.

Name: MRS. SAMUEL L. VINING.
Description: Inherited. Awarded to her from French Spoliation Claims. Made originally in shipping and foreign trade.

Name: JOSEPH WELL.
Description: Drygoods business and real estate investments.

Name: ROBERT A. BARNES.
Description: Merchandising and real estate.

Name: HENRY SHAW.
Description: Made a large fortune in the importation and sale of hardware, in which business he was engaged for twenty years; and in the purchase at low price of downtown and suburban real estate, which has now become valuable.

Name: MRS. THOMAS ALLEN.
Description: Made in the Iron Mountain Railroad and in various investments, including mines.

Name: WILLIAM R. ALLEN.
Description: From his father, Thomas Allen. Made in railroads and investments.

Name: MISS ANNE ALLEN.
Description: Same as the last.

Name: MRS. CHARLES ATWATER.
Description: From her father, Thomas Allen. Made in railroads mainly.

Name: NELSON STORY.
Description: Made in stock-raising, real estate, banking and a variety of enterprises. President of the Gallatin Valley National Bank.

Name: W. A. CLARK.
Description: Made a large fortune in banking, reduction and mines. Also in forwarding.

Name: S. E. LARABIE.
Description: Banking. He has made a large fortune.

Name: ANDREW J. DAVIS.
Description: Made a fortune of about ten millions in mines, real estate and banking. Was president of the Silver Bow Bank.

Name: MARCUS DALY.
Description: Gold and silver mines, smelting and banking. He also has a large interest in the profitable Anaconda copper mines.

Name: CHARLES X. LARABIE.
Description: Banking and mining. He has made a large fortune.

Name: ISAAC G. BAKER (of Isaac G. Baker & Co.).
Description: Merchandising, forwarding and banking.

Name: THOMAS C. POWER.
Description: Made in freighting, contracting for supplies to United States posts, banking, cattle-raising, etc. President of the American National Bank.

Name: SAMUEL T. HAUSER.
Description: Mostly made in banking. President of the First National Bank.

Name: C. A. BROADWATER.
Description: Freighting, contracting for supplies to United States posts, cattle-raising, banking, hotel and real estate investments. He had a large interest in mines and president of the Montana National Bank.

Name: C. W. CANNON.
Description: Rise in value of real estate.

Name: THOMAS CRUSE.
Description: Mostly in mining and banking. President of the Thomas Cruse Savings Bank. He sold his mines to an English syndicate for over a million dollars.

Name: WILLIAM A. CHESSMAN.
Description: Rise in value of local real estate.

Name: R. S. HALE.
Description: Mines, water and drug store.

Name: A. M. HOLTER.
Description: The sale of hardware, and local mines.

Name: E. L. BONNER.
Description: The sale of lumber, banking, etc.

Name: A. B. HAMMOND.
Description: Made in the sale of lumber, and banking.

Name: C. P. HIGGINS.
Description: Merchandising and banking.

Name: JOHN W. KILPATRICK (of Kilpatrick Bros. & Collins).
Description: Railroad contracting chiefly. He built the Central Pacific, or a large part of it.

Name: S. B. MILES.
Description: Made his start in a pony express from the Missouri River to the far West, and then invested everything in the purchase of low-priced lands in Eastern Nebraska and Eastern Kansas, of which he has about 80,000 acres which has increased greatly in value. He leases part of the land and farms the rest, raising a large amount of grain and stock.

Name: H. T. CLARK.
Description: Chiefly made in merchandising.

Name: JOHN FITZGERALD.
Description: Made a large fortune in contracting, railroad building, etc. He is president of the First National Bank.

Name: ISAAC COE.
Description: Tie contracting, cattle raising, etc.

Name: FREDERICK KRUG.
Description: Made in brewing and real estate.

Name: S. P. MORSE.
Description: Made in drygoods.

Name: WILLIAM A. PAXTON.
Description: Army supplies, contracting, cattle, real estate and banking. He is president of the Union Trust Company. An officer in the Union Stock Yards Bank, Paxton and Vierling Iron Works, Union Stock Yards Company, First National Bank and South Omaha Land Company.

Name: JOHN A. CREIGHTON.
Description: Contracting, building Western Union Telegraph lines, cattle raising, real estate, and vice-president of First National Bank.

Name: GEORGE E. BARKER.
Description: President of Bank of Commerce. Banking and real estate.

Name: BYRON REED.
Description: Made in real estate investments.

Name: SAMUEL E. ROGERS.
Description: Made in real estate investments.

Name: HERMAN KOUNTZE.
Description: Made a large fortune in real estate and banking. President of the First National Bank.

Name: GUY C. BARTON.
Description: Made in part in cattle raising, but chiefly smelting and refining, etc. President of the Omaha and Grant Smelting and Refining Company. Vice-president of the Omaha Street Railway Company.

Name: DR. S. D. MERCER.
Description: Made principally in purchases of low-priced real estate which afterward rose in value; electric and cable street railroads in Omaha and other cities in Nebraska; and silent partner in several mercantile houses. Owner of one of the largest hotels in the city.

Name: H. T. CLARKE.
Description: Merchandising, contracting, stock raising, farming and advance in value of lands.

Name: FRANK MURPHY.
Description: Banking, street railroads, gas-works, real estate, etc. President of the Omaha Street Railroad Company and the Omaha Gas Manufacturing Company.

Name: ANDREW J. POPPLETON.
Description: Law practice and real estate. He was formerly the attorney of the Union Pacific Railroad.

Name: JOSEPH MILLARD.
Description: Banking and real estate. President of the Omaha National Bank. Director in the Union Pacific Railroad.

Name: J. A. HORBACH.
Description: Advance in value of real estate.

Name: A. J. HANSCOM.
Description: Real estate.

Name: B. F. SMITH.
Description: Investments in real estate.

Name: JOHN PROCTOR.
Description: Made a fortune in manufacturing screws.

Name: JOHN L. FARWELL.
Description: Made in real estate, railroads and banking. President of Claremont National Bank and Treasurer of Sullivan Savings Institution.

Name: NATHANIEL WHITE.
Description: Began life as a stage driver. Then in the United States and Canada Express Company, which consolidated with the American Express Company and gave him a fortune.

Name: JAMES R. HILL.
Description: Manufacture of harness and contracts therefor with the Government, and investments in lots and buildings in Concord.

Name: JONATHAN SAWYER.
Description: Made in manufacturing woollen goods.

Name: GEORGE VAN DYKE.
Description: Sawmills, lumber and timber lands.

Name: WILLIAM H. CUMMINGS.
Description: Banking, lumbering and manufacturing.

Name: ARETAS BLOOD.
Description: Made a large fortune in building the Amoskeag fire engines and locomotives. Controlling owner of the Manchester Locomotive Works. President of the Second National Bank.

Name: E. H. WINCHESTER (of Main & Winchester).
Description: Harness manufacturing here, and real estate investments in San Francisco.

Name: FRANK JONES.
Description: Began life as a pedler. Went into brewing and made a great fortune. Has invested in banks, railroads, etc. President of the Boston and Maine Railroad.

Name: CHARLES A. SINCLAIR.
Description: In brewing business with Frank Jones. Has also made much money in railroads.

Name: E. G. WALLACE (of E. G. & E. Wallace).
Description: Tanning and leather, and manufacturing boots and shoes.

Name: EDWIN WALLACE (of E. G. & E. Wallace).
Description: Tanning and leather, and manufacturing boots and shoes. President of the Rochester Loan and Banking Company.

Name: CHARLES E. TILTON.
Description: Made several millions in the wholesale liquor business in New-York City; then in banking in Portland, Ore.; and in railroads and other enterprises.

Name: DAVID RUNKLE.
Description: Iron manufacturing. Was president and principal owner of the Warren foundry of cast-iron pipe at Phillipsburg, N. J.; one of the founders and directors of the Thomas Iron Company; and owner in gas and water works, etc.

Name: JAMES A. BRADLEY.
Description: Partly in the manufacture of brushes; but mainly in the development of the real estate and hotel interests of Asbury Park.

Name: GENERAL FRANCIS S. KINNEY.
Description: Manufacturing cigarettes and investments in real estate in New-York City and in New-Jersey. Has half a million of property on Broadway alone. Director of the American Tobacco Company.

Name: MRS. J. COLEMAN DRAYTON.
Description: From the Astors of New-York. Made in real estate investments.

Name: SOLON HUMPHREYS (E. D Morgan & Co., New-York).
Description: Importing tea, sugar and coffee, and banking and negotiation of bonds. Has many investments in street railways, local bonds, etc. John T. Terry and Mr. Humphreys are now the only partners in the old firm. Director in the Peoria and Pekin Union Railway, Pittsburg and Western Railroad, etc., etc.

Name: GARRET WINANTS.
Description: City contracting, real estate and railroads.

Name: RUFUS STORY.
Description: Grain business, large transactions in pepper and spices, and real estate.

Name: JOHN I. BLAIR.
Description: Contracting, railroad building and banking. He is in the Chicago and Northwestern Railroad; New-York, Susquehanna and Western Railroad; New-York, Lackawanna and Western Railroad; Oregon Pacific Railroad; Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad, and many other enterprises.

Name: SAMUEL C. COOPER.
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate and stocks.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM M. FRANKLIN.
Description: From her father, Israel Sheldon. Made in Western lands and gas stocks. Her husband is president of the People’s Bank.

Name: CHARLES A. STERLING.
Description: In the National Storage Company, of which he is president, succeeding his father in that place.

Name: COLONEL JOHN KEAN.
Description: Inherited in part. Added to his fortune by investments in gas and water works, real estate and railroads, which have risen in value. He is president of the National State Bank and was for years vice-president of the Central Railroad of New-Jersey.

Name: MRS. JOHN KEAN.
Description: Inherited from the Fish estate, in New-York. Made in real estate.

Name: JOHN DAVIDSON.
Description: Law practice; real estate investments in New-York, Brooklyn and elsewhere; and railroads and other investments.

Name: HON. WILLIAM WALTER PHELPS.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, a large drygoods merchant. Added to by himself by purchases of real estate along the Northern Railroad of New-Jersey, where he has established several villages; and by investments in railroads, securities, etc. Director in the National City Bank, New York; United States Trust Company, etc.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM WALTER PHELPS.
Description: Inherited from her father, James E. Sheffield, of New-Haven, wholesale merchant of clothing and investor in railroads, etc.

Name: DONALD MACKAY (of Vermilye & Co., bankers, New-York City).
Description: Made in banking and numerous investments. Director in the Atlantic Trust Company, Merchants’ National Bank, New-York Stock Exchange Building Company, etc., etc. President of the Citizens’ National Bank of Englewood.

Name: MRS. JOHN VAN BUREN.
Description: Inherited. Made in law practice and real estate chiefly.

Name: E. A. BRINCKERHOFF.
Description: Cotton manufacturing. He was one of the first to establish cotton mills in the South. Part of his fortune comes through his wife by inheritance.

Name: STEWART HARTSHORNE.
Description: Made in manufacturing shade rollers, patented.

Name: CHRISTIAN ZABRISKIE.
Description: Made in rise in value of real estate and investments.

Name: JOHN STEVENS.
Description: Acquired by his father, the late Edwin A. Stevens, in the Hoboken Ferry Company and in railroad enterprises, and in the rise in value of a large quantity of water frontage and land, inherited from Colonel John Stevens. Edwin A. Stevens was president of the Hoboken Ferry Company.

Name: ROBERT L. STEVENS.
Description: Inherited from Edwin A. Stevens. Director in the Hoboken Ferry Company.

Name: C. ALBERT STEVENS.
Description: Mainly inherited from Edwin A. Stevens.

Name: RICHARD STEVENS.
Description: Same as last above.

Name: MRS. EDWIN A. STEVENS.
Description: From her husband. Made as above.

Name: JOSEPH L. LEWIS.
Description: Fortune made in the West Indies, in part, and by the closest economy and purchase of securities here. He left $1,000,000 to the United States Government to help pay the National debt.

Name: JOHN HOEY.
Description: Made in the Adams Express Company of which he was president for many years; railroads; and real estate improvement at Hollywood. Director in the Chicago Junction Railways and Stock Yards Company.

Name: BENJAMIN HARTSHORNE.
Description: Partly made in California in coasting vessels, but largely the result of rise in value of lands near the Highlands of Neversink, N. J.

Name: GEORGE R. McKENZIE.
Description: Made in the manufacture of Singer sewing machines, patented.

Name: CHARLES G. SISSON.
Description: Groceries, railroad building, railroad stocks, and real estate. He was largely interested in New-Jersey railroads. He built the Northern Railroad of New-Jersey and owned the largest part of its stock.

Name: CORNELIUS V. TRAPHAGEN.
Description: One of the first settlers of Jersey City, and at his death one of its wealthiest citizens. His fortune was made chiefly in advance in value of real estate, of which he owned large tracts.

Name: CAPT. S. D. DAVIS.
Description: Banking in New-York City, and local investments at Lakewood.

Name: FRANCIS P. FREEMAN.
Description: Made in brokerage and banking in New-York City; real estate at Lakewood, etc. Director in the New-York and Harlem Railroad.

Name: WILLIAM W. EGBERT.
Description: Made in stock speculation, brokerage business and rise in the value of real estate. He is a member of the New York Stock Exchange.

Name: HENRY S. VAN BUREN.
Description: Inherited. Made in New-York real estate.

Name: FREDERICK VAN BUREN.
Description: Inherited. Made in New-York real estate.

Name: GEORGE J. KIP.
Description: Banking in New-York and real estate in Denver and Omaha.

Name: R. KISSELL.
Description: A relative of Vanderbilt family. Made in railroads and stocks.

Name: JOHN T. FOOTE.
Description: Distilling, and Cincinnati real estate.

Name: GEORGE F. STONE.
Description: Railroads and stocks.

Name: JOHN H. SWIFT.
Description: Manufacturing hats and caps.

Name: CORNELIUS FELLOWES.
Description: Inherited from his father, William Fellowes, of New-York. Director in the Equitable Manufacturing and Electric Company.

Name: RUFUS B. GRAVES.
Description: Merchandise and cotton.

Name: MRS. AUGUSTUS S. VAN WICKLE.
Description: From her father, Ario Pardee, of Hazleton, Penn., who made a fortune of more than $10,000,000 in hard and soft coal mines, iron mines, and lumber.

Name: WILLIAM HAYWARD GIBBONS.
Description: Largely inherited. Money made mostly in real estate.

Name: BENJAMIN ATHA.
Description: Manufacturing steel.

Name: EDWARD BALLBACK.
Description: Smelting ores.

Name: JOHN RADEL.
Description: Made in Newark and South Orange street railroad, and investments.

Name: EUGENE VANDERPOOL (president of the Newark Gas Light Company).
Description: Made his fortune in gas-works, etc.

Name: EX-GOVERNOR MARCUS L. WARD.
Description: Made in real estate largely.

Name: EDWIN LESTER.
Description: Made in manufacturing agricultural implements.

Name: WILLIAM CLARK.
Description: Made in manufacturing Clark’s thread.

Name: JAMES CLARK.
Description: Made in manufacturing thread.

Name: JOHN H. BALLANTINE (of P. Ballantine & Sons).
Description: Brewing. Largely inherited from Peter Ballantine.

Name: ROBERT F. BALLANTINE (with his brother, the sole partner in P. Ballantine & Sons).
Description: Brewing. Largely inherited from Peter Ballantine.

Name: MRS. PETER B. BALLANTINE.
Description: Brewing. Largely inherited from Peter Ballantine.

Name: GOTTFRIED KRUEGER.
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: JOSEPH HENSLER.
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: A. L. DENNIS.
Description: Loans on mortgage, real estate, stocks and bonds, railroads, etc. Director in the Pennsylvania Railroad and president of a plank-road company.

Name: INSLEE A. HOPPER.
Description: In manufacturing Singer sewing machines, silk mills, banks, etc. His wife was a daughter of Isaac M. Singer.

Name: THOMAS T. KINNEY.
Description: Publishing “The Newark Advertiser,” and investment of profits in real estate and securities.

Name: BERNARD M. SHANLEY.
Description: Contracting and building.

Name: MRS. CHRISTIAN TREY.
Description: Made in brewing and real estate.

Name: JOHN H. CASE.
Description: Insurance business and president of Firemen’s Insurance Company.

Name: JOHN BRISBIN.
Description: Law practice and railroads.

Name: JACOB SHINKLE.
Description: Merchandising, and real estate investments.

Name: THEODORE MACKNET.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, Charles Macknet, who had the largest business in wholesale and retail hardware in the city. The son carried on the business many years, and invested largely in financial institutions. Was president of National State Bank, and once of Mutual Benefit Life Insurance Company.

Name: MRS. FREDERICK T FRELINGHUYSEN.
Description: Inherited.

Name: CHRISTOPHER MEYER.
Description: Made a great fortune of several millions in manufacturing rubber goods, and in investments in stocks and securities.

Name: S. COVAS.
Description: Made by importation of merchandise in New-York City.

Name: OLIVER S. CARTER.
Description: Importing tea and coffee in New-York, and banking, insurance and other stocks. Director in the Home Insurance Company, National Bank of the Republic.

Name: AARON CARTER.
Description: Jewelry business in New-York.

Name: SAMUEL LORD.
Description: Wholesale and retail drygoods in New-York City.

Name: SAMUEL COLGATE (of Colgate & Co.).
Description: Made in manufacturing fine soap.

Name: HENRY GRAVES.
Description: Banking and brokerage business and speculation. Is in several railroads.

Name: MRS. JOHN S. TILNEY.
Description: Inherited from her father, Israel Sheldon. Made in Western lands and gas stocks.

Name: JOSEPH W. STICKLER.
Description: The owner of a large fortune, made by inheritance of valuable real estate on Broad-st. and Exchange Place, New-York City, other real estate in Hoboken and Orange, and bank stocks and securities. He has added considerably to his inheritance by his own good management.

Name: JOHN WATSON.
Description: Made in tanning and cotton business in New-York City and investment of accumulations in real estate.

Name: WM. G. BOULTON (Boulton, Bliss & Dallett).
Description: Trade with South America and “Red D” line of steamers.

Name: PETER REID (of Reid & Barry).
Description: Fortune made during the past twenty years in dyeing prints and calicos.

Name: HENRY A. BARRY (of Reid & Barry).
Description: Made in dyeing prints and calicos.

Name: MOSES E. WORTHEN (of Worthen & Aldrich).
Description: Manufacturing satinets.

Name: F. A. SOULE.
Description: Made in inherited real estate and ship owning.

Name: F. W. SOULE.
Description: Made in inherited real estate and ship owning.

Name: JOHN M. HOWE.
Description: Real estate.

Name: EDO KIPP.
Description: Made in real estate.

Name: MRS. RUTH SCHULTING.
Description: From her husband. Made first in drygoods, then in real estate.

Name: W. G. FENNER (of the New-York Auction House of Field, Chapman & Fenner).
Description: Auctioneering drygoods.

Name: MRS. MARY E. RYLE.
Description: Inherited from her husband, William Ryle, and her father, Charles Danforth. Made in the importation of raw silk.

Name: CHARLES RYLE DANFORTH.
Description: Importation of raw silk.

Name: WILLIAM T. RYLE.
Description: From his father, William Ryle. Made in importing raw silk.

Name: ROBERT BARBOUR (of the Barbour Flax Spinning Company and the Barbour Bros. Co.).
Description: Made in manufacturing flax.

Name: JACOB S. ROGERS (of the Rogers Locomotive and Machine Works).
Description: Made many millions in the building of locomotives.

Name: W. T. A. STRANGE.
Description: Made in silk manufacturing.

Name: CHARLES DANFORTH.
Description: Manufacturing spinning frames and locomotives. He sold his spinning frames both in the United States and Europe; and was the founder of the Danforth Locomotive and Machine Company.

Name: MICHAEL MORRIS.
Description: Made in merchandising cotton waste and oil, judicious investment of his accumulations.

Name: J. H. McGEE.
Description: Oil refining and transportation.

Name: CHARLES HYDE.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: GEORGE H. BABCOCK.
Description: Manufacturing steam boilers. President of the Babcock & Wilcox Company, headquarters in New-York City with branches in Boston, Philadelphia, Washington, Pittsburg, Cleveland and Chicago.

Name: JAMES M. CLARK.
Description: Made in tanning and leather at St. Louis, Mo.

Name: ISAAC C. ANDERSON.
Description: Importing French goods at New-York; some umbrella and silk manufacturing, and real estate investments.

Name: JAMES R. PITCHER.
Description: Partly inherited; and increased by investments in real estate and various business enterprises, including the Tradesmen’s Bank, Merchants’ Credit and Guarantee Company, National Mutual Building and Loan Association, New-York Leather Belting Co., etc., etc. He is a director or an officer in these and other companies, and has about 1,000 acres of land at Short Hills.

Name: WARREN ACKERMAN.
Description: Made in the Lawrence Cement Company, New-York City.

Name: LEONARD APPLEBY.
Description: Merchandising tobacco and snuff in New-York; then insurance business.

Name: AUGUSTUS C. RICHEY.
Description: Law and real estate investments.

Name: WASHINGTON A. ROEBLING.
Description: Made in manufacturing iron and steel wire. His firm supplied the wire for the Brooklyn Bridge.

Name: FERDINAND W. ROEBLING.
Description: Made in manufacturing iron and steel wire.

Name: CHARLES ROEBLING.
Description: Made in manufacturing iron and steel wire.

Name: EDWARD H. STOKES.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: SAMUEL K. WILSON.
Description: Made in woollen manufacturing and in investments in real estate, which has increased largely in value.

Name: JOHN S. CHAMBERS.
Description: Operation of gas works, and investments.

Name: ABNER R. CHAMBERS.
Description: By investments in real estate, which is now included in the city.

Name: CHARLES E. GREEN (from John C. Green).
Description: Made in the China trade and investments.

Name: MRS. PAXTON (wife of the Rev. W. M. Paxton).
Description: Inherited from the James O’Hara estate at Pittsburg. Made in rise in value of real estate.

Name: JOHN H. BONN.
Description: Made in street railroads, real estate, and other local enterprises.

Name: CHARLES F. TAG.
Description: Wholesale tobacco in New-York, and investments. Director in Manhattan Trust Company, Equitable Gas Light Company, United States Equitable Gas Company, Colorado Central Consolidated Mining Company, and Toledo, St. Louis and Kansas City Railroad, Exchange Place Real Estate Company.

Name: GEORGE G. GREENE.
Description: Manufacturing patent medicines.

Name: JOHN BURKE (of Edward & John Burke).
Description: Made as American agent of the Guinness ales and porters of Dublin and importer of other liquors. He left a fortune of about $2,000,000.

Name: HENRY A. PAGE (of Faulkner, Page & Co.).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: JOHN PETTIT.
Description: Real estate and building.

Name: WILSON WADDINGHAM.
Description: Made in banking, cattle-raising and lands.

Name: T. B. CATRON.
Description: Practice of law, and large land grants, which have increased greatly in value.

Name: A. STAAB.
Description: Wholesale merchandising of groceries, etc.

Name: ERASTUS CORNING.
Description: Inherited from his father. Made, first, in merchandising hardware; then in manufacturing iron in the Albany Iron Works and in banking; but the bulk of it in the New-York Central Railroad, and pine lands. The senior Corning was the master spirit in the consolidation of the New-York Central Railroad. The present Mr. Corning is president of the Albany City National Bank and director in the New-York Central and Hudson River Railroad, United States Trust Company, etc.

Name: JAMES B. JERMAIN.
Description: Inherited. Made in railroads and investments. He has several millions and is the richest man in Albany.

Name: CHARLES B. LANSING.
Description: Real estate, insurance and banking. He was the largest individual tax-payer in Albany at the time of his death.

Name: ANTHONY N. BRADY.
Description: Made in contracting and investment of accumulations.

Name: JOHN G. MYERS.
Description: Made in wholesale and retail dry-goods and investments in banks, railroads, express companies, etc.

Name: ROBERT C. PRUYN.
Description: Made in banking and investments. President of the National Commercial Bank.

Name: STEPHEN SANFORD.
Description: Manufacturing of carpets, etc. President of the Amsterdam City National Bank.

Name: DAVID BALLENTINE.
Description: Banking and railroads. President of the First National Bank.

Name: NELSON BEARDSLEY.
Description: Banking, loans and real estate. President of Cayuga County National Bank.

Name: THEODORE P. CASE.
Description: Made a fortune in manufacturing clocks, in the Oswego Starch Company, and waterworks and other investments.

Name: D. M. OSBORNE.
Description: Made in the manufacture of patented mowing machines and reapers.

Name: DR. SYLVESTER WILLARD.
Description: Made in the Oswego Starch Company, clock manufacturing and numerous investments.

Name: N. P. BURR.
Description: Merchandising and contracts.

Name: EDWIN B. MORGAN.
Description: Made in the Wells, Fargo & Co. Express Company.

Name: GEORGE WEST.
Description: Manufacture of paper and paper bags, and investments. President of the First National Bank.

Name: JOHN W. THOMPSON.
Description: Banking, railroad investments, etc. He was heavily interested in the Delaware and Hudson Canal Company, New-York Central, etc.

Name: Mrs. DEAN RICHMOND.
Description: From her husband. Made in railroads and investments.

Name: IRA DAVENPORT.
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate in Iowa and banking and various investments.

Name: JOHN DAVENPORT.
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate in Iowa, banking and investments.

Name: Mrs. G. HOWLAND LEAVITT.
Description: From her father, Robert Willetts. Made in real estate, gas companies, street railroads, etc.

Name: OLIVER CHARLICK.
Description: Started in dealing in liquors. Then, managed George Law’s steamers to California. Then in the Eighth Avenue Street Railroad in New-York City, which he developed into a paying property. Then he went into the Long Island Railroad, and became its president. He was also interested in the Harlem and Hudson River railroads, Pacific Mail, steamboats between New-York and the Eastern States, real estate in New-York and on Long Island, etc. He also made considerable money in speculation in Wall Street.

Name: ABEL BENNETT.
Description: Manufacturing overalls and clothing business.

Name: HORACE H. CRARY.
Description: Largely interested in tanneries (of which there are ten); but his wealth came from hemlock timber lands, on which oil and natural gas were discovered after the timber had been cleared off and the land had become a burden on the hands of his firm.

Name: M. HORTON (of Horton, Crary & Co.).
Description: In part in tanneries, but mainly in oil lands.

Name: WILLIAM P. WOODCOCK.
Description: Made in real estate in New-York City and Brooklyn.

Name: DAYTON S. MORGAN (of D. S. Morgan & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing reapers and mowers; and rise in Chicago real estate. The first fifty machines ever used were made at their works for McCormick.

Name: DANIEL G. ALGER.
Description: In the brokerage business and real estate.

Name: ABRAHAM ABRAHAMS (of Wechsler & Abrahams).
Description: Large retail drygoods business.

Name: LEWIS P. ATKINSON.
Description: Stocks in Wall Street.

Name: CHARLES ARBUCKLE.
Description: Importing coffee and real estate investments. He was a member of Arbuckle Brothers, and The Arbuckle Brothers Coffee Company.

Name: JOHN ARBUCKLE.
Description: Importing coffee and real estate investments. A member of Arbuckle Brothers, and The Arbuckle Brothers Coffee Company. Director in the Importers and Traders' National Bank.

Name: CHARLES W. BETTS.
Description: Inherited land, which has since been improved.

Name: DEMAS BARNES.
Description: Merchandising and investments.

Name: OLIVER T. BEARD.
Description: Inherited. Made in wharfage and stores around the Atlantic Basin.

Name: COLONEL WILLIAM HENRY BEARD.
Description: Inherited. Made in contracting and wharfage and stores around the Atlantic Basin.

Name: HENRY BATTERMAN.
Description: In his large retail drygoods store in the Eastern District; and investments. President of the Broadway Bank.

Name: ARTHUR W. BENSON.
Description: Trustee of estates. Had investments in real estate, gas companies and financial institutions.

Name: EUGENE G. BLACKFORD.
Description: Fulton Market fish business in New-York City, real estate, banking and investments. President of the Bedford Bank.

Name: JAMES BRADY.
Description: Manufacture of clothing and loans on mortgages.

Name: COLONEL A. D. BAIRD.
Description: Stone yards, banking and investments.

Name: E. W. BLISS.
Description: Has made a large fortune in the manufacture of presses, dies, patents, etc. He supplied some of the material for the big bridge; has contracts with the United States for projectiles and torpedoes; and is largely interested in improved real estate and Brooklyn City railroads.

Name: HENRY D. BROOKMAN (of H. D. & John U. Brookman, merchants).
Description: Began his fortune in deep-sea shipping. Afterward made much money in stock and real estate investments.

Name: JOHN BULLARD.
Description: Tanning and leather business in New-York City.

Name: FRANKLIN BARTLETT.
Description: Docks and elevators on the East River front.

Name: MRS. LYDIA R. BABBITT.
Description: From Charles Pratt. Oil refining and transportation.

Name: DAVID H. BROWN.
Description: Real estate investments.

Name: EDWIN BEERS.
Description: Street railroads and banking.

Name: DAVID A. BOODY.
Description: Banking and stocks.

Name: ALFRED S. BARNES.
Description: Publishing copyrighted books.

Name: THOMAS D. CARMAN.
Description: Exporting stoves to Australia when the gold fever broke out, followed by further business of similar nature.

Name: CHESTER W. COLLINS.
Description: Contracting (with Kilpatrick Brothers in Beatrice, Neb.); real estate and cattle raising.

Name: MRS. AGNES CLAFLIN (widow of Horace B. Claflin).
Description: Made by her husband in wholesale drygoods in New-York City; and large investments in real estate above the Harlem River, and in Brooklyn.

Name: RICHARD S. CHAPEL.
Description: Shipping goods to the West from Hartford in early days; then wholesale clothing in Brooklyn.

Name: ISAAC F. CHAPMAN.
Description: Deep-sea shipping and ocean freighting and trade, and real estate. Formerly in Chapman & Flint.

Name: JOHN CLAFLIN (of H. B. Claflin & Co., New-York).
Description: Commission drygoods and investments. Director in American Exchange National Bank, Commonwealth Insurance Company, Continental Insurance Company, Fourteenth Street District Railway Company, Home Life Insurance Company, New-York Life Insurance Company, Liberty Insurance Company. Owns a large amount of real estate.

Name: S. B. CHITTENDEN.
Description: Drygoods.

Name: PETER C. CORNELL.
Description: Mostly in local gasworks, ferries and banks, but partly in manufacturing gunpowder.

Name: FELIX CAMPBELL.
Description: Manufacturing iron fitting, etc.; real estate investments, including the Park Theatre, Union Ferry Company, etc.

Name: H. T. COX.
Description: Merchandising gas fixtures in New-York.

Name: EDMUND DRIGGS.
Description: Began in sloop transportation on the Hudson. Then had a grocery store in New-York. Invested in real estate, and opened large storage warehouses in Brooklyn, in which his wealth was chiefly made. Had investments in banks, insurance companies, etc.

Name: JAMES DARRAGH (of Darragh & Small).
Description: Importation of merchandise.

Name: CORNELIUS DONNELON.
Description: Building and real estate.

Name: ANDREW DOUGHERTY.
Description: Manufacturing playing cards.

Name: JACOB G. DETTMER.
Description: Manufacturing baking powder; banking and real estate. Is in People’s Trust Company and the Bedford Bank.

Name: WILLIAM DICK (of Dick & Meyer).
Description: Sugar refining, in which he has made several millions. Director in the American Sugar Refining Company.

Name: JOHN DELMAR.
Description: Real estate and politics.

Name: SAMUEL B. DURYEA.
Description: Made largely in rise in value of Brooklyn real estate, of which he was a large owner. He left a fortune of more than $2,000,000.

Name: JOHN ENGLIS.
Description: Shipbuilding and repairing and investments. Is interested in the Wallabout Bank.

Name: JOHN R. ELY.
Description: Distilling and real estate.

Name: EDWARD E. EAMES (of H. B. Claflin & Co., New-York).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: BENJAMIN FLINT.
Description: Deep-sea shipping, ocean freighting and trade, and real estate.

Name: JOSEPH FAHY.
Description: Watch-case manufacturing.

Name: HENRY GINNEL.
Description: Importing watches and jewelry, New-York City.

Name: JOHN GIBB (of Mills & Gibb, New-York City).
Description: Importing laces and drygoods.

Name: ROBERT GRAVES.
Description: Manufacturing wall-paper.

Name: SAMUEL N. HOYT.
Description: From his brother, Jesse Hoyt, the grain merchant.

Name: JOHN H. HARBECK.
Description: Made in warehousing and stores.

Name: GEORGE HAGEMEYER.
Description: Made in the sale of hardwood lumber.

Name: S. H. HERRIMAN.
Description: By inheritance, and investments.

Name: OTTO HUBER.
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: DR. CORNELIUS N. HOAGLAND.
Description: Made a very large fortune in the manufacture of cream of tartar and baking powder, and investments in financial institutions and local real estate. President of the Cleveland Baking Powder Company.

Name: J. C. HOAGLAND.
Description: Made a very large fortune in the manufacture of cream of tartar and baking powder, and investments in financial institutions and local real estate.

Name: HENRY HENTZ.
Description: Commission coffee business and investments. Director in Bank of New-York, Commonwealth Insurance Company, Houstonic Railroad, Mechanics’ National Bank and other corporations.

Name: MARK HOYT (of Hoyt Brothers).
Description: Made in tanning and leather.

Name: DAVID H. HOUGHTALING.
Description: Tea importation and investments. Is director in United States Life Insurance Company, Bank of North America, and various railroads. Richmond Railway and Electric Company.

Name: HENRY C. HULBERT.
Description: Made in paper manufacturing and investments. Director in United States Life Insurance Company, Importers and Traders’ National Bank, New-York Mutual Insurance Company, Pullman Palace Car Company, Celluloid Company, etc.

Name: SEYMOUR L. HUSTED.
Description: Street railroads and the Brooklyn and New-York Ferry investments.

Name: JOHN HILLS.
Description: Importer of fruits.

Name: THOMAS A. HOWELL (of B. H. Howell, Son & Co.).
Description: Merchandising molasses and sugar in New-York City.

Name: BENJAMIN H. HOWELL (of B. H. Howell, Son & Co.).
Description: Merchandising sugar and molasses in New-York City. Director in the Market and Fulton National Bank.

Name: W. M. INGRAHAM.
Description: Real estate and law practice.

Name: THEODORE T. JACKSON.
Description: Real estate, law, and management of estates.

Name: HENRY T. JOURNEAY (of Journeay & Burnham).
Description: Merchandising drygoods.

Name: EDWIN F. KNOWLTON.
Description: He was a partner with his father, now deceased, in the firm of William Knowlton & Sons, manufacturers of straw goods.

Name: EBEN J. KNOWLTON.
Description: In the firm of William Knowlton & Sons, manufacturers of straw goods, in partnership with his father.

Name: ABNER C. KEENEY.
Description: Building docks, sewers, etc., and investments.

Name: JOSEPH F. KNAPP.
Description: Made in the lithographing business, and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company. He was president of the last named company.

Name: P. J. KENNEDY.
Description: Publishing copyrighted books (Catholic).

Name: MARTIN KALBFLEISCH.
Description: Manufacturing chemicals.

Name: HENRY A. KENT.
Description: Merchandising, real estate, and investments in banks, etc.

Name: GENERAL WILLIAM H. LYON.
Description: Wholesale fancy goods and notions; Western real estate; and banking. Vice-President of the Hamilton Trust Company. Director in the Bedford Bank and the Brooklyn Life Insurance Company.

Name: WILLIAM H. LANGLEY (of W. C. Langley & Co., New-York City).
Description: Inherited in large part from his father, William C. Langley. All made in merchandising woollens and rise in real estate.

Name: MRS. ELIZABETH DE W. LEONARD (wife of Louis H. Leonard).
Description: Inherited from Jeremiah P. Robinson, and made in merchandising groceries and salt; largely in the storage business and Brooklyn real estate.

Name: DAVID LEAVITT.
Description: Importation of tea; manufacture of lead; banks, ferries, insurance companies, etc. He built a war vessel for the Colombian Government and made about $100,000 thereon. He started the Brooklyn White Lead Company, controlled the Brooklyn Ferry Company, was President of the Fulton Bank and interested in the American Exchange Bank, and had stocks in railroads and many other corporations.

Name: SAMUEL LIEBMAN (of S. Liebman & Sons’ Brewing Co.).
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: ABIEL A. LOW.
Description: One of the richest men in Brooklyn. Made chiefly in importation of tea in New-York City, but added to by investments in financial institutions, real estate and local street railroads. Director in American Fire Insurance Company, Central Trust Company, Delaware and Hudson Canal Company, Greenwich Insurance Company, Low Moor Iron Company, Nassau Fire Insurance Company, National Bank of Commerce, Old Dominion Land Company, Greenwood Cemetery Company, Home Life Insurance Company, Union Trust Company, Washington Life Insurance Company.

Name: JOHN LOUGHRAN.
Description: Real estate speculations, etc. Is president of Manufacturers’ National Bank.

Name: EDWARD L. LINTON.
Description: Dealing in and investments in real estate.

Name: JOHN LEFFERTS.
Description: Real estate, inherited, which has risen in value.

Name: JOSIAH O. LOW.
Description: Made in the tea business with his brother, A. A. Low.

Name: EDWARD H. R. LYMAN.
Description: Made in importing tea, and investments. Director in Atlantic Trust Company, Low Moor Iron Company, New-York Mutual Insurance Company, etc., etc.

Name: FREDERICK LOESER.
Description: Dry-goods merchandising.

Name: JAMES LOW.
Description: Tea business, etc. Is in Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company; United States Trust Company and other corporations.

Name: JOHN MATTHEWS.
Description: Made in the manufacture of patented soda water apparatus.

Name: CHAUNCEY MARSHALL (of L. Waterbury & Co., New-York).
Description: Made in the manufacture of cordage.

Name: MRS. VICTORIA A. McKENZIE (wife of John D. McKenzie).
Description: From the estate of Francis W. Lasak, her father, who was engaged in the fur business with the original John Jacob Astor, and who had large investments in real estate.

Name: HUGH McLAUGHLIN.
Description: Politics, law and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM MARSHALL.
Description: Manufacturing rope and paper; and investments.

Name: FRANCIS MARKEY.
Description: Made in the liquor trade.

Name: WILLIAM H. MAIRS.
Description: Manufacturing paper hangings and investments in real estate. Has nearly a million in real estate.

Name: JOHN W. MASURY.
Description: Manufacturing paints and varnishes.

Name: of CORD MEYER (of Dick & Meyer).
Description: Sugar refining.

Name: JOHN T. MARTIN.
Description: Government contracts for clothing during the war, in part, but chiefly railroad reorganization schemes; and water front and other real estate. Director in the Home Life Insurance Company.

Name: MOSES MAY.
Description: Abattoir business, sale of meat, and investments. Director in First National Bank, Williamsburg Fire Insurance Company, etc.

Name: EUGENE MAXWELL.
Description: Made in railroad supplies.

Name: JAMES L. MORMAN.
Description: Manufacturing chemicals.

Name: JOHN McCONNVILLE.
Description: Drygoods in New-York.

Name: NORMAN L. MUNRO.
Description: Publishing story papers and books in New-York City.

Name: J. ROGERS MAXWELL (of Maxwell & Graves, New-York City).
Description: Brokerage business, railroads and stocks. Director in Long Island Railroad, Lehigh and Hudson River Railway, Elmira, Cortland and Northern Railroad, New-York and Long Branch railroad, Rockaway Beach Railroad, New-York, Brooklyn and Manhattan Beach Railway Company, Fidelity and Casualty Company, Central Railroad of New-Jersey, New-Jersey Southern Railroad, American Exchange National Bank, Ohio Southern Railroad, Lehigh and Wilkesbarre Coal Company; Long Beach Hotel and Cottage Company, Manhattan Beach Hotel and Land Company.

Name: HENRY E. NESMITH (of Nesmith & Sons, New-York).
Description: Shipping and commission business.

Name: ALEXANDER E. ORR.
Description: Grain commission and speculation with David Dows, and investments in stocks. Director in the United States Trust Company; American Fire Insurance Company; Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad; Fidelity and Casualty Company; Mechanics’ National Bank; National Bank of Commerce; New-York Produce Exchange Safe Deposit and Storage Company, and Union Pacific Railway.

Name: PETER J. O’DONOHUE.
Description: Importing coffee, and stock in Brooklyn Ferry and other companies.

Name: HARRIET L. PACKER.
Description: From her husband. Made in real estate and the manufacture of hats.

Name: MRS. MARY H. PRATT (widow of Charles Pratt).
Description: From her late husband, the richest man in Brooklyn. Made in oil refining and transportation, and the investment of accumulations in commercial enterprises, railroads, street-car lines, banks, steamship companies, and real estate East and West. He left a fortune of about $20,000,000.

Name: CHARLES M. PRATT.
Description: Inherited a fortune from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation. He had, however, a fortune of his own, partly by gift from his father, and greatly increased in real estate and shares in business concerns. Director in the Mechanics’ National Bank, and the Brazil Mail Steamship Company.

Name: FREDERICK B. PRATT
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: MRS. FREDERICK B. PRATT
Description: By gift from her father, ex-Senator Ladd, of Portland, Ore. Made in real estate and banking, in which it is still invested.

Name: GEORGE D. PRATT.
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: HERBERT L. PRATT.
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: JOHN S. PRATT.
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: HAROLD I. PRATT.
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: MISS HELEN F. PRATT.
Description: Inherited from Charles Pratt. Made in oil refining and transportation.

Name: FRANCIS PAIRS.
Description: Merchandising.

Name: ALFRED J. POUCH.
Description: Oil refining and transportation, real estate and cotton oil.

Name: FOSTER PETTIT.
Description: Restaurant business and real estate.

Name: LOWELL M. PALMER.
Description: Cooperage business for the sugar refineries.

Name: JOHN JAY PIERREPONT.
Description: Inherited. Investments in real estate. Director in the Greenwood Cemetery Company.

Name: HENRY E. PIERREPONT.
Description: Inherited. Investments in real estate. Director in the Home Life Insurance Company.

Name: FREDERICK H. POUCH.
Description: Oil refining and transportation, and investments in real estate.

Name: ENOS RICHARDSON.
Description: Jewelry business in New-York and investments.

Name: JOHN R. ROLFE.
Description: Real estate and investments.

Name: AARON S. ROBBINS (of Calhoun, Robbins & Co., New-York).
Description: Importing and jobbing fancy drygoods.

Name: MRS. MARIA C. ROBBINS (widow of Eli Robbins).
Description: Fulton Market poultry business.

Name: LORING A. ROBERTSON.
Description: Tanning and leather business in New-York City.

Name: JOHN RUSZTITS.
Description: Merchandising furs.

Name: ALEXANDER STUDWELL.
Description: Began his fortune in shoe-findings. Increased it by investments in bank stock, city railroads, etc., etc. Director in the New-York Life Insurance Company, Broadway Bank, and Brooklyn City Railroad Company.

Name: BENJAMIN D. SILLIMAN.
Description: Law practice, in which he earned some very large fees, with investments.

Name: JOHN J. STUDWELL.
Description: Lumber business and banking.

Name: COLONEL N. T. SPRAGUE.
Description: Partly inherited. His fortune has been chiefly made, however, by real estate investments, especially in apartment houses, of which he has more than fifty. President of Sprague National Bank.

Name: JOHN E. SEARLES.
Description: Sugar Trust and sugar-refining.

Name: HENRY K. SHELDON
Description: Miscellaneous stocks and investments.

Name: MRS. MARY J. SPROULE
Description: Inherited from her husband and an uncle.

Name: ADRIAN H. SUYDAM
Description: Made by rise in value of real estate.

Name: J. S. T. STRANAHAN
Description: Real-estate speculations chiefly, and investments in corporations. Director in the Fidelity and Casualty Company, Home Life Insurance Company.

Name: JOHN SCHULZ
Description: Made in the bakery business, one of the largest in the country.

Name: HENRY STEERS (of John C. Orr & Co.)
Description: Lumber merchandising, etc.

Name: H. B. SCHARMANN
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: AUGUSTUS STORRS
Description: Commission merchant.

Name: FREEBORN G. SMITH
Description: Manufacturing pianos.

Name: WILLIAM VAN R. SMITH (of Arbuckle Bro’s.)
Description: Importing groceries, especially coffee.

Name: FRANKLIN E. TAYLOR (of Lawrence, Taylor & Co., New-York City)
Description: Wholesale drygoods business in this firm and in its predecessors, Woodward, Lawrence & Co.

Name: MRS. GEORGE A. THAYER
Description: Inherited from David Jones, the great brewer, who had a large amount of real estate, and large investments in corporations.

Name: WILLIAM ULMER
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: SAMUEL WOOD
Description: Fur business and real estate.

Name: MISS JULIA WATERBURY
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate.

Name: HENRY WEIL
Description: Furniture making and very large real estate and other investments.

Name: C. D. WOOD
Description: Banking and securities. Was formerly with Vermilye & Co., New-York City.

Name: A. M. WHITE
Description: Inheritance and investments.

Name: OLIN G. WALBRIDGE (of Calhoun, Robbins & Co., New-York).—
Description: Importing and jobbing fancy drygoods, and investments in insurance companies, etc. Director in the Liberty Insurance Company, Manhattan Life Insurance Company.

Name: PETER WYCKOFF
Description: Real estate, inherited from his father, which has since been improved.

Name: WILLIAM H. WALLACE
Description: Iron business, banks and railroads. Vice-president of the Franklin Trust Company.

Name: WILLIAM ZIEGLER
Description: Manufacturing cream of tartar and baking powder; and real estate, of which he is one of the largest owners in Brooklyn.

Name: J. J. ALBRIGHT
Description: Wholesale dealing in coal, real estate, and asphalt paving business.

Name: MRS. TRUMAN G. AVERY
Description: Inherited a large fortune from her father, Stephen G. Austin, who made his money in real estate, loans, etc.

Name: PHILIP BECKER
Description: Grocery business and real estate.

Name: MILLS W. FARSE
Description: Inherited from his father, who made it in the oil regions mostly. Is himself a banker.

Name: JOHN BLOCKER
Description: Manufacturing leather and boots and shoes.

Name: MRS. L. B. BURR
Description: Inherited a fortune from an English relative.

Name: JACOB DOLD
Description: Pork-packing in Kansas City, etc.

Name: ROBERT L. FRYER (of Gratwick & Fryer).—
Description: Sawmills, lumber, and purchase of low-priced pine-lands.

Name: GEORGE S. FIELD.—
Description: Bridge-building.

Name: W. H. GRATWICK (of Gratwick & Fryer).—
Description: Sawmills, lumber, and purchase of low-priced pine-lands.

Name: F. H. GOODYEAR
Description: Manufacturing lumber.

Name: C. J. HAMLIN
Description: Began as a drygoods merchant, and then embarked largely in the manufacture of glucose. Has large real estate investments also.

Name: NELSON HOLLAND
Description: Lumber business and other enterprises.

Name: SHERMAN S. JEWETT
Description: Manufacturing stoves and ranges, and banking and narrow-gauge railroads in oil regions. Has other investments. He is president of the Bank of Buffalo, and director in the New-York Central and Hudson River Railroad.

Name: J. H. LEE (of Lee, Holland & Co.)
Description: Partly inherited. Made in planing-mill, the sale of lumber, and real estate.

Name: A. D. A. MILLER (of Miller, Greiner & Co.)
Description: Made in the wholesale grocery business and advance in value of real estate.

Name: PASCAL P. PRATT (of Pratt & Letchworth)
Description: Made in manufacturing saddlery hardware in part, but also in suburban real estate which has increased in value. In several banks. President of the Manufacturers and Traders’ Bank.

Name: DR. RAY V. PIERCE
Description: Manufacture of proprietary medicines, and investments. President of Buffalo Loan, Trust and Safe Deposit Company.

Name: FRANCIS H. ROOT (of Root & Keating, formerly of Jewett & Root).—
Description: First in manufacturing stoves and ranges; then in tanning and leather.

Name: B. C. RUMSEY
Description: Tanning, leather and real estate.

Name: D. P. RUMSEY
Description: Tanning, leather and real estate.

Name: JEWETT M. RICHMOND
Description: Dealing in grain, real estate and banking.

Name: SIDNEY SHEPARD
Description: Merchandising hardware and investments in railroads and telegraph lines.

Name: J. T. SCHELLKOPF
Description: First in tanning, then in brewing, and also in chemical works and milling.

Name: JACOB SCHEU
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: JONATHAN SCOVILLE
Description: Car-wheel manufacturing and outside investments.

Name: JOHN SATTERFIELD (of H. L. Taylor & Co.)
Description: Oil producing.

Name: MRS. ROBERT SQUIRES
Description: From her father, William G. Fargo. Made in express business.

Name: ELBRIDGE G. SPAULDING
Description: Banking in part, but largely in real estate and other investments. President of the Farmers and Mechanics’ National Bank.

Name: HASKEL L. TAYLOR (of H. L. Taylor & Co.)
Description: Made in oil-producing.

Name: GEORGE URBAN
Description: Flour mill and real estate. Largely inherited from his father, George Urban, sr.

Name: GEORGE L. WILLIAMS
Description: From his father, the late Gibson T. Williams, who made a fortune in ship-chandlery business and tanning originally; but the bulk of it in real estate and banking.

Name: C. H. WILLIAMS
Description: Capitalist.

Name: JOHN WILKESON
Description: Grain elevator and real estate.

Name: JAMES McKECHNIE
Description: Brewing.

Name: ALEXANDER McKECHNIE.—
Description: Brewing.

Name: SMITH M. WEED
Description: Made in iron mining. President of The Chateaugay Ore and Iron Company; Hudson River Ore and Iron Company; New-York Mutual Savings and Loan Association. Director in the Nicaragua Canal Construction Company, etc.

Name: AMORY HOUGHTON, JR
Description: Manufacturing glassware, coal mines, etc.

Name: Q. W. WELLINGTON
Description: Private banking and investments in real estate.

Name: F. A. DRAKE
Description: Pennsylvania coal-mines, railroads and merchandising.

Name: JOSEPH FELLOWS
Description: Real estate, etc. He was agent of the Pulteney Estate and great landed interests.

Name: WILLIAM RANDALL
Description: Private banking, merchandising, real estate, etc.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM CONSTABLE
Description: From her father, Henry Barclay, of New-York, who made a fortune in real estate.

Name: ALFRED C. CLARK
Description: Planing mills and lumber.

Name: ALFRED DOLGE
Description: Manufacturing piano materials and rise in value of real estate.

Name: J. JENNINGS McCOMB
Description: Manufacture of the patented iron cotton tie, with investments in real estate in New-York City. Chief owner of the Navarro apartment houses.

Name: JOSEPH STINER (of Joseph Stiner & Co., New-York)
Description: Tea merchant. Has fifteen or more branch stores.

Name: FREDERICK J. STONE
Description: Stocks and law practice.

Name: GEORGE P. CLAPP
Description: From his late wife, Mrs. Desler A. Clapp, who inherited about four millions from her uncle, the late John Alstyne, whose fortune was made in banking and real estate.

Name: MATTHEW H. ARNOT
Description: From his father, John Arnot, the banker. Worth several millions. President of the Chemung Canal Bank.

Name: THOMAS BRIGGS
Description: In the brewing business.

Name: HENRY C. SPAULDING
Description: Manufacturing lumber and dealing in same.

Name: SOLOMON GILLET
Description: Manufacturing.

Name: DR. EDWIN ELDRIDGE
Description: Iron manufacturing, coal mines and Erie railroad.

Name: FREDERICK A. PALMER
Description: President of the Broadway Savings Bank in New-York City. Made in banking.

Name: JOHN W. LAWRENCE
Description: Partly inherited, this part of his fortune being made in real estate. He was himself a successful merchant in New-York City.

Name: HIRAM DURYEA
Description: Starch manufacturing at Glen Cove, Long Island. He is president of the National Starch Manufacturing Company, and of the United States Trade Mark Association. Director in the Glen Cove Machine Company.

Name: JOHN D. PATTERSON
Description: Made chiefly in real estate in California.

Name: JEREMIAH W. FINCH (of Finch & Pruyn)
Description: Sawmills, lumber and banking. President of the Glens Falls National Bank.

Name: W. T. RUSSELL
Description: Partly inherited. Banking.

Name: GEORGE MURRAY
Description: Partly inherited. Banking.

Name: MRS. E. S. BACON
Description: From her father, Brandreth. Made in manufacture of proprietary medicines.

Name: IRA SHAFER
Description: Law practice, real estate, and investments on dividend paying securities.

Name: DR. ROBERTS
Description: Made in railroad securities.

Name: WALTER A. WOOD
Description: Manufacturing patented mowers and reapers.

Name: PAUL N. SPOFFORD
Description: Inherited. Made in the commission business and real estate. Director in the Ninth Avenue Railroad, New-York City.

Name: JOSEPH L. SPOFFORD
Description: Inherited. Made in the commission business and real estate.

Name: DAVID DOWS, JR.
Description: Inherited from his father, David Dows, who made a large fortune in grain in New-York City, railroads and banking. Director in the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad and Corn Exchange Bank.

Name: MISS MARY DOWS
Description: Inherited from her father, David Dows, who made a large fortune in grain in New-York City, railroads and banking.

Name: TRACY DOWS
Description: Inherited from his father, David Dows, who made a large fortune in grain in New-York City, railroads and banking.

Name: MRS. MARGARET W. DUNHAM (wife of Dr. Carroll Dunham)
Description: Inherited from her father, David Dows, who made a large fortune in grain in New-York City, railroads and banking.

Name: GEORGE B. COOKSEY
Description: From his wife, a daughter of David Dows.

Name: ARTHUR L. BARNEY
Description: Made in the express business and freighting on the lakes.

Name: JOHN T. TERRY (of E. D. Morgan & Co.)
Description: Importing tea, coffee and sugar; negotiation of bonds and banking. Director in the Bank of New-Amsterdam, American Exchange National Bank, American Fire Insurance Company, Texas and Pacific Railroad, Wabash Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Company, International Ocean Telegraph Company, Peoria and Pekin Union Railroad, American Telegraph and Cable Company, Central Park, North and East River Railroad, Mercantile Trust Company, Metropolitan Trust Company, St. Louis, Iron Mountain and Southern Railroad.

Name: MRS. MARIA WHITNEY LIVINGSTON (wife of Robert C. Livingston)
Description: By inheritance from the estate of Stephen Whitney, the great New-York merchant. Made in merchandising, real estate and investments.

Name: HENRY W. SAGE
Description: Made many millions in the purchase of cheap pine lands in Michigan and sale of lumber therefrom.

Name: WILLIAM H. SAGE
Description: Made in pine lands in Michigan and sale of lumber therefrom.

Name: ANDREW D. WHITE
Description: Largely inherited. Made in banking and investments.

Name: EX-JUDGE DOUGLASS BOARDMAN
Description: Law, banking and investments. He was president of the First National Bank.

Name: JOHN RUMSEY
Description: Banking and railroads.

Name: PROFESSOR WILLARD FISKE
Description: Inheritance through his wife from John McGraw. Made in lumber and pine lands.

Name: EZRA CORNELL
Description: Telegraph lines, banks, railroads, etc.

Name: JOHN H. CORDTS
Description: Local real estate, banks, water works and brick-yards.

Name: EDWARD TRACY
Description: Malting, brewing and real estate investments.

Name: HORATIO G. ONDERDONK
Description: Mostly real estate.

Name: ROBERT H. BERDELL
Description: Made in the Erie Railroad and speculation.

Name: HENRY R. LOW
Description: Railroad building, railroads, real estate and investments in factories.

Name: WATSON B. DICKERMAN
Description: Brokerage business and stocks. President of New-York Stock Exchange.

Name: WILLIAM G. READ
Description: Stocks and brokerage business.

Name: JAMES M. WENTZ
Description: Importation of drygoods, chiefly. Director in the Mercantile National Bank, New-York. Vice-president of a large savings bank in Newburgh to which he devotes much time.

Name: WARREN DELANO
Description: Made in the China tea trade, with investment of profits.

Name: CHARLES S. JENKINS
Description: Ship chandlery and shipping business and investments.

Name: FRANCIS R. RIVES
Description: Partly by inheritance. Was for many years with Alexander Hamilton, mainly in real-estate law. He left over $2,000,000, mainly in real estate.

Name: CLARKSON N. POTTER
Description: Partly inherited. Made in law practice and investments.

Name: ADRIAN A. POTTER (of Pottier, Stymus & Co., New-York)
Description: Manufacture of high-class furniture and rise in real estate.

Name: WILLIAM B. KENDALL
Description: Manufacturing carpets; banks, railroads, insurance companies, etc.

Name: CHARLES G. MILLER
Description: Banking in Wall-st., New-York.

Name: CHARLES AUGUSTUS CHESEBROUGH
Description: Inherited from his mother, Mrs. Margaret Chesebrough, widow of Andronicus Chesebrough, a large quantity of real estate at Fort Washington, New-York City, and elsewhere. The estate was valued at $4,000,000.

Name: ROBERT H. ARKENBURGH
Description: Cigar manufacturing, wholesale leaf trade, and real estate in New-York City.

Name: GEORGE M. HARD
