Description: Manufacture and sale of paints and colors. Director in the Market and Fulton National Bank, etc.

Name: JOHN H. DAVIS.
Description: Brokerage business in Wall-st., also by inheritance, the latter part of his fortune having been made in real estate.

Name: MRS. JOHN W. DAVIS.
Description: Fortune made in real estate. She has a very large property.

Name: DUCHESS DE DINO (Adele L. Sampson).
Description: Inherited from the Sampson estate. Made in the auction business and the Chemical Bank. She married Fred. A. Stevens, and then the Marquis de Talleyrand-Perigord, whose title was changed to Duke de Dino.

Name: ARTHUR M. DODGE (of Dodge, Meigs & Co.).
Description: Largely inherited from his father, William E. Dodge, who made a fortune in importing metals and purchase of lumber lands. Added to by himself in exportation of lumber.

Name: CLEVELAND H. DODGE (of Phelps, Dodge & Co.).
Description: Made in importing metals and in the Ansonia Brass and Copper Company; director of the Commercial Mining Company, Copper Queen Consolidated Mining Co., National City Bank, etc., etc.

Name: NORMAN W. DODGE.
Description: Largely inherited from William E. Dodge, who made a large fortune in importing metals and the purchase of low-priced lumber lands. Added to by himself in the exportation of lumber. Director in the Hilton & Dodge Lumber Company, of Georgia. President of the Normandale Lumber Company.

Name: GEORGE E. DODGE (of Dodge, Meigs & Co.).
Description: Largely inherited from William E. Dodge. Added to by exportation of lumber by himself.

Name: MRS. GEORGE E. DODGE.
Description: From her father, Frederick H. Cossitt, who made a fortune in merchandising and real estate.

Name: WILLIAM E. DODGE JR. (of Phelps, Dodge & Co.).
Description: Largely inherited from his father, William E. Dodge, who made a fortune in importing metals and purchase of lumber lands. Added to by himself in importing metals. Director in the Ansonia Brass and Copper Company, Copper Queen Consol. Mining Company, Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company, Commercial Mining Company, Detroit Copper Mining Company, New-York Life Insurance and Trust Company, etc., etc.

Name: REV. DAVID STUART DODGE.
Description: From his father, William E. Dodge, made in importing metals and purchase of lumber lands.

Name: CHARLES C. DODGE.
Description: From his father, William E. Dodge. Made as above explains.

Name: HENRY DAY.
Description: Law practice and investments.

Name: ALFRED DE CORDOVA (of Alfred De Cordova & Son).
Description: Stock brokerage business.

Name: SIDNEY DILLON.
Description: Made in the building and management of railroads. President of the Union Pacific Railroad. Director in the Canada Southern Railroad, Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad, Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad, Wabash Railroad, Mercantile Trust Company, Safe Deposit Company of New-York, New-York, Lackawanna and Western Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Company, etc., etc.

Name: FLORENCE DELAPLAINE.
Description: Largely inherited from John W. Delaplaine. Made in shipping and rise in value of real estate.

Name: THOMAS DICKSON.
Description: Coal mines in Pennsylvania and iron mines in New-York and Pennsylvania. Director in the Delaware and Hudson Canal Company.

Name: PATRICK DICKIE.
Description: He left a fortune of about $2,750,000, made in the drug business and investments in real estate, etc.

Name: CHAUNCEY M. DEPEW.
Description: Made in railroads, of a large number of which he is either president or director. President of the New-York Central and Hudson River Railroad, the New-York and Harlem Railroad, West Shore Railroad, and Dunkirk, Alleghany Valley and Pittsburg Railroad. Director in the Chicago Junction Railways and Stockyards Company; Chicago and Northwestern Railway; Chicago, St. Paul, Minneapolis and Omaha Railway; Equitable Life Assurance Society; Delaware and Hudson Canal Company; Merchants’ Dispatch Transportation Company; Michigan Central Railroad; New-York, Chicago and St. Louis Railroad; New-York, New-Haven and Hartford Railroad; Pine Creek Railway; Syracuse, Geneva and Corning Railroad; Union Trust Company; Western National Bank; Western Union Telegraph Company; and Kensico Cemetery Company, etc., etc.

Name: Mrs. HORTENSE P. DOUGLAS.
Description: From her husband, Horton Douglas. Made in real estate.

Name: ROBERT G. DUN (of R. G. Dun & Co. Mercantile Agency).
Description: Made in successful real estate operations in city property and in Mercantile Agency reporting on credits, resulting solely from the creation of internal commerce.

Name: CHARLES DEVLIN.
Description: Made in building railroads and other public works.

Name: CHARLES W. DURANT.
Description: Railroads and investments in real estate.

Name: JOHN DELAMATER.
Description: Building, and investments in banks, insurance companies, etc.

Name: JOHNSON DE PEYSTER.
Description: Inherited. Made in real estate chiefly.

Name: General JOHN WATTS DE PEYSTER.
Description: Inherited from his father, Frederic De Peyster. Made almost wholly in real estate.

Name: NICHOLAS DE PEYSTER.
Description: Partly inherited, but he made a fortune for himself in California.

Name: FREDERIC DE PEYSTER.
Description: Inherited from the family estate. Made in real estate.

Name: HENRY McBRIDE DAVIDSON.
Description: Manufacturing in Albany, but chiefly in steamboating on the Hudson with Van Santvoord, and investments in real estate.

Name: Mrs. MARGARET E. DOWS.
Description: Widow of David Dows, from whom she inherited. Made in grain, railroads and banking.

Name: JOHN DWIGHT.
Description: Manufacturing soda and saleratus; and investments in real estate.

Name: HENRY J. DAVISON.
Description: Engineering works; building gas plants; and exporting steamboats and machinery to South America.

Name: FREDERICK W. DUNTON.
Description: Railroads. Director in the Chicago and Ohio River Railroad, Elmira, Cortland and Northern Railroad, New-York and Rockaway Beach Railroad, New-York, Brooklyn and Manhattan Beach Railroad, etc., etc.

Name: HENRY DEXTER.
Description: Merchandising newspapers and books, and investments in real estate. He is an officer in the American News Company.

Name: JOHN P. DUNCAN (of John Duncan’s Sons).
Description: Made in importation of groceries and wholesale dealing in same. Also, rise in real estate.

Name: JAMES H. DUNHAM (of Dunham, Buckley & Co.).
Description: Importation and sale of drygoods and outside investments. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society, etc.

Name: HENRY P. DEGRAAF.
Description: Made in banking, furniture and real estate. President of the Bowery Bank. Director in the De Graaf & Taylor Co., etc.

Name: JAMES M. DAVIS.
Description: Brokerage business in Wall Street.

Name: DUCHESS DECAZES (Isabella Singer).
Description: From her father, Isaac M. Singer. Made in the manufacture of the Singer Sewing Machine.

Name: GEORGE B. DE FOREST.
Description: Made in railroads and stocks. Inherited.

Name: BENJAMIN L. DE FOREST.
Description: Railroads and stocks.

Name: MRS. SUSANNA J. DANNATT (widow of William H. Dannatt, a wealthy lumber dealer).
Description: Principally from her brother, David Jones, the great brewer, who conducted an enormous business and had large investments in real estate, telegraph and insurance companies, banks, etc.

Name: MRS. HENRY DALLEY, JR.
Description: Inherited from several wealthy relatives.

Name: DAVID L. EINSTEIN.
Description: Made in the manufacture and sale of woollen goods. Director in the Swan Incandescent Electric Light Company; Brush Electric Illuminating Company; Brush-Swan Electric Light Company, etc.

Name: AMOS R. ENO.
Description: Merchandising drygoods first; but chiefly in real estate, including the Fifth Avenue Hotel, and banking. Has large investments. Director in the Second National Bank. Worth many millions.

Name: AMOS F. ENO.
Description: Real estate and investments. Director in the Jefferson Insurance Company, etc.

Name: JOHN W. ELLIS (of Charles D. Lanier & Co.).
Description: Banking. Director in the Metropolitan Trust Company and has other investments.

Name: PHILIP EBLING (of the Philip & William Ebling Brewing Company).
Description: Made in brewing and real estate.

Name: JOHN EICHLER.
Description: Brewing and real estate. President of the John Eichler Brewing Company.

Name: STEPHEN B. ELKINS.
Description: Made a start in New-Mexico in banking, law, land, and other local interests. Then came East and engaged in coal mining, railroads, etc., in West Virginia. Director in the West Virginia Coal Company; Small Hopes Consolidated Mining Company (silver), Leadville Consolidated Mining Company, etc., etc. Now Secretary of War.

Name: RICHARD H. EWART (of William Ewart & Son).
Description: Importing linen goods.

Name: SMITH ELY.
Description: Tanning and leather, and investments in real estate.

Name: EDWIN EINSTEIN.
Description: Manufacturing woollen goods. President of the Swan Incandescent Electric Light Company. Director in the Alabama Mineral Land Company, Brush-Swan Electric Light Company, etc.

Name: AMBROSE K. ELY.
Description: Tanning and leather.

Name: JAMES EVERARD.
Description: Brewing and real estate. Director in the Fifth National Bank.

Name: TIMOTHY C. EASTMAN (of Eastman’s Co.).
Description: Exportation of cattle and dressed beef. Director in the West Side Bank, and has many real estate and other investments.

Name: THOMAS A. EDISON.
Description: Inventions of telegraphic and electric light apparatus, from which he receives a royalty, or which he has sold to the companies in which he is interested. Director in The Edison Electric Illuminating Company, Edison Electric Light Company, General Edison Electric Company, Edison Ore Milling Company, Edison Spanish Colonial Light Company.

Name: WILLIAM P. EARLE.
Description: Made originally in Earle’s Hotel, and added to by investments in real estate, etc.

Name: GEORGE EHRET.
Description: Made in brewing and real estate. His fortune amounts to several millions.

Name: THOMAS J. ECKERT.
Description: Has made a fortune in telegraph and railroad development. Director in the Western Union Telegraph Company, American Telegraph and Cable Company, Gold and Stock Telegraph Company, New-York Mutual Telegraph Company, Southern Bell Telephone and Telegraph Company, American District Telegraph Company, International Ocean Telegraph Company, Texas and Pacific Railway, Missouri Pacific Railway, Mercantile Trust Company, etc., etc.

Name: DANIEL R. ELDER.
Description: Sugar refining.

Name: HENRY M. FLAGLER.
Description: Has made one of the great fortunes of the United States in petroleum oil producing, refining and transporting. Has numerous investments in the best-paying railroad and other companies, and large hotel, land and railroad interests in Florida. Director in the Standard Oil Co., Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railway, Florida Construction Co., Minnesota Iron Co., Duluth & Iron Range Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Co., International Bank Note Co., Jacksonville, Tampa and Key West Railway, etc., etc.

Name: JOHN H. FLAGLER.
Description: Producing, refining and transporting petroleum oil, and investments. Director in the Bank of North America, etc.

Name: E. B. FABBRI (of Drexel, Morgan & Co.).
Description: Made in banking and investments. Partly inherited.

Name: MISS SOPHIA R. FURNISS.
Description: Inherited from her father, William P. Furniss, who made a fortune in shipping and real estate.

Name: MISS CLEMENTINA FURNISS.
Description: From her father, William P. Furniss. Made as above.

Name: MRS. CAROLINE FRAME (wife of Charles P. Frame).
Description: Inherited from her grandfather, Samuel Willetts. Made in merchandising hardware, whaling, and investments in real estate and securities.

Name: MAXIMILIAN FLEISCHMANN (of Fleischmann Bros.).
Description: Manufacture of compressed yeast.

Name: CHARLES B. FOSDICK.
Description: Tanning and leather chiefly, but added to by judicious investment of accumulations. President of the Hide and Leather National Bank. Director in the Second National Bank, Fifth Avenue Safe Deposit Co., Oregon Railway and Navigation Co., and other companies.

Name: JOHN R. FORD.
Description: Made in rubber and other business enterprises. Director in the Home Insurance Co., New-York Mutual Gas Light Co., etc.

Name: PATRICK FLANNAGAN.
Description: Brewing and real estate.

Name: MRS. ROSWELL P. FLOWER.
Description: From her father, Henry Keep, who made a fortune in railroads.

Name: ROSWELL P. FLOWER (of R. P. Flower & Co., brokers).
Description: Made in railroads, stock brokerage, and trusteeship of the Henry Keep estate. Director in the Duluth and Iron Range Railroad, Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad, Minnesota Iron Co., N. Y. Security and Trust Co., H. H. Babcock Co., etc.

Name: HARRIS C. FAHNESTOCK.
Description: Banking and investments. President of the Bankers’ Safe Deposit Company. Director in the First National Bank, New-Jersey Southern Railroad, Central Railroad of New-Jersey, Tide Water Pipe Company, Bankers’ Safe Deposit Company, National Water Works Investment Company, New-York and Long Branch Railroad Company, etc.

Name: CHARLES M. FRY.
Description: Banking. President of the Bank of New-York. Director in the American Contracting and Dredging Company, Atlantic and Charlotte Air-Line Railway, Equitable Gas-Light Company, etc.

Name: BIRNEY FELLOWES.
Description: Inherited from William Fellowes, his father.

Name: TERENCE FARLEY.
Description: Contracting, building and real estate.

Name: CHARLES FARGO.
Description: Partly inherited, and all made in the express business, with investment of accumulations. Director in the American Express Company, Wells, Fargo & Co., Merchants’ Dispatch Transportation Company, etc. Interested in the Elgin Watch factory.

Name: JAMES C. FARGO.
Description: Partly inherited and all made in the express business. Director in the American, National, and Wells, Fargo & Co. express companies, and the Merchants’ Dispatch Transportation Company.

Name: MRS. GEORGIANA FARGO.
Description: From her father, William G. Fargo, of Buffalo, N. Y., who made a fortune of three or four millions in the Wells, Fargo & Co. express company.

Name: ALEXANDER J. FORBES-LEITH.
Description: Made mainly in manufacturing iron and steel, especially Bessemer steel, at Joliet, Ill. Director in the Illinois Steel Company.

Name: STUYVESANT FISH.
Description: Inherited a fortune made chiefly in real estate. He has added to it largely by investments and great business ability. President of the Illinois Central and the Chicago, St. Louis and New-Orleans railroads. Director in the Mutual Life Insurance Company, National Park Bank, New-York Life Insurance and Trust Company, etc.

Name: BENJAMIN H. FIELD.
Description: Made in the China trade and investment of accumulations. Director in the Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company, Bank for Savings, Greenwood Cemetery Company.

Name: MRS. CORTLANDT DE PEYSTER FIELD (Virginia Hamersly).
Description: From her father, John W. Hamersly. Made in lands in this city and their rise in value with the growth of the town.

Name: HICKSON W. FIELD.
Description: Made in rise in value of real estate. Part owner in the New-York Hotel property, among other things.

Name: HAMILTON FISH.
Description: Made in inherited real estate and law practice.

Name: ELISHA M. FULTON.
Description: Made in the manufacture of cordage. President of the Elizabethport, N. J., Cordage Company.

Name: CHARLES R. FLINT (of Flint & Co.).
Description: Made in deep-sea sailing ships, which the firm built in their own yards in Maine, for themselves, and in South American trade. Director in the Export Lumber Company, Mutual District Messenger Company, National Bank of the Republic, State Trust Company, United States and Brazil Mail Steamship Company, etc.

Name: HERMAN FLEITMAN (of Fleitman & Co.).
Description: Importation and sale of drygoods.

Name: WILLIAM DOUGLAS FARWELL.
Description: Merchandising drygoods.

Name: WILLIAM H. FOGG.
Description: Drygoods commission business, trade with China, and importation of tea and silk. He left a fortune of $3,000,000.

Name: BENJAMIN FITCH.
Description: Merchandising drygoods.

Name: CHRISTIAN F. FUNCH.
Description: Ocean transportation.

Name: C. P. FISCHER.
Description: Made in importing sugar and coffee, and in coasting steamers.

Name: D. B. FAYERWEATHER.
Description: Made in tanning and leather. Several millions.

Name: JOHN T. FARISH.
Description: Merchandising and investments.

Name: THOMAS FAYE.
Description: Manufacture of paper-hangings, and advance in value of real estate, of which he was a large owner. He had about thirty acres on the Island of Manhattan.

Name: HARVEY P. FARRINGTON.
Description: Made in steamboating, ice, and investments. Director in the Hudson River Line of Steamboats, Lincoln Safe Deposit Company, etc.

Name: JOSIAH M. FISKE.
Description: Grain and flour, with outside investments. Director in the American Exchange National Bank, Brush Electric Illuminating Company, Peoria and Buncam Valley Railroad, etc., etc.

Name: GEORGE FOLSOM.
Description: Made a fortune in law, banking and investments in silver mining, real estate, etc.

Name: JOHN C. FURMAN.
Description: Left over a million, made by advance in value of real estate.

Name: CHARLES N. FEARING.
Description: Made in the drygoods business.

Name: JOHN F. FLANAGAN.
Description: Made in the great grocery business conducted by him.

Name: JAY GOULD.
Description: Possessor of one of the leading fortunes of the United States. Made his start in Delaware County, N. Y., in merchandising maps and a local history written by himself. Then in larger operations, including speculation in Wall Street in stocks and gold, and in railroad and telegraph combinations and development. President of the Missouri Pacific Railway, Manhattan Elevated Railway, and the Texas and Pacific Railway. Director and large owner in the Western Union Telegraph Company, Gold and Stock Telegraph Company, Oregon Shore Line and Utah Railroad, Peoria and Pekin Union Railway Company, St. Louis, Iron Mountain and Southern Railroad, Union Pacific Railway, American Telegraph and Cable Company, Pacific Mail Steamship Company, etc., etc.

Name: MRS. JAY GOULD.
Description: Partly inherited from her father, a great grocery merchant, and increased by her husband by investments.

Name: GEORGE J. GOULD.
Description: Chiefly from his father, Jay Gould, in many of whose companies the son is a part owner and director. He has added to his fortune by his own operations. He is vice-president of the Manhattan Elevated Railway, and director in the East Tennessee, Virginia and Georgia Railway, Missouri Pacific Railway, Texas and Pacific Railway, Gold and Stock Telegraph Company, International Ocean Telegraph Company, New-York Bank Note Company, New-York Mutual Telegraph Company, Pacific Mail Steamship Company, St. Louis, Iron Mountain and Southern Railway, Wabash Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Company, American District Telegraph Company, American Speaking Telephone Company, and other concerns.

Name: EDWIN GOULD.
Description: Chiefly from his father, Jay Gould, in several of whose companies he has an interest and a share in the management. Director in the International Ocean Telegraph Company, Manhattan Elevated Railway, St. Louis, Arkansas and Texas Railway, Western Union Telegraph Company, American District Telegraph Company, American Speaking Telephone Company, etc.

Name: MRS. MARY J. GRIFFITHS.
Description: From David Jones, the great brewer, who had several large establishments, and large investments in banks, telegraph and insurance companies, real estate, etc.

Name: MRS. HANNAH G. GERRY (widow of Thomas R. Gerry).
Description: Inherited from her brothers, Peter and Robert Goelet. Made in merchandising and rise in value of real estate. She has a very large quantity of real estate.

Name: ELBRIDGE T. GERRY.
Description: Inherited from the Goelets. Made in merchandising and real estate and various investments. Is himself in law.

Name: MRS. ELBRIDGE T. GERRY (Louisa M. Livingston).
Description: From her father, Robert J. Livingston. Made in investments in real estate chiefly.

Name: ROBERT GOELET.
Description: One of the leading men of wealth of New-York City. His fortune has been inherited from the Goelet family. It was founded originally in merchandising, followed by purchases of real estate, then low-priced, but now enormously valuable, situated on Broadway and in others of the best parts of the city. Director in the Chemical Bank, Metropolitan Opera House, New-York Life Insurance and Trust Company, etc.

Name: OGDEN GOELET.
Description: Inherited a great fortune from the Goelet family. Made as above.

Name: FRANCIS F. GUNTHER (of C. G. Gunther & Sons).
Description: Inherited from his father, Christian G. Gunther. Made in the sale of furs and real estate investments.

Name: JOHN CHARLES GUNTHER (of C. G. Gunther & Sons).
Description: Inherited. Made in the fur business and real estate.

Name: ERNEST R. GUNTHER (of C. G. Gunther & Sons).
Description: Sale of furs and rise in real estate.

Name: FRANKLIN L. GUNTHER (of C. G. Gunther & Sons).
Description: Sale of furs and rise in real estate.

Name: JOHN A. C. GRAY.
Description: Made in drygoods, real estate, etc.

Name: ALBERT H. GALLATIN.
Description: Inherited from Albert R. Gallatin. Made in banking and real estate.

Name: JOHN GOOD.
Description: Cordage manufacturing. His plants are in Brooklyn and Ravenswood.

Name: WALTER S. GURNEE.
Description: Made in banking, brokerage, mining and railroads. Director in the United Smelting and Refining Company, Colorado Smelting Company, Chrysolite Silver Mining Company, American Surety Company, Montana Smelting Company, etc., etc.

Name: MRS. LETITIA R. GARRISON.
Description: From her late husband, Cornelius K. Garrison. Made in ocean steamers and railroads.

Name: MRS. WM. R. GARRISON.
Description: From her husband, Wm. R. Garrison and his father, Cornelius K. Garrison. Made in ocean steamers and railroads.

Name: MALCOLM GRAHAM (of the former firm of Schuyler, Hartley & Graham, now known as Hartley & Graham).
Description: Made in the wholesale jewelry business and dealing in fire arms. Now has an interest in the Remington Arms Company. He inherited some money from his father, Colonel John L. Graham, a merchant.

Name: FREDERIC GALLATIN.
Description: Inherited from Albert R. Gallatin. Made in banking and real estate.

Name: JAMES GALLATIN.
Description: Inherited from Albert R. Gallatin, banking and real estate.

Name: MRS. CHARLOTTE MATILDA GOODRIDGE (wife of Frederic Goodridge).
Description: From her mother, Matilda Ann Grosvenor. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: MRS. RACHEL M. GILSEY (widow of John Gilsey).
Description: Made by Peter Gilsey, first in merchandising cigars and tobacco at retail, but chiefly in investments in real estate, on Broadway, including the Gilsey House, now exceedingly valuable.

Name: ANDREW GILSEY.
Description: Inherited from Peter Gilsey. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: CHARLES GILSEY.
Description: Inherited from Peter Gilsey. Made as above.

Name: PETER GILSEY.
Description: Inherited from Peter Gilsey. Made as above.

Name: HENRY GILSEY.
Description: Inherited from Peter Gilsey. Made as above.

Name: MRS. LUCY GILSEY (wife of Henry Gilsey).
Description: Inherited from her father, George M. Varlan, a large quantity of real estate, part of an old farm, now overgrown by the city.

Name: GEORGE F. GILMAN.
Description: Merchandising tea, and inheritance from his father, Nathaniel Gilman, the leather merchant and tanner.

Name: JAMES A. GARLAND.
Description: Has made a large fortune in banking and investments. Vice-President of the First National Bank. Director in the Central Railroad of New-Jersey, Lehigh Valley and Wilkesbarre Coal Company, New York and Long Branch Railroad, Bankers Safe Deposit Company, etc.

Name: WILLIAM R. GRACE (of William R. Grace & Co.).
Description: Has made several millions in the export and import trade with South America, and in shipping. Has many investments. Director in the Lincoln National Bank, Lincoln Safe Deposit Company, New-York Bank Note Company, American Sulphur Company of West Virginia, etc.

Name: MICHAEL P. GRACE (of William R. Grace & Co.).
Description: Made in trade with South America and shipping.

Name: JOHN W. GRACE (of William R. Grace & Co.).
Description: Trade with South America and shipping.

Name: RANDOLPH GUGGENHEIMER.
Description: In the practise of law and promoting.

Name: JOHN GREEN.
Description: Contracting, street railroads, and for several years president of the Central Safe Deposit Company.

Name: MRS. SARAH HELEN GREEN (widow of John C. Green).
Description: From her husband, who made a fortune of several millions in the China trade, first with N. L. & G. Griswold, in New-York City, and then in the house of Russell & Co., in China. He returned later to New-York and engaged in business here, having numerous investments in banks and other companies.

Name: CHESTER GRISWOLD.
Description: From his father, John A. Griswold, of Troy, who with John F. Winslow owned the patents for manufacturing Bessemer steel in this country. John A. Griswold began life in the wholesale and retail drug business; a partner next in the Rensselaer Iron Company; and then, by consolidation with Erastus Corning, the owner of the largest rolling mill and iron works in the country, with Bessemer steel works at Troy; blast furnaces at Fort Edward and on the Hudson, and an iron mine in the Champlain region. Chester Griswold is a director in the Hudson River Ore and Iron Company; Colorado Coal and Iron Company; Adirondack Railway, and other enterprises; president of the Crown Point Iron Company.

Name: MRS. HARRIET A. GARNER (widow of Thomas Garner).
Description: From her husband, who made a great fortune, amounting to more than $5,000,000, in manufacturing cotton goods. He had large mills at Cohoes, N. Y., and others in Rochester, Little Falls, Pleasant Valley and Newburgh, N. Y., and Reading, Pa., with print works at Wappinger’s Falls and Haverstraw, N. Y.

Name: WILLIAM H. GEBHARD.
Description: Importations of foreign liquors and wines. Has numerous investments, including about a million of real estate. Director in the Equitable Gaslight Company.

Name: FREDERICK GEBHARD.
Description: Inherited. Made in importing liquors and in real estate.

Name: LADY GORDON-CUMMING (Florence Garner).
Description: From Thomas Garner, through his son, William T. Garner her father. Made in manufacturing cotton goods.

Name: MAYER GOLDSMITH.
Description: Exportation of cattle.

Name: R. SUYDAM GRANT.
Description: Banking, railroads and investments. Director in the Delaware and Hudson Canal Company. President of the Adirondack Railway. In other companies.

Name: WILLIAM GRAY.
Description: Made in dealing in sulphur.

Name: MRS. JOHN C. GRAY (Grace Townsend-Turnbull).
Description: Inherited from the Townsend family, of Newport.

Name: JOHN GARCIA.
Description: General commission merchandising. Had a large estate in Spain.

Name: FREDERIC E. GIBERT.
Description: Inherited from his father, a merchant, and invested by him in real estate, storehouses, etc.

Name: DR. NORVIN GREEN.
Description: Made in telegraph lines and investments. President of the Western Union Telegraph Company, Gold and Stock Telegraph Company and International Ocean Telegraph Company. Director in the Southern Bell Telephone and Telegraph Company, Dives Pelican Mining Company, American Speaking Telephone Company, Mercantile Trust Company, etc.

Name: MRS. HETTY GREEN.
Description: One of the wealthiest women in the world. She inherited several millions from her father, Edward Mott Robinson, of New-York, and her aunt, Sylvia Ann Howland, of New-Bedford. The principal part of the money inherited by her was made in whaling, shipping, foreign trade, etc., and she has increased her fortune greatly by shrewd investments. She is a keen and sharp business woman. Has several millions of real estate in Chicago.

Name: JAMES LORIMER GRAHAM.
Description: President of the Metropolitan Insurance Company, and investor.

Name: JAMES W. GERARD.
Description: Law practice and investments in real estate and various business enterprises. He had an interest in the Vermont Central Railroad and the Boston Sugar Refinery.

Name: ECCLES GILLENDER.
Description: Made in tobacco manufacturing.

Name: JOHN GREENOUGH (of Poor & Greenough).
Description: Made his fortune in banking and railroads. Has extensive interests all over the country, and is president of several investment companies in London, which invest their money in this country.

Name: HENRY O. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Partly inherited. All made in sugar refining and investment of accumulations. An owner in the Havemeyer Sugar Refining Company, and the Havemeyers & Elder Sugar Refining Company. Director in the American Sugar Refining Company.

Name: MRS. HENRY O. HAVEMEYER (Maria Louisa Elder).
Description: From her father, Daniel R. Elder. Made in sugar refining with the Havemeyers, and investments.

Name: THEODORE A. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Made in sugar refining with the Havemeyers and Elder. Was a director in the American Sugar Refining Company.

Name: WILLIAM M. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Made in sugar refining with the Havemeyers and Elder.

Name: WILLIAM F. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Partly inherited from Hector C. Havemeyer. All made in sugar refining and investments.

Name: THOMAS J. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, Frederick C. Havemeyer. All made in sugar refining and investments.

Name: FREDERIC C. HAVEMEYER.
Description: Sugar refining.

Name: LOUIS S. HARGOUS.
Description: Made a fortune in banking in Mexico and subsequently in investments in New-York City.

Name: JOHN H. HEWSON (of Hewson & White).
Description: Private banking and investments.

Name: HENRY HART.
Description: Local street railroads, stocks, real estate and various other investments. Director in the Third Avenue Railroad and Pacific Mail Steamship Company.

Name: ANSON W. HARD (of Hard & Rand).
Description: Importing coffee. Director in the Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company, Bank of New-York, and other concerns.

Name: JOHN H. HALL.
Description: Wholesale paper business at first. Then in elevated railroads in New-York City; southern railroads, and other investments. Was a director in the Georgia Central Railroad; East Tennessee, Virginia and Georgia Railroad; Richmond and Danville Railroad; Knoxville and Ohio Railroad; etc., etc.

Name: REV. CHARLES F. HOFFMAN.
Description: Inherited from his father, Samuel V. Hoffman. Made in real estate, inherited for several generations.

Name: VERY REV. EUGENE A. HOFFMAN.
Description: Inherited from his father, Samuel V. Hoffman. Made in real estate, inherited for several generations.

Name: AARON HERSHFIELD.
Description: First in mercantile business; then in investments in real estate, and building houses.

Name: EUGENE HIGGINS (of E. S. Higgins & Co.).
Description: Inherited several millions from his father, Elias S. Higgins. Made first in merchandising carpets; then in manufacturing them; accompanied by large purchases of real estate, and the investment of accumulations. Eugene Higgins is a member of the old firm, and director in the Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad; Consolidated Gas Company of New-York; Lackawanna and Western Railroad; Liberty Insurance Company, Central National Bank, etc., etc.

Name: RUSSELL H. HOADLEY.
Description: Commission merchandising and trade with South America. He had numerous investments in insurance companies, etc.

Name: JOHN C. HAMILTON.
Description: Inherited from the Alexander Hamilton estate. Real estate chiefly.

Name: WILLIAM HILLS (of Hills Brothers).
Description: Importation of fruits.

Name: HENRY W. HUBBELL.
Description: Made in the China trade and ships to foreign lands.

Name: HENRY HILTON.
Description: Law practice, and inheritance from Alexander T. Stewart, the drygoods merchant. Director in the Merchants’ National Bank.

Name: JAMES HARRIMAN.
Description: Made a fortune in importing drygoods.

Name: J. LOW HARRIMAN.
Description: Importing drygoods.

Name: OLIVER HARRIMAN (of Low, Harriman & Co.).
Description: Commission merchandising and investments. Director in the Illinois Central Railroad; Central Trust Company, Bank of America, Bank for Savings, Mutual Life Insurance Company and other corporations.

Name: WILSON G. HUNT.
Description: Made in merchandising woollens and investment of profits. Director in the United States Trust Company, National Park Bank, Consolidated Gas Company, Eagle Fire Insurance Company; New-York Life Insurance and Trust Company; New-York, New-Haven and Hartford Railroad; Globe Fire Insurance Company, Washington Life Insurance Company; Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad, etc., etc.

Name: JOSEPH W. HARPER (of Harper & Bros.).
Description: Publishing copyrighted books and the “Magazine,” “Weekly,” “Bazar” and “Young People” issued by this great house.

Name: JOSEPH ABNER HARPER (of Harper & Bros.).
Description: Made in the publishing business, as above.

Name: JOHN W. HARPER (of Harper & Bros.).
Description: Made in the publishing business, as above.

Name: JOHN HARPER.
Description: Made in Harper & Bros., publishers.

Name: JOSEPH HENRY HARPER.
Description: Made in the publishing business in the firm of Harper & Bros.

Name: COLLIS P. HUNTINGTON.
Description: A man of very great fortune, amassed chiefly in building and managing the Central Pacific and Southern Pacific railroads. He has large interests in railroads running to the Pacific Ocean and in the South. President of the Southern Pacific Railroad; Chesapeake, Ohio and Southwestern Railroad; Galveston, Harrisburg and San Antonio Railway; Guatemala Central Railroad, and the Mexican International Railroad. Large owner and director in the Pacific Mail Steamship Company; Texas and New-Orleans Railroad Company; United States and Brazil Mail Steamship Company; Central Pacific Railroad Company; Southern Pacific Company; Old Dominion Land Company; Chesapeake Central Railroad; Morgan’s Louisiana and Texas Railroad and Steamship Company; Western Union Telegraph Company; Metropolitan Trust Company; Newport News and Mississippi Valley Company, etc., etc.

Name: PRINCESS HATZFELD.
Description: From her father, Collis P. Huntington.

Name: JOHN E. HOFFMIRE (of John E. Hoffmire & Sons).
Description: Joinery business, river steamboating and street railroads. Has numerous investments. Is in the New-York and Norwalk Steamboat Company.

Name: HIRAM HITCHCOCK (of Hitchcock, Darling & Co.).
Description: Made largely in the Fifth Avenue Hotel. Director in the Nicaragua Canal Company; Garfield National Bank; Garfield Safe Deposit Company; Indianapolis, Decatur and Quincy Railway; Madison Square Garden Company, etc.

Name: BENJAMIN H. HUTTON.
Description: Importing French silks, and large investments in real estate. He had more than $1,000,000 worth of real estate.

Name: WILLIAM S. HAWK.
Description: Made chiefly in the hotel business. Inherited from his father, Samuel Hawk.

Name: CHARLES C. HASTINGS.
Description: Clothing business in San Francisco and real-estate investments here.

Name: MRS. LAURA P. HAZARD (wife of William A. Hazard).
Description: Inherited from Samuel J. Tilden, who made a fortune in law, elevated roads, etc.

Name: WILLIAM H. HALL (of Hall & Ruckel).
Description: Wholesale drugs.

Name: MARCELLUS HARTLEY (of the old firm of Schuyler, Hartley & Graham, now Hartley & Graham).
Description: Has made a fortune in the wholesale jewelry business, and sale of firearms. President of the Remington Arms Company. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society; German-American Bank; Liberty Insurance Company; Lincoln National Bank; United States Electric Lighting Company; Western National Bank; Mercantile Trust Company, etc., etc. President of the Mutual District Telegraph Company and Mutual District Messenger Company.

Name: ALFRED S. HEIDELBACH (of Heidelbach, Ickelheimer & Co.).
Description: Private banking and stocks.

Name: MRS. CLARENCE E. HYDE.
Description: Inherited from B. T. Babbitt, her father. Made in the manufacture of soda, saleratus, potash and soap.

Name: MRS. FREDERICK E. HYDE.
Description: Inherited from her father, B. T. Babbitt. Made in the manufacture of soda, saleratus, potash and soap.

Name: MRS. MATILDA HALLGARTEN.
Description: From her late husband, Julius Hallgarten, of Hallgarten & Co., the Broad-st. brokers.

Name: ALBERT HALLGARTEN.
Description: From his father, Julius Hallgarten. Banking, brokerage and stocks.

Name: DR. FREDERICK HUMPHREYS.
Description: Manufacture of homoeopathic family medicines. President of Humphreys Homeopathic Medicine Company.

Name: EDGAR HENDRICKS (of Hendricks Brothers).
Description: Metal merchandising.

Name: EDMUND HENDRICKS (of Hendricks Bros.).
Description: Metal merchandising.

Name: HARRY B. HOLLINS (of H. B. Hollins & Co.).
Description: Banking and investments. President of the Metropolitan Ferry Company; director in the Knickerbocker Trust Company, etc.

Name: MRS. ANNIE L. HOE.
Description: From her father, David Dows. Made in grain and railroads.

Name: EDWARD HAIGHT.
Description: Made in importing cloth and tailors’ trimmings, and investments in banks, etc.

Name: DAVID HENRY HAIGHT.
Description: Merchandising drygoods and hatters’ supplies, with large investments in real estate. He had over $1,000,000 of real estate in Broadway alone.

Name: ABRAM S. HEWITT (of Cooper, Hewitt & Co.).
Description: Made in the manufacture of iron, isinglass and glue. Director in the Chrysolite Silver Mining Company; Lehigh Coal and Navigation Company; Montana Smelting Company; New-York and Greenwood Lake Railway; American Electric Elevator Company; United Smelting and Refining Company, etc., etc.

Name: Mrs. SARAH AMELIA HEWITT (wife of Abram S. Hewitt).
Description: Inherited from her father, Peter Cooper. Made in manufacturing iron, isinglass and glue.

Name: Mrs. SUSAN HERTZ (wife of Christian A. Hertz, M. D.).
Description: Inherited from her father, David Dows. Made in grain and railroads.

Name: THOMAS V. HITCHCOCK.
Description: Part owner of “The New-York Sun.” Partly inherited, and added to by shrewd investments in real estate, stocks and corporations.

Name: ROBERT HOE (of R. Hoe & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing patented printing presses. Has investments in various corporations. Director in the Metropolitan Trust Company, etc.

Name: MRS. ROBERT HOE (Olivia P. James).
Description: From her father, the London member of the firm of Phelps, Dodge & Co.

Name: Mrs. HELEN MARIA HOYT (widow of Jesse Hoyt).
Description: From her husband, who made a great fortune in the grain and flour commission business, and in investments in pine lands and real estate in Michigan, and in railroads. He bought large tracts of pine in Michigan; and East Saginaw is built on land owned by him. Built hotels, cottages and banks. Was in many Michigan and Minnesota railroads and the Chesapeake and Ohio Railroad.

Name: ALFRED M. HOYT.
Description: In the grain and flour commission business with his brother, Jesse Hoyt, and in banking afterward. Also by inheritance from Jesse Hoyt.

Name: REUBEN HOYT.
Description: From his brother, Jesse Hoyt.

Name: LOUIS T. HOYT.
Description: Made in the stock brokerage business.

Name: WILLIAM HOYT (of Hoyt Brothers).
Description: Tanning and leather business.

Name: EDWARD C. HOYT (of Hoyt Brothers).
Description: Made in tanning and leather.

Name: Mrs. MARY W. HAMILTON (widow of James A. Hamilton).
Description: Inherited from her father, Thomas Suffern, a linen importer and merchant and investor in real estate.

Name: ALVIN HIGGINS.
Description: Made in carpet manufacturing with his brother, E. S. Higgins; and in real estate investments.

Name: JAMES HOOKER HAMERSLEY.
Description: Inherited through his father, John W. Hamersley. Made in real estate.

Name: JACOB HAYS.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, William H. Hays. Made in banking; the Eighth and Ninth Avenue street railroads; gas companies; the People’s Line of steamboats on the Hudson; railroads; the Brooklyn Ferry Company, etc. Jacob is a director in the Consolidated Electric Light Company, Eighth Avenue Railroad; Brooklyn and New-York Ferry; Knickerbocker Trust Company, etc., etc.

Name: E. ST. JOHN HAYS (of E. St. John Hays & Co., bankers and brokers).
Description: Partly inherited from his father, William H. Hays, and made as above. Director in the Eighth Avenue Railroad; engaged in banking and brokerage.

Name: HENRY L. HOGUET.
Description: Banking, brokerage and investments in real estate and securities.

Name: GEORGE G. HAVEN.
Description: Banking and investments. Director in the Bank of New-Amsterdam; Manufacturing Investment Company; Metropolitan Opera House Company; New-York, Providence and Boston Railroad; Providence and Stonington Steamship Company; New-York and Northern Railway; Quicksilver Mining Company, etc., etc.

Name: MRS. GEORGE G. HAVEN.
Description: From her father, John Arnot, of Elmira, the great banker. Made in banking.

Name: EDWARD HEN.
Description: Merchandising tobacco and smokers’ articles; exportation of American goods to the Isthmus, and speculation in Wall Street.

Name: MRS. ANNETTE W. W. HICKS-LORD.
Description: From her late husband, Thomas Lord, who made a fortune in merchandising and real estate.

Name: HENRY A. HURLBUT.
Description: Made a fortune in the manufacture of hats and caps, and investment of profits. Director in the Second National Bank; Fifth Avenue Safe Deposit Company; Mercantile Safe Deposit Company; Mercantile Trust Company; Equitable Life Assurance Society; Fidelity and Casualty Company; Forty-second Street and Grand Street Ferry Railroad; Home Insurance Company, etc., etc.

Name: GEORGE HARDIN.
Description: Importation of linen and merchandising drygoods.

Name: MRS. MARY M. HECKSCHER (wife of John G. Heckscher).
Description: From her father, William R. Travers. Made in Wall Street.

Name: WILLIAM HEGEMAN.
Description: Merchandising drugs.

Name: EDGAR HOLLIDAY (of Read, Holliday & Sons).
Description: In the manufacture of aniline dyes, and in real estate, electric light and other investments. He is president of the company.

Name: CHARLES G. HAVENS.
Description: Inherited a large fortune from his wife.

Name: WILLIAM H. HARBECK.
Description: Has made a large fortune in ships, ocean freighting, staves, etc.

Name: ADRIAN ISELIN.
Description: Made a large fortune in the importation of drygoods, and judicious investment of profits; in banking, etc. Director in Metropolitan Opera House and Manhattan Storage Warehouse Company.

Name: ADRIAN ISELIN, JR. (of A. Iselin & Co.).
Description: Made originally in the importation of drygoods, followed by banking and investments in railroads, etc. Director in the Buffalo, Rochester and Pittsburg Railway, Central Trust Company, Gallatin National Bank, Mobile and Ohio Railroad, Sixth National Bank, Manhattan Storage and Warehouse Company, etc. President of the Metropolitan Improvement Company.

Name: WILLIAM E. ISELIN (of William Iselin & Co.).
Description: Importation of drygoods.

Name: ISAAC ISELIN.
Description: Made in banking, brokerage and stocks.

Name: MRS. C. OLIVER ISELIN.
Description: By inheritance from William T. Garner, her father. Made in cotton manufacturing.

Name: COLUMBUS O’D. ISELIN.
Description: Banking, brokerage and stocks.

Name: RICHARD IRVIN (of Richard Irvin & Co.).
Description: Banking and investments. Director in the Commercial Company ; New York, Ontario and Western Railroad, etc.

Name: WILLIAM B. ISHAM.
Description: Tanning and leather, and investments in stocks.

Name: BRAYTON IVES (of J. B. Metcalf & Co.).
Description: Made in banking and brokerage business. President of the Western National Bank. Director in the Mercantile Trust Company; New-York Stock Exchange Building Company, etc.

Name: SAMUEL INSLEE (of Calhoun, Robbins & Co.).
Description: Merchandising fancy drygoods, and advance in value of real estate.

Name: JOHN H. INMAN (of Inman, Swan & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited from his father, a cotton merchant. Largely increased by himself by his own great business ability, first in the cotton commission business and, after 1884, in railroads. President of the Richmond and Danville Railroad. Director in nearly all the railroads of the South, among them the Louisville and Nashville; East Tennessee, Virginia and Georgia; and Memphis and Charleston. Also director in the American Cotton Oil Company; American Surety Company; Fourth National Bank; Home and Liberty Insurance companies, etc. One of the founders of the Cotton Exchange in New-York City.

Name: ISAAC ICKELHEIMER (of Heidelbach, Ickelheimer & Co.).
Description: Private banking. Director in the Importers and Traders’ National Bank.

Name: Mrs. ADELIA DUANE P. IRELAND (wife of John B. Ireland).
Description: Inherited from the Pell family. Made in real estate.

Name: D. WILLIS JAMES (of Phelps, Dodge & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited from his father, who was the London member of the firm. Added to largely by himself. The fortune has been made in the importation of metals, and investments. Director in the Ansonia Brass and Copper Company, Copper Queen Consolidated Mining Company, United States Trust Company, etc., etc.

Name: JOHN JAY.
Description: Real estate, inherited. President of the Robinson Consolidated Mining Company.

Name: JOHN TAYLOR JOHNSTON.
Description: Merchandising by his father, and railroads by himself. Director in the New-York Life Insurance and Trust Company, Central and New-Jersey Land Improvement Company, Dolphin Manufacturing Company (jute goods), etc., etc.

Name: MRS. LAURA HALL JENNINGS (wife of Frederick B. Jennings).
Description: From her father, Trenor W. Park, who made a fortune, first, in law, then in the Mariposa Mine and real estate in California, then in railroads in Vermont, and in the Panama Railroad, which he sold to the De Lesseps’ Canal Company at a large profit.

Name: MRS. EMMA L. JACOB (wife of Leonard Jacob).
Description: Inherited from her father, J. R. Lawrence. Made in merchandising and real estate.

Name: JOHN D. JONES.
Description: Made in insurance and investments. President of the Atlantic Mutual Insurance Company. Director in the Citizens’ Insurance Company, Manhattan Savings Institution, Equitable Life Assurance Society, etc., etc.

Name: GEORGE JONES.
Description: Publishing “The New-York Times,” and investments in real estate.

Name: MARY S. JONES.
Description: From her brother, John Q. Jones, who was president of the Chemical Bank. Made in banking and railroads.

Name: MASON RENSHAW JONES.
Description: Inherited. Made in banking and real estate.

Name: OLIVER LIVINGSTON JONES.
Description: From Oliver H. Jones. Made in rise in value of real estate.

Name: GEORGE JONES.
Description: Inherited from Joshua Jones, who made a fortune in the Chemical Bank, and in real estate and other investments.

Name: MARY MASON JONES (widow of Isaac Jones).
Description: Inherited from Joshua and Isaac Jones. Made in the Chemical Bank, and investments in real estate and stocks.

Name: JOHN J. JONES.
Description: From David Jones, the brewer. He had breweries in Williamsburg, New-Rochelle, Jersey City and New-York; and large investments in real estate and securities. He was in telegraph and insurance companies, banks, etc.

Name: MARGARET J. JONES.
Description: From David Jones, the brewer.

Name: MRS. MARY MASON JONES.
Description: Largely from her father, John Mason, who owned a great deal of real estate, the rise in value of which made her very wealthy. She left an estate of several millions, Edward Renshaw Jones being her principal heir.

Name: FREDERICK RHINELANDER JONES.
Description: By inheritance from the Rhinelander and Joshua Jones families. Made in real estate, banking and investments.

Name: JOSEPH A. JAMESON.
Description: Merchandising in St. Louis and banking and investments in New-York City.

Name: ERAZM J. JERZMANOWSKI.
Description: Gas making. President of the Equitable Gas Light Company and of the United States Equitable Gas Company.

Name: MORRIS K. JESUP (of John Paton & Co., bankers).
Description: Importation of iron, banking and investments. Director in the Metropolitan Trust Company, New-York, Lake Erie and Western Railroad, etc.

Name: EDWARD S. JAFFRAY (of E. S. Jaffray & Co.).
Description: Importing drygoods, and investments in real estate.

Name: OLIVER B. JENNINGS.
Description: Went to San Francisco in 1849; was there engaged in the wholesale clothing business; retired in 1865 and moved East. He then became interested in the Standard Oil Company and was made a director. The larger part of his fortune has been made in the Standard Oil Company, in the production, transportation and refining of petroleum. Director in the Manhattan Company, the Connecticut National Bank at Bridgeport, Troy Steel and Iron Company, and other corporations.

Name: AUGUSTUS D. JUILLIARD (of A. D. Juilliard & Co.).
Description: Has made a large fortune in wholesale drygoods and manufacturing woollens. Director in the Mutual Life Insurance Company, Bank of America, Central Trust Company, Hanover Fire Insurance Company, etc.

Name: MRS. A. D. JUILLIARD.
Description: From her father, Frederick H. Cossitt, who made a fortune in merchandising and fortunate investments in real estate.

Name: HOWARD L. JOHNSON.
Description: Tobacco merchandising.

Name: WILLIAM M. JOHNSTON (of R. T. Wilson & Co., bankers, of New-York City, and of I. B. English & Co., of Macon, Ga.).
Description: Banking and cotton pressing.

Name: ROBERT JOHNSTON.
Description: Largely inherited from John Johnston (of J. & C. Johnston), to whom his brother, Charles, in the same firm, also left his fortune. All made in merchandising drygoods.

Name: ALGERNON S. JARVIS.
Description: Tobacco inspection business.

Name: JOSIAH JEX.
Description: Made in the shipping business and investments in real estate now very valuable.

Name: HUGH J. JEWETT.
Description: Made in railroads, especially in the Erie, of which he was president.

Name: FREDERICK P. JAMES.
Description: Left an estate of $1,250,000, accumulated in banking and investments in securities and real estate.

Name: EDWARD KING.
Description: Made in financial institutions. He is president of the Union Trust Company. Director in the Manhattan Savings Institution, etc.

Name: EUGENE KELLY (of Eugene Kelly & Co., bankers and brokers).
Description: Began life in the drygoods business in San Francisco. Came East, invested his accumulations in corporations and has operated largely in Wall Street, amassing a fortune of several millions. Director in the American Contracting and Dredging Company, Bank of New-York, Emigrant Industrial Savings Bank, Equitable Gas Light Company, Equitable Life Assurance Society, National Park Bank, Title Guarantee and Trust Company, Atlanta and Charlotte Air Line Railway, etc., etc.

Name: A. GRACIE KING (of James G. King’s Sons).
Description: Private banking and investments. Director in the Metropolitan Trust Company.

Name: JAMES R. KEENE.
Description: Silver mines and speculation in San Francisco, and operations in Wall Street in New-York.

Name: MRS. LOUISA M. KERNOCHAN (widow of John A. Kernochan).
Description: Inherited. She received a fortune from the Lorillard and Marshall families. Partly made in tobacco manufacturing.

Name: MRS. JAMES P. KERNOCHAN.
Description: Inherited from the Lorillard family. Made in tobacco manufacturing.

Name: JOHN STEWART KENNEDY.
Description: Inherited.

Name: WILLIAM M. KINGSLAND (of A. A. C. Kingsland & Sons).
Description: Made a fortune in shipping, merchandise and rise in value of real estate. Director in the Leather Manufacturers’ National Bank.

Name: GEORGE L. KINGSLAND (of A. A. C. Kingsland & Sons).
Description: Inherited from Ambrose C. Kingsland, shipping merchant and large owner of Hudson River and suburban real estate.

Name: WALTER F. KINGSLAND (of A. A. C. Kingsland & Sons).
Description: From Ambrose C. Kingsland. See last above.

Name: MRS. AMBROSE C. KINGSLAND (Catherine Aspinwall).
Description: From her late husband, and also from William H. Aspinwall, her father. Made in shipping and trade, railroads, and real estate and other investments.

Name: GEORGE KEMP.
Description: Manufacturing drugs and Florida water. Special partner in the firm of Lanman & Kemp.

Name: WILLIAM C. KIMBALL.
Description: Inherited a fortune and added to it in Wall Street.

Name: ISAAC C. KENDALL.
Description: Left over $1,000,000 in real estate.

Name: JOHN ALSOP KING (of James G. King’s Sons).
Description: Private banking and investments.

Name: EUGENE KETELTAS.
Description: Rise in value of local real estate, and investments.

Name: HARVEY KENNEDY.
Description: Brokerage business and stock operations, especially in the Delaware, Lackawanna and Western, in which road he was a large owner. He left a fortune of $2,300,000.

Name: JOHN B. KENNEDY.
Description: His fortune was made chiefly in illuminating gas works. President of the Mutual Gas Light Company. He also owned a machine shop, and made Hazleton and other boilers.

Name: RICHARD KELLY.
Description: Made in street railroads in New-York City and banking. President of the Fifth National Bank.

Name: FREDERICK KUEHNE.
Description: Banking and investments.

Name: DAVID KING.
Description: Contracting and building; and real estate investments.

Name: MRS. EVA KIP (wife of Colonel Lawrence Kip).
Description: From her brother, Pierre Lorillard. Made in the tobacco manufacture and real estate.

Name: AUGUSTUS KOUNTZE (of Kountze Bros.).
Description: Private banking and railroads. President of the Boston, Hoosac Tunnel and Western Railway. Director in the National Security and Trust Company, and other enterprises.

Name: LUTHER KOUNTZE (of Kountze Bros., bankers).
Description: Partly by inheritance. The rest in banking and real estate investments.

Name: GUSTAV E. KISSEL (of Kessler & Co.).
Description: Commission merchandising, banking and stocks. Partly inherited from his father, a merchant.

Name: COLONEL DELANCEY KANE.
Description: Inherited through his mother, who was a member of the Astor family. He married Miss Iselin, who also inherited money. Made in real estate and banking chiefly.

Name: ROBERT LENOX KENNEDY.
Description: Made in banking, trust companies, syndicates and corporations.

Name: JOHN H. KEMP (of Kemp, Day & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited. Made in importing tea, sugar and coffee, and in canning provisions.

Name: HENRY A. KERR.
Description: Made in the grocery business and investments.

Name: ABRAHAM KUHN.
Description: First, in the clothing business in Cincinnati. Then a banker in New-York. Founder of the house of Kuhn, Loeb & Co.

Name: EMANUEL LEHMAN (of Lehman Bros.).
Description: Made by buying cotton in the South and exporting it to Europe, and investing in the reorganization of Southern railroads. Now in banking and brokerage business. Director in the Metropolitan Ferry Company; Tenth and Twenty-third sts. Ferry Company; Mercantile National Bank; Alabama Mineral Land Company; Berry-Boice Cattle Company, etc.

Name: MAYER LEHMAN (of Lehman Bros.).
Description: Made in the exportation of cotton; cotton oil; banking, etc. Director in the Hamilton Bank; American Cotton Oil Company, etc.

Name: ARTHUR LEARY.
Description: Inherited. Made the bulk of it in shipping, but some in real estate and banking. Director in the National Park Bank; New-York Mutual Gas Light Company, etc.

Name: HARRISON J. LIBBY (of H. J. Libby & Company).
Description: Commission drygoods.

Name: ADOLPH LADENBURG (of Ladenburg, Thalmann & Company).
Description: Private banking and real estate. Has many investments. Is in the Madison Square Garden Company, etc.

Name: STEPHEN R. LESHER (of Lesher, Whitman & Company).
Description: Importation of tailors’ trimmings.

Name: CHARLES G. LANDON.
Description: Has made a large fortune in the importation of drygoods and investments. Director in the Central Trust Company; Bank of America; Equitable Life Assurance Society; German American Insurance Company; Gutta Percha & Rubber Manufacturing Company; Gold & Stock Telegraph Company; Hanover Fire Insurance Company; Sixth Avenue Railroad Company; Sixth National Bank, etc., etc.

Name: WILLIAM LIBBEY.
Description: Made in wholesale and retail drygoods, as partner of A. T. Stewart. Director in the American Pig Iron Storage & Warrant Company; Colorado Midland Railway; National Bank of Commerce; New-York, Lake Erie and Western Railway, United States Trust Company, etc., etc.

Name: CHARLES LANIER (of Winslow, Lanier & Company).
Description: Private banking and investments. Director in the Central Railroad of New-Jersey; Central Trust Company; Central and South American Telegraph Company; Madison Square Garden Company; National Bank of Commerce; New-York and Long Branch Railroad; West Shore Railroad; Third National Bank; Western Union Telegraph Company, etc., etc.

Name: COUNTESS VON LINDEN (Isabella Andrews).
Description: From her father, Loring Andrews. Made in tanning and leather.

Name: SOLOMON LOEB (of Kuhn, Loeb & Co.).
Description: Banking and rise in real estate.

Name: DAVID LANE.
Description: Merchandising, foreign trade, and investments in banks, insurance companies, etc.

Name: RICHARD LATHERS.
Description: Insurance business chiefly.

Name: LAZARUS LEVY (of L. Levy & Co., stock brokers).
Description: Made in dealing in stocks and in brokerage business, mainly. He started in Memphis, Tenn.

Name: EDWARD V. LOEW.
Description: Banking and financial corporations. President of the Manufacturers and Builders’ Fire Insurance Company. Director in the American Surety Company, Eleventh Ward Bank, Knickerbocker Trust Company, New-York Mutual Savings Loan Association, Seaboard National Bank, Batopilas Mining Company, etc., etc.

Name: LOUIS J. LORILLARD.
Description: Inherited from the Lorillard and Wolfe estates. Made in tobacco manufacturing, hardware merchandising and real estate. Director in the Honduras Commercial Company, etc.

Name: PIERRE LORILLARD.
Description: Inherited a large fortune from the Lorillard family, and increased by himself. Made in tobacco manufacturing.

Name: GEORGE LAW.
Description: Partly from his father, George Law, the builder of High Bridge and of part of the Croton Aqueduct, and part of the Panama Railroad, and added to by himself. Made first in building roads and public works; then in railroading and banking; in part in steam-shipping to California; and finally in street railroads and ferries in New-York City. President of the Eighth and the Ninth Avenue Railroads.

Name: DANIEL LORD.
Description: Inherited from his father in part. Increased by law practice and trusteeship of estates in the Astor family, etc. Director in the Long Island Railroad.

Name: JAMES LOW (Low, Harriman & Co.).
Description: Made a fortune in the drygoods business. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society, Hanover Fire Insurance Company, Safe Deposit Company of New-York, etc.

Name: DAVID C. LYALL (of Buchanan & Lyall).
Description: Importation of tobacco.

Name: WILLIAM LUMMIS.
Description: Banking. Director in the Emigrant Industrial Savings Bank; Rome, Watertown and Ogdensburg Railroad; New-York and New-England Railroad; Washington Trust Company; and Bond and Mortgage Guarantee Co. Vice-president of the Newburgh, Duchess and Connecticut Railroad.

Name: HENRIETTA LENOX.
Description: Inherited from her brother James Lenox. Made in merchandising and investments in real estate by their father, Robert Lenox.

Name: GEORGE GRAHAM LAKE.
Description: Importation of drygoods first; then street railroads and gas companies in various cities.

Name: JOHN H. LUNING.
Description: Inherited a fortune from his father, Nicholas Luning, of San Francisco. Made in loans, real estate and banking.

Name: NATHAN LITTAUER (of Littauer Bros.).
Description: Manufacturing gloves and merchandising fancy drygoods.

Name: JOHN J. LAPHAM (of H. G. Lapham & Co.).
Description: Tanning and merchandising leather. Largely inherited from Henry G. Lapham.

Name: LEWIS H. LAPHAM (of H. G. Lapham & Co.).
Description: Tanning and merchandising leather. Largely inherited from Henry G. Lapham.

Name: JOSEPH F. LOUBAT.
Description: Partly by inheritance from his father, a tea merchant, who invested his accumulations in now valuable real estate. Owns over a million of real estate in New-York City.

Name: THOMAS LEWIS.
Description: Made about $3,000,000 in the manufacture of roofing materials and investments in real estate. He lived quietly, and none knew of his great wealth until after his death.

Name: MRS. GEORGE LEWIS, JR. (Mary Taylor).
Description: Inherited several millions from her father, Moses Taylor, made in importing sugar and in shipping first, but chiefly in railroads, gas, banks and coal investments.

Name: PHINEAS C. LOUNSBURY (ex-Governor of Connecticut).
Description: Law practice, banking, and investments. President of the Merchants’ Exchange Bank here.

Name: BENJAMIN LICHTENSTEIN.
Description: Manufacturing cigarettes and tobacco, and investments in real estate. President of the Consolidated Cigarette Company.

Name: JOHN LAWRENCE.
Description: Partly inherited. Made in drygoods and insurance, and in trusteeship of the Garner estate.

Name: HORATIO IRELAND LAWRENCE.
Description: Partly inherited. Made in drygoods and trading in Michigan lands.

Name: JOHN LAWRENCE.
Description: From his father, J. R. Lawrence. Partly made in rise in real estate.

Name: PRESCOTT LAWRENCE (formerly of Groton, Mass.).
Description: Inherited from Massachusetts relatives. Manufacturing.

Name: MRS. FRANCIS C. LAWRENCE.
Description: From her father, William T. Garner, son of Thomas Garner, the great manufacturer of cotton goods. (See Mrs. Harriet A. Garner.)

Name: CHARLES H. LELAND.
Description: Made originally in the trade with Cuba. Added to in banking. President of the Sixth National Bank. Director in the Union Trust Company, etc.

Name: MRS. WOODBURY LANGDON (Helen Colford Jones).
Description: From her husband, whose fortune was partly inherited from the Astors, and from her father. Made in real estate chiefly.

Name: WOODBURY LANGDON (of Joy, Langdon & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited, but made in part in commission drygoods and investments. Director in the Central National Bank.

Name: WILLIAM H. LEE (of Lee, Tweedy & Co.).
Description: Drygoods. Director in the Fifth Avenue Bank, Hanover Fire Insurance Company, etc.

Name: EDWARD R. LADEW.
Description: Tanning and leather.

Name: JOSEPH H. LADEW.
Description: Tanning and leather.

Name: JOHNSTON LIVINGSTON.
Description: His fortune came originally by inheritance, but has been added to largely by himself, in railroads, express companies and investments in real estate, during a long and active life. Director in the American Express Company, Delaware and Hudson Canal Company, National Express Company, etc.

Name: ROBERT E. LIVINGSTON.
Description: Rise in real estate chiefly.

Name: LEONARD LEWISOHN (of Lewisohn Brothers).
Description: Made by importing, first, ostrich and other feathers, hair, bristles, etc.; then the firm became sales agent for a number of copper companies; president of the Lewisohn Importing and Trading Company.

Name: ADOLPH LEWISOHN (of Lewisohn Brothers).
Description: Importation of metals.

Name: PHILIP LEWISOHN (of Lewisohn Brothers).
Description: Importation of metals. A member also of the Lewisohn Importing and Trading Company.

Name: EDWARD LIVINGSTON.
Description: Inherited. Made chiefly in real estate. He is a very large owner of this class of property.

Name: JOSEPH MILBANK.
Description: Inherited about $2,000,000 from his father, Jeremiah Milbank, who made a large fortune, first in groceries, then in banking, a share in Borden’s condensed-milk factories, and railroads. Joseph Milbank is a director in the Chicago, Milwaukee and St. Paul Railway, and one of its largest owners ; Hamilton Bank ; Quicksilver Mining Company ; Borden's Condensed Milk Company, etc.

Name: MRS. ELIZABETH L. MILBANK.
Description: From her husband, Jeremiah Milbank. Made as above explained.

Name: WARNER MILLER.
Description: Made in manufacturing printing paper and wood pulp. Interested in the Hudson River Paper and Pulp Company, and the Herkimer Paper Company. President now of the Nicaragua Canal Construction Company. Director in the Nicaragua Canal Company; New-York Mutual Savings and Loan Association, etc.

Name: WILLIAM J. MERRALL (of Acker, Merrall & Condit).
Description: Made in wholesale and retail groceries. Now the principal owner in the firm.

Name: Mrs. CAROLINE L. MACY.
Description: From her husband, Josiah Macy. Made in producing, refining and transporting petroleum oil, in the Standard Oil Company.

Name: WILLIAM A. MACY.
Description: Made in banking, Hoboken Ferry Company, etc.

Name: WILLIAM H. MACY.
Description: Ship-owning, whaling and banking. He was president of the Seamen’s Savings Bank.

Name: Dr. WILLIAM H. MUNN.
Description: Made in the Chemical Bank.

Name: ROBERT McCOSKEY.
Description: Made in the Chemical Bank.

Name: ROBERT MACLAY.
Description: Made in the enormous business of the Knickerbocker Ice Company, of which he is president.

Name: LEWIS MAY.
Description: Brokerage business and investments. In street railroads, etc. Director in the Mutual Life Insurance Company; Continental Construction and Improvement Company; Harney Peak Tin Mining, Milling and Manufacturing Company, etc.

Name: COURTLANDT D. MOSS (of Lawrence, Taylor & Co.).
Description: Commission dry-goods, and investments in a number of corporations.

Name: CHRISTOPHER MOLLER.
Description: Sugar refining.

Name: ALONZO C. MONSON.
Description: Long Island real estate.

Name: HENRY G. MARQUAND.
Description: Wholesale jewelry and importing, and investments in real estate and stocks. Director in the Mercantile Trust Company; Missouri Pacific Railroad; American Fire Insurance Company; Equitable Life Assurance Society; Metropolitan Opera House Company, etc.

Name: SETH M. MILLIKEN (of Deering, Milliken & Co.).
Description: Started in a country store in Maine; then engaged in commission dry-goods in Boston; finally, in the same business in New-York City. Has a large interest in woollen and cotton factories in New-England. Director in the Mercantile National Bank, etc.

Name: DUCHESS OF MARLBOROUGH.
Description: From her first husband, Louis C. Hamersley, who inherited from his father, Gordon Hamersley, a great fortune, made in the advance in value of real estate here.

Name: JOHN G. MOORE (of Moore & Schley, one of the largest banking firms in Wall Street).
Description: Made money in contracting, especially in building the Mutual Union Telegraph Company, which he sold to the Western Union Telegraph Company; and in Southern railroads. Director in the East Tennessee, Virginia and Georgia Railroad; Knoxville and Ohio Railroad; Lake Erie and Western Railroad; Western Union Telegraph Company; New-York Mutual Telegraph Company; Chase National Bank; International Bank Note Company, etc., etc.

Name: D. O. MILLS.
Description: Banker, from the age of 18; first in partnership with his cousin in Buffalo; then in California, whither he went in 1849. Added to his profits by investments in mines, railways and real estate.

Name: JOHN J. MORRIS.
Description: Merchandising, groceries and investments in real estate. Was in the Globe Fire Insurance Company.

Name: JOHN MEEKS.
Description: Rise in value of city and suburban real estate.

Name: JOSEPH W. MEEKS.
Description: Rise in value of city and suburban real estate.

Name: MRS. MARY ELY MILLER (wife of Charles Addison Miller).
Description: From her father, David J. Ely, coffee importer.

Name: JOHN W. MITCHELL.
Description: Investments in real estate.

Name: NATHANIEL MCCREADY.
Description: Coasting shipping and commission. Was in the Old Dominion steamship Company, etc.

Name: J. PIERPONT MORGAN (of Drexel, Morgan & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited from J. S. Morgan. Made in private banking and investments in railroads, etc. Director in the Central Trust Company, Manhattan Elevated Railway Company, Mexican Telegraph Company, New-York Central and Hudson River Railroad Company, New-York, Providence and Boston Railroad, West Shore Railroad, Western Union Telegraph Company, National Bank of Commerce, Central and South American Telegraph Company, Madison Square Garden Company, Manufacturing Investment Company, etc.

Name: GEORGE A. MORRISON.
Description: Merchandising, linen and investments. Is in the American Cotton Oil Company.

Name: EX-JUDGE JOHN H. McCANN.
Description: Speculation in real estate and law practice. Had an estate in Ireland also.

Name: CHARLES M. McGHEE.
Description: Before the war a large land and slave owner in the South. After the war he went into railroad development in the South, in company with Richard T. Wilson and others, and reorganized and built up many Southern roads. Director in the East Tennessee, Virginia and Georgia Railroad, Knoxville and Ohio Railroad, Memphis and Charleston Railroad, Texas and Pacific Railroad, Cincinnati, Jackson and Mackinaw Railroad, Western Union Beef Company, etc.

Name: GEORGE C. MAGOUN (of the old firm of Kidder, Peabody & Co., bankers).
Description: Private banking and sugar refining. Director in the Chicago, Milwaukee and St. Paul Railroad, Equitable Life Assurance Society, Union Trust Company, Colorado Midland Railway, American Sugar Refining Company, Don Enrique Mining Company, etc.

Name: JOHN L. MACAULAY.
Description: Cotton Exchange business, cotton oil, Housatonic Railroad, Nicaragua Canal Company, etc.

Name: EDWARD A. MORRISON.
Description: In the business of importing laces, ribbons, etc., for over thirty years; and in large real estate investments.

Name: PETER MARIE.
Description: Banking in the vicinity of Wall Street; large negotiations in Government bonds, for the United States Government; and investments. He was a large owner of railroad securities.

Name: RALPH MEAD, SR.
Description: Railroad building and similar enterprises.

Name: MRS. ELIZA HALL McCULLOUGH (wife of General John G. McCullough).
Description: From her father, Trenor W. Park, who made a fortune in law, the Mariposa mine, real estate and railroads in California; then in railroads in Vermont, then in the Panama Railroad and sale of the same to the De Lesseps Canal Company.

Name: MISS E. T. MINTURN.
Description: Inherited. Made in shipping, ocean trade, banking, and investments.

Name: MRS. ROBERT B. MINTURN (Susanna Shaw).
Description: Inherited from her husband, who left his whole fortune to her. Made in shipping and ocean trade.

Name: ROBERT S. MINTURN.
Description: Inherited. Made in shipping and ocean trade.

Name: MRS. JOHN W. MINTURN (Louisa Aspinwall).
Description: Inherited in part from her father, William H. Aspinwall, and in part from her husband, of whose entire estate she has the income. All made in shipping, ocean trade, railroads and investments.

Name: JOHN C. MINTURN.
Description: Made in shipping and ocean trade.

Name: MARCHIONESS DE MORES (Medora Marie Hoffman).
Description: From her father, J. Hoffman, the banker.

Name: DAVID H. McALPIN (of D. H. McAlpin & Co.).
Description: Manufacturing tobacco, real estate (of which he has an enormous quantity), and investments. Director in Home Insurance Company, Manhattan Life Insurance Company, National Bank of the Republic, Rutgers Fire Insurance Company, Union Trust Company, etc.

Name: COLONEL EDWIN A. McALPIN (of D. H. McAlpin & Co.).
Description: Made in tobacco manufacturing and real estate. Director in Sixth National Bank, Hygeia Sparkling Distilled Water Company, State Trust Company, etc.

Name: LEVI P. MORTON (of Morton, Bliss & Co.).
Description: Made his start in a country store in New-England, then engaged in the drygoods business in Boston, then in New-York in importing and jobbing drygoods, and then in banking. Director in the Equitable Life Assurance Society, Washington Life Assurance Company, Home Insurance Company and other corporations.

Name: THEODORE W. MYERS (of Theodore W. Myers & Co.).
Description: Private banking, stocks and investments.

Name: JAMES McCREERY.
Description: Made in his large wholesale and retail drygoods store. Is in the Liberty Insurance Company, etc.

Name: GEORGE MUNRO.
Description: Publishing story papers and books.

Name: JORDAN L. MOTT (of the Jordan L. Mott Iron-works).
Description: Partly inherited from his father, Jordan L. Mott, who was the first man to make a stove in which anthracite coal could be burned. Added to by himself in the same business, namely the manufacture of coal stoves and ornamental iron ware. Interested in the North American Iron Works. Director in the Forty-second Street and Grand Street Railway Company, Central Gaslight Company, Drexel Manufacturing Company, oils; North New-York Lighting Company and owner of a large quantity of real estate.

Name: DR. VALENTINE MOTT.
Description: Made in the practice of medicine and rise in value of real estate, of which he owned a large quantity.

Name: HOPPER STRIKER MOTT.
Description: His large fortune originated in the rise in value of the old “Hopper farm,” which has been in the family since 1642 and extended from near Fifth-ave. to the Hudson River and across to the uplands on the Jersey side. From his uncle, Jordan Mott.

Name: EDWIN D. MORGAN, Jr.
Description: From his uncle, Edwin D. Morgan, nearly the whole of whose great fortune he inherited. Made in importing tea, coffee, and sugar, first; then in negotiation of public bonds, and, finally, in general banking.

Name: GEORGE D. MORGAN (of E. D. Morgan & Co.).
Description: Importing tea, coffee, and sugar; negotiation of bonds; and banking.

Name: MARY JANE MORGAN.
Description: From her husband, Charles Morgan, the founder of Morgan’s fleet of coasting steamers and Morgan’s Louisiana and Texas railroads.

Name: MRS. ANGELICA L. H. MORGAN (widow of William D. Morgan).
Description: From her husband. Made in sail and steam coasting vessels; Louisiana and Texas railroads; banks, etc.

Name: RICHARD J. MORGAN.
Description: From Charles Morgan. Made in sail and steam coasting vessels and Louisiana and Texas railroads.

Name: ROLAND G. MITCHELL.
Description: Partly inherited from his father, Jethro, who was one of the largest ship owners in the United States. The son was in insurance in Cincinnati; then came to New-York, and married Cornelia Park, daughter of the founder of Grinnell, Minturn & Co. He invested in a patent for stearic acid and glycerine, and manufactured those articles and candles for many years.

Name: WILLIAM MOIR.
Description: Made in the jewelry business.

Name: MRS. WILLIAM MOIR.
Description: From her sister, Mary Jane Morgan, widow of Charles Morgan, who was the founder of Morgan’s steamship lines and Morgan’s Louisiana and Texas railroads.

Name: FRANCIS O. MATTHIESSEN.
Description: Made in sugar refining in the F. O. Matthiessen & Wiechers Sugar Refining Company. Director in the American Sugar Refining Company; Western National Bank.

Name: RICHARD MORTIMER.
Description: Inherited from Richard Mortimer, who made a fortune in importing merchandise and in real estate investments.

Name: STANLEY MORTIMER.
Description: Inherited from Richard Mortimer, who made a fortune in importing merchandise and in real estate investments.

Name: WILLIAM YATES MORTIMER.
Description: Inherited from Richard Mortimer, who made a fortune in importing merchandise and in real estate investments.

Name: MRS. JOSEPHINE MAY (widow of Charles A. May).
Description: From her father, George Law, who made a fortune in building public works; banking; ocean transportation; railroads; street railroads and ferries, etc.

Name: NEWBOLD MORRIS.
Description: Inherited. Made in importing metals and rise in real estate.

Name: HENRY R. MALLORY (of C. H. Mallory & Co.).
Description: Inherited in part from Charles Mallory. Made in ship building at Mystic, Conn., and in sailing vessels and steam lines down the coast and to the West Indies.

Name: CHARLES H. MALLORY (of C. H. Mallory & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited from Charles Mallory. Made in ship building and vessels in the coasting and West India trades.

Name: ROBERT MALLORY (of C. H. Mallory & Co.).
Description: Partly inherited from Charles Mallory. Made in ship building and vessels in the coasting and West India trades.

Name: GOUVERNEUR MORRIS.
Description: Railroad building; railroads; and real estate. Inherited some property from the Morris family.

Name: JOHN P. MOORE.
Description: Made in the sale of guns and revolvers.

Name: KENNETH M. MURCHISON (of Murchison & Co.).
Description: Cotton commission business.

Name: GIOVANNI P. MOROSINI.
Description: Stocks and speculation.

Name: MRS. BRADLEY MARTIN.
Description: Inherited from her father, Isaac Sherman, manufacturer of stoves on a large scale, and large investor in the best classes of securities.

Name: WILLIAM DE FOREST MANICE.
Description: Inherited. Made in rise in value of real estate.

Name: EDWARD S. MANICE.
Description: Made by inheritance of real estate now very valuable.

Name: FREDERICK MEAD (of Frederick Mead & Co.).
Description: Tea importation. Director in the Fourth National Bank, etc.

Name: MRS. JOHN KEMBLE MASON (born Cram).
Description: Rise in real estate.

Name: HENRY MASON.
Description: Inherited. Made in banking, stocks and rise in real estate.

Name: ALEXANDER McCOMB.
Description: Made principally in real estate.

Name: CHARLES D. MATTHEWS.
Description: Merchandising and investments.

Name: MULFORD MARTIN.
Description: Made by large purchases of real estate, which advanced in value, and in storage warehouses on the North and East rivers.

Name: W. B. MOFFAT.
Description: Made in the manufacture of proprietary medicines and pills, and investments in real estate, etc.

Name: H. VICTOR NEWCOMB.
Description: Partly inherited, and made in banking, railroads and speculation.

Name: MRS. BELLE NEILSON.
Description: Inherited from the Gebhard fortune. Made in importing wines, etc.

Name: ADAM NORRIE.
Description: Importation of iron and investments in banks, insurance companies, Western lands, railroads, etc.

Name: JOSEPH NAYLOR.
Description: Importing iron and investments in real estate. He has made a large fortune.

Name: STEWART NEWELL.
Description: Real estate in Texas and coal lands in Pennsylvania.

Name: OF BENJAMIN NATHAN.
Description: Stocks, street railroads and investments.

Name: ECKSTEIN NORTON.
Description: The possessor of a large fortune, made in banking and railroads. Director in the Bank of the State of New-York, Chesapeake, Ohio and Southwestern Railway, Kentucky Central Railway, Louisville and Nashville Railroad, Manhattan Trust Company, and Mechanics’ National Bank, etc., etc.

Name: J. VERNER NASH.
Description: Largely inherited. All made by advance in value of real estate, with other investments.

Name: SAMUEL T. NORSWORTHY.
Description: Made in real estate, of which class of property he had over $2,000,000 worth.

Name: HENRY NEWMAN (of Henry Newman & Co.).
Description: Importation and sale of clothiers’ supplies and trimmings.

Name: MAX NATHAN (of the Nathan Manufacturing Company, manufacturers of patent injectors and lubricators).
Description: Made mainly in royalties on his “injectors,” which are an essential part of every steam engine.

Name: DANIEL O’DAY.
Description: Producing, refining and transporting petroleum oil. Director in the Seaboard National Bank, etc.

Name: WILLIAM O’GORMAN.
Description: Made in advance in value of real estate.

Name: ROBERT M. OLYPHANT.
